loans.name: Daysy

texts.es:
Daysy tiene la edad de 46 años, madre de dos hijos, casada siendo su esposo sastre.
Su profesión es la costura con veinte años en su trabajo que ambos se han  ayudado conociendo el mismo trabajo y han podido unirse para salir adelante, hacen todo tipo de traje, para dama, caballero, niños, reparan ropa que los clientes llevan.
También doña Daysy vende bebidas de coca cola, repostería, jugos, para lograr aumentar su economía, 
Para lograr aumentar de producción de ropa, accedió al financiamiento  ya que requería, de más telas y no contaba con el capital. Lo que ha venido hacer de gran  beneficio por que invirtió también en venta de coca cola.
Con este financiamiento comprara dos rollos de tela sincatex que abarca cincuenta yardas, un rollo de dacron, y otras para lograr hacer sus trajes y vestido y poder vender.
texts.en:
Daysy, 46, is married and has two children. Her husband is a tailor. She has been a dressmaker for 20 years. Since both she and her husband are in the same profession they have been able to help each other and have gotten ahead together. They make all kinds of clothes for women, men and children. They also repair clothing that their customers bring them. Daysy also sells Coca-Cola, pasties and juices to earn extra income. In order to increase clothing production she requested funding because she needed more fabric but lacked funds to purchase it. The funds were a great help; they even made it possible for her to invest in more Coca-Cola. This loan will be used to buy two bolts of Sincatex (a brand of polyester) that will be 50 yards and one bolt of Dacron as well as others to make her suits and dresses to sell.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: She will buy two volts of Sincatex (a brand of polyester) and Dacron as well as other to make more clothes and thus sell more.

loans.name: Lucy

texts.es:
Lucy pertenece al Banco Comunal Proyección.
Lucy es soltera, tiene 52 años y 6 hijos de los cuales 2 estudian, Lucy vende pescados en el terminal pesquero de la ciudad de Ayacucho, actividad que realiza los días sábados, y los días domingos viaja a la ciudad de Andahuaylas. Además Lucy vende jugos de frutas en su casa los días lunes por realizarse una feria de ropa.
Lucy necesita un préstamo de 2500 soles para la compra de pescados.
Los sueños de Lucy son que sus dos ultimas hijas sean profesionales y ampliar su negocio.
texts.en:
Lucy belongs to the Proyección communal bank. Lucy is single, 52 years old and has 6 children. Two of her children are in school. Lucy sells fish in the fish terminal of Ayacucho, an activity that she carries out every Saturday. On Sundays she travels to Andahuaylas. In addition, Lucy sells fruits juices from her home on Mondays for a clothing market she puts on. Lucy needs a loan of 2500 PEN ($900 USD) to purchase fish. Lucy hopes that her youngest two daughters can become professionals, and she hopes to expand her business.

Translated from Spanish by Marni Siegal, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase fish.

loans.name: David Maina

texts.en:
David Maina G. is 29 years old. He is married to Esther Wanjiku and they have one child. David has been distributing water in Naivasha town since 2006. He was introduced to KADET by a friend and this will be his second loan. He paid his first loan well and in good time. He plans to use the loan amount to buy two donkeys and a cart for distributing  water.

In the future, David hopes to diversify and open a shop for selling phones and phone accessories.

loans.use: To buy two donkeys and a cart for distribution of water

loans.name: Fausto Fernando

texts.es:
Fausto Fernando P. G. tiene 30 anos. Es soltero y vive con sus papas  en el cantón de Chillanes en la Provincia Bolívar.

Fausto es socio de la ventanilla rural El Placer de Ser Amigos, que está ubicada a 20 minutos de la parroquia San Jose del Tambo. Son 15 socios en total, que en la mayoridad se dedican al cultivo de cacao o tienen sus propios pequeños negocios.  

Fausto se dedica a la agricultura. Tiene cultivos de cacao, soya, y arroz. Hace las compras de sus productos en Mata de Cacao y las ventas en Matilde Esther cada 15 días. Solicita el crédito para comprar los insumos para el mantenimiento de cacao. Con el apoyo del préstamo podría seguir cultivando el cacao. Su sueno es seguir trabajando y seguir adelante con la familia. 

Le gusta practicar el deporte de Bolly Bol.
texts.en:
Fausto Fernando P. G., 30, is single and lives with his parents in Chillanes canton, Bolívar province.

He is a member of the “EL Placer de Ser Amigos” (The Pleasure of Being Friends) communal bank located twenty minutes from San José del Tambo parish.  It has 15 members who for the most part are cocoa bean farmers or small business owners.

Fausto is a farmer.  He has cocoa bean, soybean and rice crops.  He buys his products in Mata de Cacao and sells them in Matilde Esther every two weeks.

He is asking for funds to buy supplies for his cocoa bean crops.  Support from the loan will help him keep growing cocoa beans.  His dream is to continue working and making progress with his family.

He enjoys playing Volleyball.

loans.use: For crop care.

loans.name: Dorine Atieno

texts.en:
Dorine A., 32 years old, is from Katito area and is married to George. They have seven children who are all school-going between the ages of 12 and two years old.

Dorine has a basketry business that she has been working at for the past six years. Her monthly income comes to Kshs 7,000. She is applying for her second loan from KADET LTD after successfully completing the first one. She is in need of basketry raw materials and thus the need for applying for a loan to enable her to buy them. She hopes to use the profits made to improve her business and also pay school fees for her children.

Her desire is to improve the living standards of her family.

loans.use: Buy raw materials for basketry

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more food items and catering materials

loans.name: Fred Otieno

texts.en:
Fred Otieno is an entrepreneur in Migori, in the western part of Kenya. He is married to Jael Akinyi who sells second-hand clothing in the same town. They have three children who depend on them. 

Fred operates a clothing business where he sells new clothes both male and female. He has had this business for the last six years with great success and makes a monthly income of Kshs 25,000 — a good income in this town where the living standards are not so high. He is taking a first loan of Kshs 20,000 to buy new clothing for sale in this festive season when demand is high. He will use the profits to add more clothing to meet customer demand.

Fred hopes to expand and become a leading clothing wholesale who small-scale traders can buy from.

loans.use: To buy new stock of clothing to sell.

loans.name: Mutua Ikandi

texts.en:
Mutua Ikandi is 54 years old and married to Muli. They have nine dependent children. For the past 10 years, Mutua has run a business buying and reselling chicken and goats after fattening them. Mutua earns 1,400 KES each month and his wife also contributes to the family’s total monthly income through her business.

This is Mutua’s third loan with KADET LTD and he will use it to buy goats and chicken. He has successfully repaid his previous loans. In the future, Mutua hopes to start selling cows to a Nairobi slaughter house in Dagorretti. He also wants to give his children quality education.

loans.use: to buy chicken and goats

loans.name: María Consuelo

texts.es:
María Consuelo es una madre de familia de 48 años de edad que reside junto a su familia en uno de los caseríos que conforman el distrito de Pacora, una zona agrícola de regular movimiento comercial que se encuentra ubicada en la provincia de Lambayeque, aproximadamente a una hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Ella cuenta con una pequeña bodega instalada en su domicilio en donde ofrece a sus clientes diversos productos de uso diario entre productos de primera necesidad y abarrotes. El negocio ya cuenta con cuatro años de antigüedad y durante ese tiempo ella siempre se ha esforzado por brindar a sus clientes productos de calidad y un buen servicio. Gracias a ello actualmente cuenta con una clientela estable y fidelizada. El negocio le sirve para ayudar a su esposo con el sostenimiento de la economía de su familia.

María Consuelo desea adquirir más productos para poder ampliar su negocio y satisfacer la demanda con la que cuenta, por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su objetivo.
texts.en:
María Consuelo is a 48-year-old mother who lives with her family in one of the settlements that make up the district of Pacora, an agricultural zone with steady commercial activity. It is located in the province of Lambayeque, approximately an hour from the city of Chiclayo.

She has a small grocery store in her house where she sells different everyday products to her customers, among basic household goods and groceries. The business is already four years old and during this time, she has always made an effort to provide her customers with good quality products and good service. Thanks to this, she currently has a stable and loyal clientele. The business allows her to help her husband with the family’s needs.

María Consuelo wants to obtain more goods to be able to expand her business and meet the demand that she has. For this reason, she is requesting a loan of 2,000 Peruvian Nuevos Soles (PEN) from Edpyme Alternativa that will help her to achieve her goal.

loans.use: To obtain more goods to be able to expand her business and meet the demand.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Rose is currently in the business of selling beans, cooking oil, onions and "kimbo". She is 42 years old, a widow with one child who goes to school. She took out a loan to stock  more bags of beans, more litres of cooking oil, more sacks of onions, and more kimbo to sell. Rose hopes to expand her business with extra profits in the future.

loans.use: Stock more bags of beans, litres of cooking oil,  sacks of onions, etc.

loans.name: Luz Marina

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “EL MOLINITO II”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Luz Marina; ella tiene 33 años de edad y es conviviente y tiene 2 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de transporte, la socia tiene un carro que maneja su pareja y hace servicio de taxi y ella es ama de casa, la socia quiere mejorar el servicio de taxi. La socia solicita el préstamo para el mantenimiento de su carro.

 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The member belongs to El Molnito II Community Bank. The bank is located in the district of Cusco, in the province of Cusco and department of Cusco.

The member is Luz Marina; she is 33 years old and married with two children. Her daily activities include running a transportation business, she has a car that her husband drives to provide taxi service. She is a housewife. She wants to improve the taxi service. The member is requesting this loan for car maintenance.

The member is happy to get the loan and promises to make her payments on time.

loans.use: Car maintenance

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
This is Victoria P., 52, resident of Caloocan City, Philippines. She has two children. Together with her children, she manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Victoria operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a Php5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. Arlene earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of Php 400 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php 15,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Victoria hopes to be able to expand further soon, just as she hopes to purchase some material needs for herself and her family. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory

loans.name: Alba Luz

texts.es:
ALBA LUZ D. A., ES DE MANAGUA, ELLA TRABAJA DIARIO COMO RECEPCIONISTA, ES MADRE DE FAMILIA DE DOS HIJOS, PERO ESTOS YA NO DEPENDEN DE ELLA.
DOÑA ALBA LUZ ACUDE A LAS OFICINAS DE CEPRODEL PARA SOLICITAR UN NUEVO PRESTAMO PARA EL MEJORAMIENTO DE SU VIVIENDA PARA INVERTIR EN LA COMPRA DE MATERIALES DE CONSTRUCCION COMO: ZINC, PERLINES, PINTURA PARA EL TECHO DE SU CASA DE HABITACION YA QUE ESTE SE ENCUENTRA EN MAL ESTADO.
TODO ESTO PARA EL MEJORAMIENTO DE SU CASA DE HABITCION Y BRINDARLE MEJORES CONDICIONES DE VIDA A SU FAMILIA.
AGRADECE A CEPRODEL POR LOS PRESTAMOS OTORGADOS YA QUE ESTOS HAN SIDO PARA EL MEJORAMIENTO DE SU VIVIENDA.
texts.en:
Alba Luz D. A. is from Managua. She works as a receptionist and she is the mother of two children. They still depend on her. 

Alba Luz approached the offices of Ceprodel (Kiva Field Partner) to request a new loan for the improvement of her house, investing in the purchase of construction materials, such as zinc, steel, and sealant for her house. It is currently in a poor state of repair. The improvement of the house is to provide her family with improved living conditions. 

She is thankful to Ceprodel for the loans granted to her. They have all been used towards the improvement of her house.

loans.use: To purchase construction materials.

loans.name: Angel Segundo

texts.es:
Angel Segundo A. M. tiene 47 años, Es casado vive con la esposa y  con los hijos solteros en  el Cantón Guaranda Provincia de Bolívar. Tiene 5 hijos.

Los miembros de la V.R.C.  GRUPO ENMANUEL se encuentra ubicada en el recinto San Juan  pertenece al Cantón Guaranda, esta ventanilla de 17 miembros se dedica a las labores agrícolas en ciclo corto de siembra maíz, trigo, papas en grandes cantidades y a la cría de animales como chanchos y gallinas.

Angel  se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y a la cría de chanchos y gallinas. Compra sus productos en Comercial Silva cada fin de semana por la comida de los animales y los vende en la feria de los jueves en la Ciudad de Guaranda.

Solicita el crédito para sembrar maíz trigo, papas y  compra de  animales además para insumos de alimentación e insumos para los cultivos.   Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentar desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es tener casa y terreno.

Le gusta bailar en carnaval.
texts.en:
Angel Segundo A. M. is 47 years old.  He is married, and he lives with his wife and his single children in the canton of Guaranda in Bolivar province.  He has 5 children.

The members of the rural communal bank "Grupo Enmanuel" are located in Recinto San Juan, which is part of the canton of Guaranda.  This communal bank has 17 members who work as farmers cultivating short cycle varieties of corn, wheat and potatoes in large quantities; they also raise animals such as pigs and chickens.

Angel is a farmer who cultivates corn and raises pigs and hens.  He buys his animal feed products in the Silva store every weekend, and he sells his products in the Thursday markets that are held in the city of Guaranda.

He requests this loan to cultivate more wheat and potatoes, and to buy animals, feed, and farming supplies.  The support of this loan will help him financially to get the supplies he needs.  He must deal with challenges such as the pests, diseases and weather changes that affect his crops.  His dream is to have his own house and land.

He enjoys dancing at the carnival.

loans.use: to plant more corn, wheat and potatoes and to purchase animals.

loans.name: Kigoyera Marketing Cooperative B - Kyenjojo Group

texts.en:
Peter K. is the leader of the Kigoyera Marketing Cooperative B group in Kyenjojo. He is 45 years old and married with seven children, three of whom are still in school. Peter deals in produce, which includes maize, beans, cassava and so on, from Kigoyera. He works with his wife. He has a well-stocked store and his customers are mostly big grocery owners. 

He is able to make 80,000 Ugandan shillings as weekly income from this business he started two years ago. Before, he had a livestock business from which he accumulated capital in addition to the loan to begin his produce-selling business. His dream is to educate all his children to university as well as to purchase a truck to help in his business. He needs a loan to be able to increase stock in his store.

loans.use: To increase stock of maize, beans and cassava flour in his store

loans.name: Getrude

texts.en: Getrude A. I. makes a living by operating a beauty salon in the Lucky Summer section of Nairobi. She has been in this business for three years and earns about KES. 10,000 a month. She is 29 years old, single and has a child who is 11 years old. This is her first loan from KADET LTD and she plans to use the entire amount to buy more beauty products, including facial creams, hair dyes and perfumes, to sell to her customers. The income she earns from this loan will allow her to pay her child's school fees. In the future, she hopes to expand her business by opening a larger and more modern beauty parlor.

loans.use: to buy beauty products to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Achora

texts.en: Achora S. is currently in a business of selling beans, oil, and charcoal. She is 30 years old, married, and has two children, one of whom attends school.  Achora is requesting a loan, which she will use to stock more beans, oil, and charcoal to sell. She hopes to build a concrete house with extra profits from her business in the future.

loans.use: to stock more beans, oil, and charcoal

loans.name: George

texts.ar: جورج متزوج عمره 62 سنة يعمل في تعهدات البلاط للمنلز والمكاتب والورش له في عمله 20 سنة يحب هذا العمل ويرى انه بحاجة الى دعمه بشكل اكبر فهو يسعى الى تأمين حياة كريمة تضمن له العيش بشكل جيد يريد من خلال طلب قرض من المجموعة الى شراء عدة للمصلحة منشار وعدة يعاني من منافسة قوية ورأس مال ضعيف هذا ما يعيق تطور العمل يطمح بأن يصبح صاحب مؤسسة كبيرة تقوم على بيع المعدات بالمفرق والجملة حتى يؤمن مستقبل جيد لأولاده
texts.en: George is 62 years old and married. He has worked for twenty years providing ceramics for homes, offices, and workshops. He derives great satisfaction from his work, although he struggles against fierce competition and a lack of capitA.. To this end, he wanted to seek a loan from A. Majmoua to purchase a saw and other equipment for his business. Ultimately, George hopes to one day be the proud owner of a large establishment selling appliances both retail and wholesale so that he can secure a good future for his children.

loans.use: to purchase a saw and other equipment for his ceramics business.

loans.name: Charo

texts.es:
Charo nació en el distrito de Coya y tiene 33 años edad. (Coya se encuentra a 10 minutos de la ciudad del Calca). Actualmente, ella vive en la ciudad donde nació y tiene su pareja y fruto de esta relación tiene dos hijos. (La ciudad de Coya caracteriza por tener hermosos paisajes por ser una zona turística, ganadera y agrícola). Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Clorinda Matto de Turner” de la Asociación Arariwa y las reuniones son cada treinta días en las oficinas de la ciudad de Calca. 

En la reunión del banco comunal conocimos a la Señora Charo que nos cuenta que tiene una pequeña tienda de abarrotes en la ciudad de Coya. Ya son 7 meses que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que realiza en su trabajo. Ella en esta oportunidad accede al crédito para comprar mercadería así poder surtir y abastecer su tienda. Con este préstamo de USD 500 dólares aumentara el capital del negocio, comprará sacos de arroz y azúcar, tarros de leche y otras cosas más. 

Charo es una mujer luchadora y su sueño es hacer crecer su negocio. Está muy agradecida con el Movimiento Asociación Arariwa por ayudar a mujeres como ella a tener oportunidades de poder hacer realidad sus sueños.
texts.en:
Charo was born in Coya district and is 33 years old (Coya is 10 minutes from the city of Calca).  Currently, Charo lives in the city where she was born.  She lives with her partner and has two children.  The city of Coya is noted for its beautiful landscape and for the fact that it is a tourist area where people raise livestock and farm.  Charo is a member of Asociación Arariwa's "Clorinda Matto de Turner" community bank whose meetings take place every thirty days, in our offices in the city of Calca.

We met Charo during a community bank meeting.  She told us that she has a small grocery store in the city of Coya.  She has been in this business for seven months and it is going very well thanks to the effort that she puts into her work.  On this occasion, she is requesting a loan to buy merchandise with which to stock her store.  She will use this loan for $500 US dollars to increase her business capital.  She will buy sacks of rice and sugar, jars of milk and other products.

Charo is a hard-working woman and her dream is to grow her business.  She is very grateful to Asociación Arariwa for helping women like her to have the opportunity to make their dreams come true.

loans.use: to buy sacks of rice and sugar, jars of milk and other products

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
Lilia, a 45-year-old married mother of one child, works hard to provide for her family. She has been operating a sari-sari store for five years in the Philippines and also earns an income from selling Avon products. Lilia has borrowed and repaid two loans from NWTF and has now requested a PHP 10000 loan to buy more items to sell in her sari-sari store such as shampoo, groceries, etc.

Lilia aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her child to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell in her sari-sari store

loans.name: Lennox

texts.en:
Lennox is a single man who lives in a rental house that has electricity but not piped water. His greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past four years, he has operated a shoe-selling business, selling in a shop and from home to his neighbors and passersby. He faces a major challenge of high transportation costs from other shoes sellers in the market. Lennox dreams of establishing a wholesale shop in the future. 

With the KES 20,000 he wants to purchase shoe soles and leather materials for sale. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: to purchase shoe soles and leather materials for sale

loans.name: Benkadi  7 Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Benkadi  7  est constitué de femmes mariées du village de DIGAN dans la sous préfecture de OUELESSEBOUGOU, région de KOULIKORO (deuxième  région administrative de la république du Mali). Elles  vivent dans des familles traditionnelles, ont en moyenne 45  ans, 4 enfants et  cultivent de l’arachide, du gombo, du dah etc.   
Dans le souci de rentabiliser leurs exploitations agricoles, les membres du groupe ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso  et  sont à leur  cinquième  prêt  de campagne.
SALI, qui est la deuxième assise à gauche,  compte utiliser son  prêt pour acheter, une quantité suffisante de semences d’arachide, des petits matériels et des intrants agricoles,  au grand marché de OUELESSEBOUGOU. Après l’hivernage, les récoltes sont stockées pendant un certain  temps pour qu’elles aient de la valeur avant d’être vendues  au grand marché de OUELESSEBOUGOU, BAMAKO et  dans les  marchés  environnants, en détail, souvent en gros, au comptant  à une clientèle venant généralement des grandes villes.
Les membres du groupe comptent réaliser chacune, après l’écoulement de leurs produits agricoles, un bénéfice de 10.000 à 20.000 FCFA qui sera utilisé pour le remboursement des intérêts du prêt et les dépenses courantes de la famille.
texts.en:
The Benkadi 7 group is made up of married women from the village of Digan in the sub-prefecture of Ouelessebougou, which lies in Koulikoro (the Republic of Mali's second administrative region). They live in traditional families, average 45 years of age with four children each and grow groundnut, gombo, bissap etc.

With a view to making their farming activities profitable, the group members decided to join Soro Yiriwaso's loan program and are on their fifth farming loan.

Sali, who is sitting second from the left, is planning to use her loan to buy a sufficient amount of groundnut seeds, small materials and farm inputs at the large market in Ouelessebougou. After the rainy season the crops that have been harvested are stocked for a certain amount of time for them to gain value before being sold at the large markets in Ouelessebougou and Bamako as wells as in other surrounding markets, on a retail basis, but often wholesale, for cash, to customers who are mainly from large towns.

The group members expect to make a profit of between 10,000 and 20,000FCFA each once their produce has been sold, and this will be use to repay interest on their loans as well as to cover their families' day-to-day expenses.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs, seeds and small materials

loans.name: Santos María Luz

texts.es: Santos María Luz de cuarenta y seis años de edad vive con su compañero de vida y su hijo. Ella posee una tortillería y últimamente se ha hecho de mucha clientela, ahora su tortillería es la más visitada en la localidad pues las personas la prefieren porque tiene un buen servicio, es muy amable y rápida para despachar a los clientes, además que sus tortillas están  hechas de maíz de calidad y las vende a un buen precio. Santos María Luz quiere ver crecer su negocio y está haciendo su mejor esfuerzo para salir adelante, para ella lo más grande en el mundo es la mujer que lucha por un futuro mejor es por eso que le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar maíz por mayor para seguir elaborando tortillas y satisfacer a las personas que la visitan. Santos María Luz tiene fe que su esfuerzo le dará a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Santos María Luz is 48 years old and lives with her life partner and their son. She has a tortilla business and lately she has gained many customers, so that her tortilla business is now the most-visited in her village. People prefer her business because she provides good service, is very friendly, and tends to her customers quickly. Furthermore, she makes her tortillas from good-quality corn and sells them at a good price.

Santos María Luz would like to see her business grow and is making her best effort to get herself ahead. To her, the greatest thing in the world is a woman who fights for a better future. This is why she has requested a loan through INTEGRAL. The loan will allow her to buy corn wholesale and to continue making tortillas to satisfy the people who visit her business. Santos María Luz has faith that her efforts will giver her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy corn in wholesale quantities

loans.name: Evelia Del Socorro

texts.es: Evelia Del Socorro de 48 años se dedica a la venta de cosméticos.  Ella tiene 2 hijos con los que sueña ver prósperos y productivos y por eso se esmera por lograr una educación de calidad y es precisamente su mayor motivación en el trabajo que desempeña como comerciante. Evelia inició su negocio con capital propio. La competencia de su mercado es muy fuerte y para ella este es su mayor desafío, pero como maneja muy bien sus relaciones con los proveedores, logra precios que traslada a sus clientes, con los cuales los mantiene fieles. Este crédito es para la compra de  cremas, tratamientos, shampoo, lápiz labial, brillos, lápiz de ojos entre otras.
texts.en: Evelia del Socorro, 48, sells cosmetics.  She has 2 children and she dreams of seeing them prosperous and productive and that is why she is making the effort so that they receive a quality education.   This is precisely her main motivation in her work as a businesswoman.  Evelia began her business with her own money.  The competition in this market is very strong and for her this has been the biggest challenge.  However, since she maintains good relations with her suppliers, she has been able to give good prices to her customers, and they are loyal to her.  She will use the loan to buy creams, facial treatments, shampoo, lipsticks, nailpolish, eyeliners, etc.

loans.use: To buy creams, facial treatments, shampoo, lipsticks, nailpolish,  eye liners

loans.name: Jenneth

texts.en:
Jenneth is married with 2 children. Jenneth is 28 years old and live in Siloy, Calamba.

Jenneth sells groceries and dry goods to earn a living and has had this business for 5 years. Each month, she earns PHP 10,000 doing this type of work. She has requested a loan for 35000 to purchase more dry goods to sell.
 
Jenneth has been a member of PMPC for 4 years.

loans.use: to purchase more dry goods to earn a living.

loans.name: San Judas Tadeo Group

texts.es:
La Sra. Irma se inicio  en la venta D. cosméticos animada por sus amigas  y también por aportar algo adicional a sus ingresos  aparte D. eso también se dedica a la confección D. prendas D. lana e hilos, las que ofrece entre sus amistades y personas que aprecian su trabajo estos ingresos la ayudan  mucho para apoyar a sus hijos en los estudios, lo que ella mas quisiera es tener su propia tienda D. insumos para tejido  y ofrecer todo tipo D. productos para ese rubro, en esta oportunidad usara su préstamo para comprar  mas lanas y seguir tejiendo las prendas que confecciona aprovechando la demanda por la temporada D. invierno,  también con una parte cubrirá  el pago D. sus pedidos D. belleza para dar facilidades D. pago a sus clientas, el grupo SAN JUDAS TADEO esta formado por 8 socias  todas viven en la misma zona D. los olivos Lima Peru.

* La Sra.Irma es la primera esta con un bolso cruzado.
texts.en:
Señora Irma was inspired by her friends to start selling cosmetics, which also earns her some additional income.  In addition to this, she also works making garments from wool and yarn, which she sells among her friends and people who appreciate her work.  This income helps her greatly in supporting her children in their education.

What she most wants is to have her own store offering weaving supplies, and to offer every type of product for this field.

On this occasion, she will use her loan to buy more wool, and to continue weaving the clothes that she makes according to demand for the winter season.  With a small part, she will also cover the payment of her beauty orders, so as to proviD. payment facility for her customers.

The group SAN JUDAS TADEO is maD. up of eight members.  They all live in the same area of Los Olivos, in Lima, Peru.


* Señora Irma  is the first one in the photo with a bag across her chest.

loans.use: to buy wool and beauty products.

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
Lilia is widow who has a business selling home products in the Philippines. She works hard to support her family and has run her business for the past seven years. 

Lilia  is requesting a 13,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more home products to sell. She would like to save money for the future of her family and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy home products to sell

loans.name: Leonora

texts.en:
Leonora is 47 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has four children.
 
Leonora buys and peddles home products like umbrellas, watches, radios and other items. She has had this business for 10 years. 

She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy stock to sell like umbrellas, watches, radios etc.

Leonora is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, Leonora hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy stock to sell like umbrellas, watches, radios, etc

loans.name: Walter Americo

texts.es:
El señor Walter tiene 53 años de edad, vive con su esposa y dos de sus cuatro hijos.

Desde muy pequeño a don Walter le ha tocado trabajar fuerte, a él le ha gustado dedicarse a la agricultura y el oficio de estructuras metálicas, empezó a  trabajar de ayudante a la edad de 12 años de edad, para aprender el oficio y ya tiene unos 25 años de desempeñar estas actividades.

Él viaja en su pick up a la ciudad recorre unos diez kilómetros, para comprar los materiales y los insumos agrícolas que necesita, para preparar su cultivos de maíz.

Don Walter solicita un préstamo a Fundación Campo, para comprar el abono y herbicidas, para el buen manejo de su cultivo ya que es en este momento, que necesitan los fertilizantes para obtener una buena cosecha.

Con el préstamo él podrá obtener a tiempo los insumos que necesita para preparar el cultivo, ya que en este momento él no cuenta con el dinero suficiente para comprarlos.

De esta forma él podrá obtener más cantidad de sacos de maíz, por lo que venderá más cantidad de maíz y recibirá mayores ingresos, esto lo ocupara para brindarle una mejor alimentación a sus hijos y a su esposa.

Él espera aumentar la producción para el próximo año y lograr que su taller de estructuras metálicas este mÁs fortalecido, para que sus hijos aprendan bien ese oficio y a cultivar la tierra.
texts.en:
Walter is 53, and lives with his wife and two of his four children. Since he was very little, Walter has had to work hard.  He has chosen to work as a  farmer and metalworker. He began to work as a helper at the age of 12, in order to learn the trade, and now has been doing this work for some 25 years.  He travels to the city in his pick-up, travelling some ten kilometers, in order to buy materials, and the agricultural supplies that he needs to prepare his corn crop.

Walter is applying to Fundación Campo for a loan to buy fertilizer and herbicides for good management of his crop, since at this time he needs fertilizers to get a good harvest. 

With the loan he will be able to get the supplies he needs in time to prepare his crop, since just now he doesn't have enough money to buy them. In this way, he will be able to obtain more sacks of corn, sell more corn, and receive greater income. This will enable him to provide more food for his wife and children. 

He hopes to increase his production by next year, and succeed in building up his metalworking shop, so that his children learn this trade well, and learn to cultivate the land.

loans.use: To buy agricultural supplies for growing corn.

loans.name: Phidelice

texts.en:
Phidelice, age 27, describes himself to be God-fearing, hardworking, and social. He operates a a charcoal sales business, selling charcoal to the local people. He has been involved in this business for two years and employs one staff member. His business is located in a residential area in Nairobi. He describes his biggest business challenge to be the rainy season, as he sells the charcoal in open air. 

Phidelice and his wife have a seven-month-old baby.

He will use the Kes 20,000 loan to add a larger stock of charcoal to offer for sale. His business goal is to grow his business and become the major supplier of charcoal within Kibera in Nairobi within five years. 

He hopes that in the future, he will be able to build a residential house for his family.

loans.use: to add a larger stock of charcoal to offer for sale

loans.name: Baryor

texts.en: Baryor is 27 years-old and lives in Jacob Town.  She is married and has four children aged 4 to 15, and they are currently in school and live at home. For three years she has been operating a cook shop (Restaurant) in the local market.  She makes lots of profit and has many customers. She is requesting a loan to purchase more rice, pepper and oil for her business and she hopes to build a house.

loans.use: to purchase more rice, pepper and oil for her business,

loans.name: Perlita

texts.en:
Perlita is a married woman with two children. Perlita is 43 years old, residing at Calamba, Misamis Occidental in the Philippines.

Perlita owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of products such as shampoo, diapers, soaps and many others. She has been in this business for two years. Each month, she earns 3,000 PHP doing this business.

She requested a loan of 4,000 PHP to purchase products to resell. Perlita has been a member of GDMPC for a year. In the future, she wants to expand her store and to enable her children to finish their studies.

loans.use: to purchase products to resell.

loans.name: Evelyn Rosina

texts.es:
Evelyn es socia del Banco Comunal Sarita, tiene 30 años, es madre de 2 hijos, tiene una Botica, esta en Finca desde hace 1 año y medio, con el primer préstamo que sacó compró medicamentos y otros accesorios para su negocio, gracias a la ayuda de Finca pudo abrir en otro lugar otra Botica, le gusta las capacitaciones porque aprendió a socializar con las demás socias, aprendió a valorarse como mujer e invertir bien su dinero. El préstamo que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de medicamentos para sus dos Boticas. 
Su sueño es ser distribuidora de Medicamentos por mayor a otras Boticas.
texts.en:
Evelyn is a member of the Sarita community bank.  She is 30 years old and has two children.  She has a pharmacy.  

She has been working with Finca for a year and a half.  With her first loan, she purchased medicines and other items for her business.  Thanks to the help of Finca, she was able to open a pharmacy in another location.  She likes the trainings because she learned to socialize with the other members, she learned to value herself as a woman, and to invest her money well.  

She is asking for this loan to purchase medicines for her two pharmacies.  Her dream is to become a wholesale medicine distributor to other pharmacies.

loans.use: to purchase medicines for her two pharmacies.

loans.name: Sango Group

texts.en:
Crescent is the facilitator of the Sango group. Crescent and his group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Crescent takes care of five children at home. He joined One Acre Fund to access One Acre Fund’s best prices and to ensure food security for his family. In the recent 2011 season, Crescent had an excellent maize yield harvesting 10 bags on ½ acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund,  Crescent was only able to harvest five bags of maize on ½ acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Crescent and his group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from his maize sales, Crescent will educate his children and repay his loan.

In 2012, the members of Sango group will each plant maize plots between ½ and 1 acre of land.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season

loans.name: Ephram

texts.en:
Ephraim is 31 years old and is married to Damaris, who is a farmer. The couple is blessed with two children. For the past three years, Ephraim has been a mixed-crop farmer and he also works as a taxi operator. He earns 10,000 KES monthly which he uses to support his family. Ephraim was introduced to KADET by an organization staff member.

Ephraim is applying for his first loan with KADET to buy seedlings and fertilizer to plant maize, bean, cabbages, onions, and tomatoes on his farm. With the anticipated profit from his loan he will educate his children. In the future, Ephraim hopes to open a retail shop for his wife.

loans.use: to buy seedlings and fertilizer

loans.name: Vincent

texts.fr:
Client de 49 ans, marie et père de 5 enfants dont tous sont scolarise,ayant deja bénéficie d'un prêt au premier cycle, il a fait des épargnes considérables ,il a rembourse sans difficultés  et avec ses benefices le prêt a beaucoup profite a améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.
Avec ce nouveau prêt, il va renforcer le stock de sa marchandise en ajoutant des cartons de vivres frais comme de la viande, de cotes de porcs,cartons de poules a bouillir et de la charcuterie.
Pour l'avenir est entrain de se battre pour une ouvrir une grande boucherie, ajouter des nouveaux congélateurs et freezer et avec le temps le transformer en chambre froide pour faire la vente en gros.
texts.en:
Vincent, age 49, is married and the father of 5 school-attending children. He obtained his first loan, which enabled him to put a considerable amount of money away.

He repaid his first loan without problems, and used his profits to significantly improve the living standard of his family.

With this new loan, he will bolster his stock by adding boxes of fresh products, such as meat, pork chops, boxes of boiling hens, and charcuteries.

He is currently fighting to open a large butcher shop and add new freezers, in order to turn it over time into a refrigerated storage room so that he can become a wholesaler.

loans.use: to purchase meat, fish, and chicken

loans.name: Samson

texts.en:
Samson is 38 years old, married, and has two children. He does photography so as to earn a living. He has been in the business for thirteen years. He has employed two people in the business. Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has been able to buy equipment for his photo studio.

Samson desires to grow his clientele in the future. He needs a loan of 100,000 Kenya shillings to buy a printer, digital camera, and renovate the business premises.

loans.use: to buy a printer, digital camera, and renovate the business premises.

loans.name: Clemence

texts.en: Clemence is 31 years old. She has 3 children who are between 6 and 10 years old. Clemence has been running a shop for 2 years. With the requested loan, she will buy more items such as rice, sugar, and home products to sell. She plans to use the profits to renovate her house. She would like to own a shop in the future.

loans.use: To buy more rice and sugar to sell.

loans.name: Lyda

texts.en:
Lyda (in the photo), age 37, sells food and Chines noodle and coffee. Her husband, Bunthon, age 35, is assisting his wife in the business. They live on an island of the Mekong River, about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh City and they just have two children-one son who is still young and one daughter who is in school. 

Lyda is asking for a loan of $1,500 to purchase a cow to raise. She will get extra income from selling cow for beef or sale for calf when the cow gives a baby.

loans.use: To purchase cow to raise.

loans.name: Bornface

texts.en: Bornface is aged 40 years, married with five children and lives in Bundibugyo, Uganda. He deals in retail business selling mainly sugar, rice, maize flour ground nuts and cooking oil. He has future prospects of educating his children and building a residential house for the family but is faced with challenges of inadequate capital. For ten years he has worked hard and operates on a busy street in town, he has asked for a loan to buy sugar and rice to sell to customers of his shop.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for resale

loans.name: Peggy

texts.en: Peggy runs a General Store in a community of about 25,000 inhabitants. She has high demand for her retail activity. Peggy has been a long time client of Kraban Support Foundation and has participated in 2 of the 3 training programmes oN the TEACH lending. Though semi-illiterate Peggy now has developed a very strong desire to keep the needed records on her business since \'graduating\' from the BUSINESS DEVELOPMENT TRAINING seminars of KSF. She needs a loan amount of $700 to employ 2 more shop assistants to support her at the shop.

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Nely Margarita

texts.en: Hello, my name is Nely and, for several years my primary activity has been clothing and American shoe sales. My business is located in the city center, and the income I receive is used to cover my family’s expenses and other commitments I have to my suppliers. Currently, I need to stock my store a little more since it is in a strategic location and the volume of sales is greater.

loans.use: Purchase of mixed clothing, children’s clothing, skirts, and American shoes.

loans.name: Evalyne

texts.en:
Evalyne is a single mother of four, all in school. She trained at Joy Medical Centre and afterwards opened a chemist shop where she works to date. She started her business in 2002 when she saw there was an unmet demand for the service in her community. There are only two chemists in the trading centre, hers included, so she has a good number of customers.

Her existing stock right now can be estimated at Kshs. 7,000/= in drugs form. She gets her stock of drugs from Bungoma town. Apart from her business, Evalyne is also a small-scale farmer specializing in planting maize and beans. Through her business, she has been able to educate her children, develop her farm and sustain her family. She has also brought services near to the community. With the proposed loan of $150 from PEMCI, she wishes to increase her stock of drugs and buy fertilizer for her maize farm. We recommend her loan for support by Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Stock her chemist shop and buy fertilizer for her farm

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Comprar mas mercaderia

loans.name: Ana Delia

texts.es:
Ana Delia lives In Monterrey, Nuevo Leon. She is married and has two children (3 & 9 years of age). Her husband works as an independent bricklayer, and doesn't have a steady income or work. In order to help her husband with their family's expenses and to help get ahead, Ana Delia opened up her own business selling clothes. Initially, she sold used clothing and then began incorporating new items. She sells her merchadise in public markets where her customers frequently do business.

The desire to give her children a good education and to have access to a better future is what motivates Ana to grow her business and give better service. She is requesting a loan of $375, which she will use to buy more merchandise and promises to repay the loan in 3 months.

Today you can help those who really need it - please decide to help Ana. She and her family will be sincerely grateful.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Gould, Kiva volunteer.

En Monterrey, Nuevo León vive Ana Delia, está casada y tiene dos hijos, de 3 y 9 años de edad, su esposo trabaja como albañil independiente, por lo que no tiene un salario fijo y en ocasiones el trabajo escasea, para ayudar a su esposo con los gastos de su hogar y salir adelante con su familia Ana Delia inició su propio negocio con la venta de ropa, inició solo vendiendo ropa usada y poco a poco fue incorporando ropa nueva, ella realiza sus ventas en los mercados, donde sus clientes se incrementan continuamente.

El deseo de darle a sus hijos una buena educación y puedan tener acceso a un mejor futuro motiva a Ana a mejorar su servicio y hacer crecer su negocio, por lo que ahora está solicitando un préstamo de $ 375 dólares que empleará en la compra de mercancía, ella se compromete a regresar esta cantidad en 3 meses. Hoy puedes ayudar a quien más lo necesita, decídete a apoyar a Ana, ella y su familia te lo agradecen sinceramente.

loans.use: Loan will be used to buy new merchandise for her business.

loans.name: Georgina Casilla

texts.en: Georgina is a single woman with no children living in San Cristobal in the Dominican Republic.  She sells a variety of home furnishing fabrics, including tablecloths, curtains, and bed sheets.  In addition to being her primary source of income, her craft is something in which she takes tremendous personal enjoyment and pride. Georgina plans on investing in new textiles and cloth with her loan, so she can vary the kinds of products she fashions.

loans.use: Purchase of new fabrics for decorative home furnishings

loans.name: Yem

texts.en:
Mrs. Yem S., 42, is married with three children and lives in Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia. To support the household, she works raising pigs at her home, while her husband works transporting and selling wood to the rest of the province, earning together around $6/day of profit.
Mrs. Yem S. has applied for a loan to purchase more feed for her livestock and the remainder of the money is to buy a cow for her husband which he will use as transportation for his business.

loans.use: To purchase more feeds for her livestock and the remainder of the money is to buy a cow for her husband

loans.name: Milton Antonio

texts.es:
The business that Milton Mejia dedicates himself to is the sale of basic grains in the Mayoreo market. He is a young married man and with one son under his responsibility, this difficult economic situation he has to overcome by selling basic grains at the market with his wife. Since he was very young he has been characterized as being a hard worker, from the moment he decided to create a home he began his work with the most responsibility and consent to care for his nuclear family. The necessity that this young man has to fulfill is the remodeling of his store that from the moment he arrived at the market one year ago he found in a bad condition and it has been transforming very slowly now that he has received small loans from Ceprodel (5 credits) to achieve his dream of having a better store that is in good condition for the clients and to obtain better quantities of basic grains.

Translated from Spanish by Fallon Shields, Kiva Volunteer.

El negocio al que se dedica Milton M. es a la venta de granos básicos en el mercado Mayoreo. Es un joven casado y con un hijo a su responsabilidad, la difícil situación económica que atraviesa junto a su esposa hace que incursione al mercado de la venta de granos básicos en esta localidad.

Desde muy niño se ha caracterizado por ser muy trabajador, sin embargo desde el momento que decide formar un hogar inicia su trabajo con mayor responsabilidad y consiente que debe mantener su núcleo familiar. La necesidad que atraviesa este joven es la remodelación de su local ya que al momento que llegó al mercado hace una año se encontró con un local en malas condiciones por lo que lo ha venido transformando muy lentamente ya que ha realizado pequeños prestamos en Ceprodel (5 créditos) para así ver realizado su sueño de tener un mejor local que preste las condiciones necesarias para los clientes y de igual manera brindar mayores cantidades de granos básicos.

loans.use: Compra de mercadería

loans.name: Aksinia

texts.en: Aksinia D. lives in the village of Resovo near Vratza. She keeps a grocery store the village. Aksinia is married and has two sons. Her husband works as a driver. The grocery store is the only one in the village and has many clients. Now, Aksinia D. needs to enlarge the variety of goods that she offers, so she has applied for this loan.

loans.use: To supply the grocery store

loans.name: Shergiye

texts.en: Shergiye I. is a livestock breeder. She is married, has 5 children, and lives in Azerbaijan, Khachmaz. Shergiye has been actively involved with her family business for the past ten years, and has already successfully repaid one of her loans. She is looking to increase her cattle supplies in order to continue the support she has been giving to her family.

loans.use: To purchase cattle

loans.name: David

texts.es:
The purchase and sale of sheep and cows has always been the work of David and his family. As a young father, he was responsible, along his wife and eight-year-old child, for the future of this business. Not too long ago things were going very well, both with his family and business. Unfortunately his loving wife became ill. This grieved him, but at the same time it gave him strength to continue sacrificing to gain money to cover the costs of his wife's medical bills so that she would recover quickly. David would like to take advantage of the large expanse of property that he inherited from his parents. He hopes to increase his capital in order to invest in his business while at the same time dedicating himself to the growing of vegetables. He promises to give this endeavor his best in order to see his business grow and to ensure his wife's complete recovery. With your kind heart he will realize this wish in short time.

Translated from Spanish by Marco Alves, Kiva Volunteer.

La actividad de compra y venta de ganado ovino y vacuno siempre ha sido la labor de don David y su amada familia, él como padre joven y vigoroso trata de sacar adelante este negocio y a través de el a su pequeña niña Janeth de 8 añitos y a su querida esposa Noemí.Hasta hace poco tiempo todo le iba de maravillas, tanto en el ámbito familiar como en su negocio, desafortunadamente su amada esposa enfermó, este hecho lo acongojó pero al mismo tiempo le dio mayor fortaleza para seguir esforzándose a fin de tratar de reunir dinero para seguir cubriendo los gastos de medicamentos de su esposa para su pronta recuperación.David desea sacar provecho a la gran extensión de propiedades que heredó de sus padres, con ese fin desea aumentar el monto de su capital para invertirlo en su negocio de compra y venta de ganado y al mismo tiempo dedicarse a la producción de vegetales.Así mismo promete poner lo mejor de sí para cumplir su propósito de ver florecer su negocio y ver totalmente recuperada a su amada esposa, con tu buen corazón este anhelo se concretará en un corto tiempo.

loans.use: To invest capital to increase production

loans.name: Leonarda Martha

texts.es:
Leonarda lives in her own home with her young daughter in Ricardo Bustamante Street in the Villa Nuevo Potosi neighborhood of the city of La Paz. Her business is selling fruit on the sidewalk of Buenos Aires Avenue (in the city of La Paz, as well as in the interior of the country, many fruit and vegetable vendors sell their products in stalls located on the sidewalks in the streets of the most populated neighborhoods). She is requesting a loan to increase her capital and purchase a greater variety of fruits to offer her clients. This is the second time Leonarda requests a loan through Kiva. Her prior loan has been paid in full without a problem. Her prior history is good and she qualifies for a new loan.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy M., Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Leonarda vive en casa propia con su hija menor en la calle Ricardo Bustamante de la zona de Villa Nuevo Potosí de la Ciudad de La Paz; la actividad que realiza es la venta de fruta en la acera de la Av. Buenos Aires (en la ciudad de La paz, así como en el interior del país, muchas vendedoras de frutas, hortalizas y otros, venden sus productos en puestos ubicados en las aceras de algunas de las calles de los barrios más populosos). El crédito que solicita es para aumentar su capital y comprar más variedad de frutas para ofrecer a sus clientes conocidos y también a nuevos clientes que caminan por su puesto de ventas. Esta es la segunda vez que Leonarda solicita un préstamo a través de Kiva. El crédito anterior ha sido pagado en su totalidad sin ningún problema. Su antecedente histórico es bueno y califica para obtener un nuevo crédito.

loans.use: Purchase of fruit to attend to her clients.

loans.name: Sharof

texts.en:
U. Sharof is 32 years old. He is married with two children of school age. His wife is a housekeeper and she is taking care of their children. Thus Sharof is the main bread-winner in the family. Sharof’s children are small now, but already today he is working hard to ensure the best future for them.

For more than a year Sharof has been baking the national bread “lepeshka.” He believes that this business is profitable and is not subject to seasonable ups and down. He gets up early to bake the lepeshka and bread so that people have fresh bread on their tables for breakfast.

All materials like the flour, salt, and yeast he purchases at the local market. Now Sharof requests 3400 Somoni (1000 $ US Dollars) for the term of 12 months. The loan shall be spent for purchasing flour and coal for baking the lepeshka. Sharof has already had two loans, and demonstrated himself as an honest client, and he promises to repay the current loan promptly.

loans.use: To purchase flour for baking the national bread “lepeshka”

loans.name: Munavar

texts.en: I. Munavar is 58 years old, married, and has one child. She has been married for 35 years, and her son is married. Munavar’s husband works as an accountant. In order to support her husband, Munavar has been running her own business for the past eight years. She sell national trousers for women, an important article of clothing in Tajikistan. The majority of women wear them, and Munavar is able to sell to them in the central market of Dushanbe city. Munavar would like to expand her customer base and clientele range, and is requesting a loan of $1000. She would use the profits earned from her business to continue to support her family.

loans.use: Purchasing of the new national trousers for women for increasing the range of goods.

loans.name: Hadia's Tusonge Mbele Group

texts.en:
Hadia is 29 years old and married with two children ages 9 and 6. She also takes care of another person who is 82 years old. She has been a clothes seller since 2005. She works from 6:00 a.m. to 10:00 p.m. every day at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $23 from her sales.

In the past, Hadia successfully repaid another loan from BRAC Tanzania to expand her business. She will use this loan to buy more clothes for her business and will share this loan with her subgroup member Asha.

loans.use: To buy more clothes to sell in her business.

loans.name: Sothea

texts.en:
Mr. Sothea V., 22, and his wife, Mrs. Tun Vannak, 28, who live in a small village about fifteen kilometers south of Phnom Penh, married in 2008.

Mr. Sothea is a blacksmith. He does his work near his village. His wife used to be a garment factory worker but now she wants to create her own business selling clothes in a market in Phnom Penh, but she lacks the money to buy an initial supply of clothes. Therefore, Sothea is requesting a loan of US$ 1200 to purchase more clothes for his wife to sell.

loans.use: To purchase clothes for re-sale

loans.name: Yusif

texts.en:
Yusif N. is a 26-year-old man. He is married and is the father of two adorable sons. Yusif has a grocery store which he attends to himself, along with caring for his family and his home. 

Yusif began his small business 6 years ago. The reason for starting the business was to increase his large family's income. His business has been gradually growing ever since.  

In order to grow his business still more, he requests a loan. Yusif is planning to use the loan to buy more goods for re-sale, thus increasing his range of goods. He promises to repay his loan and thanks everybody who decides to support him.

loans.use: To increase inventory

loans.name: Roman

texts.en:
Roman lives with his wife and daughter in Berdyansk, a city on the Sea of Azov. He runs a small business selling sportswear and jackets in the local market for low-income customers. He has been in this business for several years and has been quite successful. Currently, Roman has about $650 of working capital. His monthly net profit amounts to $500.

Roman is a very polite and affable businessman. His kiosk offers a variety of good-quality inventory for reasonable prices and his willingness to make sure that his customer’s needs are met help him stay competitive and maintain repeat clientele. A nice, convenient location for his business also adds to the success of his trade. Roman is requesting a loan of 3000 Grivnas to purchase some additional inventory. High inflation rates produce a negative impact on businesses in Ukraine. This has definitely affected Roman’s business, too. He believes that financial assistance in combination with his hard work and perseverance will help him keep up with competition and contribute much to the successful growth and increased profitability of his business.

Note: this is a short term seasonal loan that will be repaid in two months.

loans.use: Increase his inventory

loans.name: Mrs. Saron Sun Village Bank Group

texts.en:
The Village Bank loan group consists of ten members who live in Phsar village in Kampong Chhnang Province. Mrs. Saron S. is the Village Bank president. She is a 28-year-old bamboo seller. She has a lot of customers and demand is very high, which is why Mrs. Saron S. has decided to ask for a loan to buy more bamboo to re-sell. She hopes to improve her business by providing better service to her customers. Her husband, Mr. Klang Sunheang, is a teacher in the local school. Mrs. Saron S. has two children who are too young to work or study.

This is a group loan with two end-of-term loans and eight monthly payment loans. The end-of-term members are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because they are most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. Such loans allow them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able. Most clients start to make their payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s client make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and a default rate of 0% on Kiva loans.

loans.use: To buy more bamboo to re-sell.

loans.name: Abla Ahoefa

texts.fr:
Cette dame réside dans le quartier d’Agoè, un quartier de Lomé (Togo) où elle exerce son activité génératrice de revenu qi n’est autre que la vente de gravier. Elle exerce ce commerce depuis 2005 et s’approvisionne à AKATA. Cette dame n’a jamais obtenu de crédit de chez WAGES et sollicite donc son premier prêt pour acheter trois (03) bennes de dix (10) roues.
Madame G. divorcée de son époux  et à deux (02) enfants à charge. Ce crédit qu’elle demande lui permettra aussi de pouvoir bien subvenir aux besoins de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Mrs. G. lives in the Agoè neighborhood, a district of Lomé (Togo), where she sells gravel to earn a living. She has been in this business since 2005 and gets her supply from AKATA. She has never received a loan from WAGES and is requesting her first to buy 3 buckets of 10 wheels.

Mrs. G. is divorced from her husband and is raising two children. This loan that she is requesting will also allow her to better support her children and supply what they need.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchasing gravel for re-sale

loans.name: Ut's Group

texts.en:
This small loan is being requested by four borrowers, all of whom live in Ompeul Commune in Siem Reap Province. The group leader, Mrs. Ut N., age 27, makes a living selling groceries in front of her house. She has been selling groceries since 2007 and currently earns approximately US$ 3 each day. She is married and has one child who is still young and is cared for by her. Her husband, aged 45, is a local construction worker.

Recently, N. sold all her groceries to customers at her store and she hopes to increase her grocery inventory to revive her business. Thus she has applied for a loan to purchase a range of groceries to sell.

These are the three other borrowers:

Han T. who sells clothes is a widow, aged 50. She needs a loan to buy additional clothing for sale.

Hiem I., 53, is a widow. She sells porridge out of her home and is requesting a loan to enlarge her business.

Onn ChanT. is 32 years old and makes a living as a motorcycle taxi driver. He needs a loan to replace his old motorcycle.

loans.use: to purchase a range of groceries to sell

loans.name: Eliza

texts.en:
Mambo (Greetings!) from Tanzania! This is 28-year-old Eliza S. from Mbeya. She is married with three children children between the ages of 2 and 9. Additionally, she is responsible for supporting two dependents because they are  orphans. 

Eliza has been running a clothing business since 2002. She purchases clothes from wholesale businesses and sells them at retail. 

She works at the business for 12 hours per day, six days per week and is assisted by four employees. Eliza currently earns about US$200 a month from her business. She is requesting a loan of US$700 to purchase more clothes in bulk for her business. In the future, she plans to open another business. Eliza thanks you for your support!

ABOUT SELFINA:
SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of microleasing is that is allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes in bulk for her business

loans.name: Nasrullo

texts.en:
Nasrullo is a very hard working and responsible entrepreneur. He and his family live in Khujand, Tajikistan. He is married and has three children. Nasrullo works in the central city market selling women’s clothing. His business is characterized by stability and consistent growth. He has been working in the market for two years. Once a month he travels to the neighboring city Istaravshan to purchase new goods. Nasrullo likes to work for himself. His business is the main source of income for his whole family. Today Nasrullo would like to ask for a loan of $800 USD for the term of 12 months to purchase new clothing to sell. We believe Nasrullo’s drive for success will help this young entrepreneur succeed and thrive in business. You can be an important part of the growth of Nasrullo’s business.   


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and it’s famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists, and poets: Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC.  And, even today, Tajikistan is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture, and Central Asian traditions. 

Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. 

IMON's History
Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low-income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing new clothing

loans.name: Marian Danixa

texts.es:
La señora Marian Danixa B. P., tiene 39 años de edad, vive en el distrito de Moche, provincia de Trujillo, departamento de la Libertad, Perú.
Ella estudió primaria completa, tiene 5 hijos los cuales dependen económicamente de ella. 
Marian se dedica a la venta de pollo, cuando inicio con los créditos también se dedica a la venta de pollo pero en menor cantidad,  su negocio esta ubicado en su casa.
Con el primer crédito de 300 soles que recibió de su Banco comunal “Luis Alberto Sánchez II”, lo invirtió en la compra de productos de Omnlife, el cual le ha permitido obtener buenos ingresos.
 Con el crédito de 800 soles, que será cancelado en 4 meses, lo invertirá en la compra de una balanza y una vitrina útiles para el negocio.
Marian Blás tiene como sueño, brindarles bienes a sus hijos y construir su casa.
texts.en:
Marian Danixa B. P. is 39 years old and lives in the Moche district of Trujillo province in the state of La Libertad, Peru. She completed her primary school education and has five children who are financially dependent on her.

Marian's business is selling chicken, and the funding she has received has enabled her to do so in greater quantities. Her business is located in her home.

She is a member of the “Luis Alberto Sánchez II” Community Bank and invested her first loan (for 300 Peruvian nuevos soles) in the purchase of Omnilife products, which resulted in good earnings. She will use the money from this loan (for 800 nuevos soles, to be repaid in four months) to purchase a scale and a display case for her business.

Marian's dream is to be able to provide things for her children and to build a home.

Translated from Spanish by Kris Vickery, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a scale and a display case.

loans.name: Celia

texts.es: Celia tiene exactamente 44 años cumplidos, es casada y tiene dos hijos. Hace 5 años viene trabajando en la venta de pasteles y pizzas en un local alquilado en una zona céntrica de la ciudad de Tarma, convirtiéndose en la pionera de este rubro, lo cual le permite organizar y dirigir a un grupo humano que trabaja con ella. Celia cuenta con un especialista en el preparado y decorado de pasteles y pizzas, cuidando el mínimo detalle en el proceso de la elaboración, con ingredientes de la mejor calidad para la satisfacción de sus clientes, además de dos señoritas encargadas de la venta. Las ganancias de este negocio le permiten pagar mensualmente el alquiler del local y el sueldo de su personal, por ello, Celia está muy feliz y agradecida con Dios y con la institución MFP que le ha permitido avanzar en su negocio, ahora tiene anhelos de poner un negocio similar en la Merced (ciudad cercana a Tarma). Celia comenta que hay muchos momentos amenos en las reuniones de su banco comunal, pero en el momento de efectuar los pagos debe ser serena, este es su 8vo préstamo con MFP, y en todo este tiempo ha demostrado puntualidad. El dinero que ahora solicita es para la compra de insumos e ingredientes de primera calidad, para la elaboración de cada una de sus tortas y pizzas.
texts.en:
Celia is a 44-year-old woman who is married and has two children. She has been selling cakes and pizza for 5 years in a rented office space in downtown Tarma. She has become a pioneer in this field, which allows her to organize and manage a good group of people who work with her. Celia has a specialist on her team who prepares and decorates the cakes and pizzas, paying attention to the smallest details and using the highest-quality ingredients for customer satisfaction. Two young ladies are in charge of selling her baked goods. The profits earned from this business allow her to pay both the monthly rent for her business space and her personnel’s salaries. For this reason, Celia is very happy and gives thanks to God and to MFP for allowing her to move ahead with her business. She now wishes to set up a similar business in La Merced—a city near Tarma. Celia states that she spends many enjoyable moments during her microfinance institute’s meetings, but when she needs to give her payments, she gets serious. This is her 8th loan with MFP, during which time she has demonstrated punctuality. The money that she is now requesting will be used to purchase supplies and high-quality ingredients so that she can make all of her cakes and pizzas.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase ingredients for cakes and pizzas

loans.name: Fatou

texts.fr: Madame Fatou G. est  une femme mariée qui a une moyenne d’âge de 37 ans  et habite  Bayal de Thiès. Elle fait le commerce des parfums et divers marchandises de femmes, elle est à son deuxième prêt et avec ce prêt elle veut diversifier son commerce  c'est-à-dire elle veut acheter des tissus ( thioub , khartoume, chaussures…) pour les revendre. Elle réalise un bénéfice avec lequel  elle rembourse les intérêts de son prêt et compte investir le reste dans son commerce.
texts.en:
Ms. Fatou G. is a married woman who is about 37 years old. She lives Bayal, in Thiès. She does commerce in perfumes and in various women’s merchandise. She is on her second loan, which she wants to use to diversify her business. That is, she wants to buy some fabrics (thioub, khartoume) and shoes to resell them. She earns a profit, with which she repays the interest on the loan. She intends to invest the rest in her business.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cloth and shoes

loans.name: Makhfurat

texts.en: Makhfurat is a hard-working person and, over many years, this has allowed her to earn enough income to support her five children alone. Together with her husband (pictured), Makhfurat is devoted to the raising of animals, especially cows which she buys and sells in her local market. In this manner, she obtains the income that she needs. In order to increase her income and revitalize her business, Makhfurat is requesting a loan of 4300 Somoni for the term of 6 months for purchasing young cattle. This purchase will enable her to increase her sales, to earn more, and to meet the needs of her children. More about Tajikistan and IMON International Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium B.C. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. IMON's History Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase cattle in order to expand the business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase breeding livestock

loans.name: Noemi

texts.en: Noemi D. is from the village of Lumbia, Cagayan De Oro City. She is 55 years old, married, and has five adult children. Noemi owns and operates a tailoring business, providing specialty tailoring services to local community members. She has been engaged in her business for over thirty years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month. In 2009, Noemi joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional fabrics and materials. This loan will be her first from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to finance their farming and to save a portion for future use. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional fabrics and materials

location.town: Lumbia, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: 12 De Febrero Group

texts.es: En el Centro Focal “Alto Lima” se encuentra la Asociación Comunal “12 de febrero”, con 12 integrantes, están juntas casi 3 años liderizadas por su presidenta Maria Elena H.. Todas tienen negocios pequeños, algunos dedicados al sector de servicio como el transporte y ellas necesitan el préstamo para el mantenimiento de su movilidad, otras cuentan con negocios dedicados al área de producción  como la costura de chamarras, polleras (falda) sombreros y necesitan el préstamo para la compra de materia prima como la tela, forro, hilos y cinta y la gran mayoría se dedica  a  negocios de comercialización, como la venta de ropa, comida, tienda y otros y requieren el préstamo para la compra de mercadería.
texts.en:
The "12 de febrero" Communal Association is part of the Alto Lima Focal Center and has twelve members. They have been together almost three years and are led by their president Maria Elena H.. They all have small businesses. Some of these women work in the transportation service industry and need a loan for vehicle maintenance. Other women work in the production industry for goods such as jacket seams, skirts, and hats, and they need the loan to buy the raw materials like cloth, lining, thread, and ribbons. Most of the women run businesses selling clothing, food and other things, and they need the loan to buy merchandise.

Translated from Spanish by Cristina Bejarano, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise and raw material

loans.name: Poch

texts.en: Poch S. is a 41-year-old farmer who lives in Siem Reap Province. Poch S. is married to Mr. Earn, age 42, who works with her in the farming business.
