This couple currently owns a cultivating machine that they use for their farming. In addition, they use their machine to plow a nearby farmer’s farmland for profit. Unfortunately, the machine has often broken down during the plowing process. Because of this problem, Poch S. would like a loan to purchase spare parts in order to replace a part of the cultivating machine. With the loan, this family will be able to continue providing their service to generate income.

loans.use: To purchase spare parts in order to replace a broken part of the cultivating machine.

loans.name: Denise

texts.fr: Denise est née vers 1970 à Aïdjèdo à Cotonou, Capitale Économique de la République du Bénin. Denise est mariée à Donatien, agent de SOGEMA, société de gestion de Dantokpa, grand marché international du Bénin. Denise et son mari ont quatre enfants à charge tous scolarisés dont trois qui sont leurs propres enfants. Denise et sa famille vivent à Cotonou, depuis six ans. Denise supporte les charges de la famille avec son mari. Denise est alphabétisée et vend de friperies de façon ambulante depuis six ans. C’est à Dantokpa que Denise achète ses articles de friperies. Denise est à son quatrième crédit avec ALIDé et rembourse bien ses prêts. Denise sollicite ce prêt pour agrandir son activité.
texts.en:
Denise was born around 1970 in Aïdjèdo in Cotonou, the economic capital of the Republic of Benin. Denise is married to Donatien, an employee of SOGEMA, the trust company of Dantokpa, the grand international market in Benin. Denise and her husband have four children in their care, all of whom are in school, and three of whom are their own. Denise and her family have lived in Cotonou for six years. Denise provides for her family with her husband. Denise is literate and has been selling second-hand clothing door-to-door for six years. It is at Dantokpa that Denise buys her second-hand clothes. Denise is seeking her fourth loan through ALIDÉ (one of Kiva's field partners), and repaid all her previous loans well. Denise is seeking this loan to enlarge her business.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy bales of second-hand clothing

loans.name: Awurade Naye Group

texts.en:
Ophelia is 33 years old she is married and mother with two children. Currently all are schooling in the community where they live. They are very humble family who wants to invest in their children future by providing them with quality education.  She is a petty trader and sells item like cooking oil, spices, pepper, onions. She supplies the onions to the food vendors in bulk. Selling of these products, she says they move very fast and you can easily recover your money to restock. She takes delivery of goods from the capital city of Kumasi. With her six years experienced in her business she wants to add other stuffs like maize, eggs and others which are frequently demanded by her customers. She says she would be grateful for your assistance.

She is the leader of a trust bank group called ‘Awurade Naye’ which means ‘It is the doing of the LORD’. She is the one sitting in the group photograph. Most of the members of this group are petty traders, food vendors etc. In this group, members guarantee for one another as social collateral to access the loan and peer pressure to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy food stuffs like cooking oil, bags of rice spices and tin tomatoes etc.

loans.name: Frida

texts.en:
Frida is a member of the Kichangani borrower group in Kihesa, Iringa. She is 36 year old woman, she is married and a mother of 2 children. Her children are 4 and 3 years  old.

Frida has owned a shop business  for 6 years, she works 12 hours a day and she earns a monthly profit approximately 150,000 Tanzanian shillings.

This is Frida`s first loan from BRAC_Tanzania, she requested the amount of 200,000 Tsh in order to buy more shop commodities fro sale.

With the additional profit she gains from the use of this loan,Frida hopes to save money, Pay school fees and expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more shop commodities

loans.name: Edward

texts.en: Edward is sixty – two years old. He is married and has give birth to seven children, all in school. He lives with his wife and some of her children in a rented apartment in a town called Dormaa in the Brong Ahafo Region of Ghana. Dormaa is a commercial and farming town. Edward is a herbalist. He prepares all kinds of concoctions and from leaves, roots and tree barks. Edward supplies to local drug stores and also treks to nearby communities to sell. He has been in business for over twenty years. He wants a loan to buy herbs and other ingredients in bulk.

loans.use: To buy herb

loans.name: Wainaina

texts.en:
Wainaina is 58 yrs old and is married to Tabitha. They are blessed with three children. He was introduced to Kadet through an existing client. He is applying for his 2nd loan from Kadet. With this loan, Wainaina is planning to increase his stock of clothes and diversify his business by stocking other household items. Wainaina targets youth because they have a taste for new clothes.

He intends to use extra profits to expand his business, and save part of his profits for an emergency or stability fund. His future hope and dream is to open a wholesale store. He describes himself as a hardworking man; prayerful, faithful and honest.

About KADET: 
The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is dedicated to economically empower her clients by providing financial services to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Kenya. KADET is the microfinance subsidiary of World Vision Kenya. Obtain more information on KADET from the website: www.kadet.co.ke

loans.use: To increase stock of clothing for his store and to diversify his goods by selling other household items

loans.name: Ernesto

texts.en:
Ernesto is a tricycle (motorcycle taxi) driver within the village of Sto. Niño,  San Agustin. He is married to Lailanie and they are blessed with four children namely: Glocel, a 17-year-old college undergraduate; Cricon Bryan, a 16-year-old who college student; Napol, a 14-year-old high school student; and Waren Keith, an 11-year-old elementary pupil.

Ernesto would like his children to finish their schooling, thus he strives hard for to earn a bigger income. He wants a Kiva-funded loan to amounting to Php4,000 in order to purchase new sprocket for his passenger motorcycle.  Ernesto says his guiding principles include “being humble and industrious.”

loans.use: To pay for maintenance of a motorcycle taxi.

loans.name: Minet

texts.en:
Minet is 24 years old and married with two children aged 2 and 6. She has a business selling spare parts for motor vehicles. She has been in this business for three years and employs one person. She says business is very good and she hopes to open more outlets in different locations in the future.

Minet has successfully repaid four previous loans through Faulu and has requested this loan of Kes 40,000 to purchase more spare parts. She describes herself as industrious and says that since joining Faulu she changed from selling used-clothing to spare parts, which is more stable. Her dream is to own her own home in Kikuyu Town.

loans.use: To add to her stock of spare parts

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buying manure and expanding his arable land

loans.name: Khiev

texts.en: Khiev R., 30, is a low-income person living in Kompong Tom. To earn a living, Khiev R. built a stall next to her house, in which she raises many pigs to sell. Khiev R. is married and has two school-aged children. Her husband helps deal with the family’s financial situation by working as a salt trader. Besides their businesses, the family cultivated a rice crop during the farming season. Khiev R. needs a loan to buy cow, which she will raise for plowing the farmland or for breeding in the future.

loans.use: To buy cow

loans.name: Elmer

texts.es: Elmer tiene 38 años y cuya familia esta constituida por su esposa y sus tres hijos, y juntos viven en su propia casa. Desde hace 8 años que se dedica a cultivar la alfalfa, papa y maíz, y al cabo de un tiempo luego de la cosecha son comercializados en el mercado de sus ciudad. Diariamente Elmer observa sus plantaciones en desarrollo y crecimiento, y en lo posible cuida de ellas para evitar las infecciones ocasionadas por plagas o enfermedades que puedan afectar sus cosechas. De esto depende para que pueda comercializarlos a buen precio, siendo más rentable la venta de alfalfa. En adelante espera adquirir más extensiones de terreno e intensificar el cultivo de la alfalfa. Este es su tercer crédito con MFP, y manifiesta que trabajar en equipo es una buena opción de desarrollo, por lo que esta muy contento de trabajar con su grupo comunal. Con el crédito que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de sacos de abono para sus próximos cultivos.
texts.en:
Elmer is 38 years old and his family is composed of his wife and their 3 children, They live in their own house. For the last 8 years he has been dedicated to cultivating alfalfa, potatoes and corn. After harvests, he sells his crops in the city market. Daily, Elmer observes his plantings growing and developing, and as much as possible, he cares for them to avoid infections from plagues or illnesses that might affect harvests. This is necessary if he is to sell them at a good price. Alfalfa is his most profitable to sell. In the future he hopes to acquire greater extensions of land and intensify cultivation of alfalfa. This is his 3rd loan with MFP. He says that to work as a team is a good option for development and for this reason, he is very content to work with his communal group. He will invest this loan in purchasing sacks of manure for his next plantings.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: TO BUY MORE MANURE FOR HIS CROPS

loans.name: Noem

texts.en:
Mrs. Noem D., 46 years-old, and her husband, Mr. Davy Srey (pictured together), 44 years-old, live about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh. They have been married since 1983 and have eight children: two sons and six daughters. Two of the children are married and live outside the family home, three assist their mother at work and the other three attend school.

Noem has been selling vegetables for 31 years. She buys it from farmers and resells in KoKi market. She is applying for her first loan of $800 to build a concrete house foundation and restroom for the family's use.

loans.use: To build a concrete house foundation and restroom.

loans.name: Irma Hermelinda

texts.es:
La señora Irma es socia del Banco Comunal “San Pedro” desde hace 2 años, vive en el distrito de Acora, provincia y departamento de Puno, tiene 36 años de edad, es casada y tiene 01 hijo. Ella estudió hasta segundo de primaria, se dedica a la compra y venta de animales menores.

Irma nos cuenta que con el primer préstamo solicitado al Movimiento Manuela Ramos, que fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, pudo incrementar su capital.

Ella solicitará un crédito  de S/. 1,800.00 nuevos soles con el cual podrá comprar ovejas cara negra.

Su sueño para el futuro es aumentar su ganado y tener mas capital.

Lo que mas le gusta de su Banco Comunal es la puntualidad de las socias para cada reunión.
texts.en:
Irma has been a member of the Communal Bank "San Pedro" for two years. She lives in the Acora district, Puno department. She is 36 years old, is married, and has one son. She has a 2nd grade education and currently buys and sells small animals. Irma has told us that with the first loan of PEN 300 she received from Kiva partner Movimiento Manuela Ramos, she was able to increase her working capital. She is now requesting a loan of PEN 1,800 with which she will be able to buy Black Faced sheep. Irma's dream for the future is to increase the number of cattle she owns and to have more working capital. What she likes most about the Communal Bank is how timely all the members are when attending meetings.

Translated from Spanish by Violeta Rubiani, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying Black Faced sheep

loans.name: Mavluda

texts.en:
Mavluda H. is 52 years old and lives with her spouse. She works every day, starting very early in the morning so that she can get ahead and achieve her goal of having her three children successfully enter and finish school. Her business is located in the central market of Dushanbe city and she sells clothes for kids. Thanks to the support of her spouse and her own effort, Mavluda was able to expand her business, which began with little inventory and in a small space and now has a bigger space and a large clientele. With the loan of 5000 Somoni, Mavluda will buy a greater variety of clothing styles, for a variety of occasions, and a few specific requests of her customers. 

Support this woman of much strength and courage to keep working.
 
More about Tajikistan and IMON International
Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History
Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj.

loans.use: To buy new clothing for kids in order to increase her range of goods.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy beauty products.

loans.name: Ofelia

texts.en:
Ofelia H. is a 50 year old, married woman who supports her family as a food vendor.  She also runs a tricycle business.  She lives in Brgy Salong, Kabankalan City, Negros Occidental with her husband Ramil, 40 years old, a tricycle driver.  They have 4 children between the ages of 13-24.  Three of them currently go to school.

She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 1999 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts.  By working hard in her food vending and tricycle business, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of Php 6,000.

Ofelia is now borrowing Php 16,000 so she can repair and maintenance her cycle and to support her food vending business.  This will be her 19th cycle loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon.  Her previous loan of Php 16,000, which she paid off within its term, was just another step in her journey towards economic freedom.  Ofelia aspires to elevate her family’s living conditions and ensure their future well being by following the “Dungganon” way. 
-------------------------------
About NWTF:
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress out of earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: Reapir and maintenance of tricycle and additional capital for food vending.

loans.name: José Daniel

texts.es:
El señor José Daniel T. esta terminando la construcción de un cuarto en la planta alta de la vivienda. 
Solicita un préstamo para poder comprar el material ya que en horario a adicional a su empleo el se encargara de la construcción. Desea que sus hijos tengan ya su propio espacio y privacidad en la casa. 
Don José Daniel trabaja en la vecina ciudad en un restaurante de comida Mexicana, como cocinero, con una parte de este sueldo planea pagar el crédito.
La persona que aparece en la foto es la señora Ana Cecilia González esposa del señor José Daniel T., ya el se encontraba en su trabajo el día de la visita a la vivienda.
texts.en:
José Daniel T. is finishing the construction of a room on the top floor of his house. He is asking for a loan to be able to buy the material. He will do the construction in the hours he is not working for his employer. He wants his children to have their own space and privacy in the house. Don José Daniel works in the neighboring city in a Mexican food restaurant. He is a cook, and he will use part of this salary to pay the loan. The person in the photo is Ana Cecilia González, his wife. José Daniel T. was at work the day of the visit to his house.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Finish building a room on the top floor

loans.name: La Nueva Esperanza Group

texts.es:
“La Nueva Esperanza”, es una alcancía comunal que se encuentra ubicada en la zona de San Gregorio, distrito de Ate, departamento de Lima,  conformado por 10 socios quienes se dedican a labores de servicio, comercio y producción minorista, trabajan con EDAPROSPO – prosperidad desde hace 1 año y 6 meses.
Olga tiene 36 años, es conviviente y tiene 4 hijos, asume actualmente el cargo de presidenta.
Desde hace 12 años se dedica al trabajo de obrera y servicio doméstico, además recientemente se dedica a la venta de cosméticos por catalogo, con el esfuerzo de su labor diaria ha logrado mejorar el nivel de vida de su familia, ha arreglado su vivienda y mejorado la educación de su hijos. El gran sueño de Olga es tener un club de nutricionistas. El reciente préstamo será destinado para comprar mercadería.
Agradecen el financiamiento para sus actividades comerciales y seguirán cumpliendo con sus pagos puntualmente.
texts.en:
The New Hope is a village bank located in the San Gregorio zone of the Ate district of Lima, Peru and is made up of 10 members who work in day labor, sales and retail; they have worked with EDAPROSPO for the past year and a half. Olga, a 36 year old who lives with her partner with whom she has 4 children, is the current president. For the past 12 years, she has worked as a housekeeper and recently began selling cosmetics through a catalogue; due to her hard work, she has been able to improve her family's standard of living. She has repaired her home and improved her children's education. Her dream is to have a nutritionist club. This loan will be used to purchase inventory to sell. The group members are grateful for the loans to finance their businesses and they will continue to fulfill their scheduled payments on time.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Crandall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise to sell

loans.name: Rezyl

texts.en:
Rezyl C. is 24 years old and from the town of Sto. Niño. She is married and has three infant-aged children. To make a living, Rezyl owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector planting rice and selling her harvest. Recently, she also started raising pigs and she hopes to acquire more pigs to raise. One of her goals is to save for her children's education.
In 2008, Rezyl joined Kiva partner, CEVI, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Rezyl is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure and also additional piglets and feed. This loan will be her sixth from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers, such as manure, plus piglets and feed

loans.name: Yan

texts.en: Mrs. Yan P. is 66 years old. She lives in Ta Reab Doun Sa village in Kandal province. She is a widow, and she has a child who is a seamstress in a garment factory. Her position as a fruit seller at her local market allows her to earn some money to support her family. Since her business is going well she wants to expand it. So to improve her business, Mrs. Yan P. is applying for a loan to buy more fruit to resell. She hopes that she can earn some money to increase her business with this loan.

loans.use: To buy more fruit to resell.

loans.name: Batdorj

texts.en:
Batdorj S. is 29 years old and lives with his wife and 3-month-old daughter in the Arhangai province of western Mongolia. He and his family live together in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. His wife is a student and their daughter stays at home. 

Batdorj started a transportation business in 2002 with his father. He is a good driver and that has enabled him to transport more people and goods. His daily revenue ranges between approximately 18,000 and 20,000 Mongolian tugriks (MNT). Batdorj is committed to not only improving the lives of his wife and child, but he also wants to expand his business through opening his own taxi-service center. 

Batdorj is a hardworking and gentle person who says, “I want to provide my customers with fast, safe and reliable service.” He is requesting a 2,500,000 MNT loan in order to buy a newer, more reliable small-size truck so that his business will become even more profitable.

loans.use: To purchase a truck

loans.name: Sheeman Bibi's Group

texts.en:
Sheeman bibi lives in the area of Anwerabad which is in a city called Vehari in Pakistan. She is living in a poor financial condition and that’s why she has to work to support her husband. A very shy lady, Sheeman operates a domestic-sewing business for her neighborhood clients.

Sheeman bibi has applied for a loan from Asasah for her husband who has been involved in the business of scrap for the last six years. With the loan he will buy more scrap material that will enhance his income due to the availability of more stock.

Sheeman bibi has been married for the last fifteen years but she does not have any children. That’s why she operates her sewing business to spend her time.

loans.use: To enable her husband to purchase more scrap for his scrap business

loans.name: Pedro Buenaventura

texts.es:
Pedro de 41 años, vive en la Perimetral de Guayaquil (zona periurbana, a su alrededor tiene el estero salado), el tiene un taller de metales es cerrajero desde que su papa le enseño y también con la ayuda de sus estudios en cerrajería.  

Cuando comenzó a ser cerrajero tuvo que trabajar muy duro para poder tener el taller en su casa, poco a poco compro los materiales y las maquinas, ahora el taller lo tiene en la parte delantera de su casa para mas facilidad. Trabaja solo desde muy temprano hasta el anochecer. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar una maquina soltadora para su negocio, en el futuro quiere terminar de construir su casa.
texts.en:
Pedro, age 41, lives along Guayaquil’s beltway, a periurban area surrounded by a salty estuary. He has a metal shop. He has been a locksmith since his father taught him. His locksmith studies also helped him. When he started to be a locksmith he had to work very hard to be able to have a shop in his house. Little by little he bought the materials and the machines. Now he has his shop in the front part of his house, and it is easier. He works alone from very early until the evening. He wants to use the loan to buy a welding machine for his business. In the future he wants to finish building his house.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Welding machine

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase construction materials like cement, sand and gravel to make improvements to her house

loans.name: Lua

texts.en:
Lua T. N. was born in 1985 and is married with two children who are still young. Her husband is a carpenter.

Not only does Lua T. N. grow rice but she also sells clothes in the market and the couple has a monthly income of about 5,000,000 VND. She has always needed loans to invest her shop so, since 2004, she has participated in SEDA and repaid punctually.

For this loan, Lua T. N. would like to borrow 8,502,000 VND to expand her clothes shop.

loans.use: To expand her clothes shop

loans.name: Maria Raquel

texts.es:
Maria es socia del Banco Comunal Anabella hace 4 años y lo que mas le agrada son las reuniones y los prestamos fáciles.
Maria es casada y tiene 6 hijos de los cuales 5 estudian, Maria tiene una tienda en su casa en donde vende abarrotes en general, verduras, carnes, además Maria tiene cabinas de Internet en el mismo lugar, la administración de estos negocios los realiza sola. Además Maria prepara chocotejas que vende a pedido.
Maria necesita un préstamo de 1750 soles para la compra de arroz, azúcar.
Maria sueña con tener una bodega grande, ser mayorista y tener capital propio.
texts.en:
María has been a member of the Anabella communal bank for 4 years. What she likes best about it are the meetings and the fuss-free loans. She is married and has 6 children, 5 of whom are students. María has a grocery store in her home where she sells assorted groceries, vegetables and meats. In addition, she also has Internet access booths there. She runs both businesses by herself. She also makes "chocotejas" on order [A teja is a candy filled with "manjarblanco" (a sweet, white spread or pastry filling made with milk) and coated with a fondant-like shell. When this shell is made with chocolate, the candy is called chocoteja] María needs a 1750 sol loan to buy rice and sugar. She dreams with having a large store, with being a wholesaler, and with having her own capital.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy rice and sugar.

loans.name: Hun

texts.en: Miss Hun N. was born in 1979 and lives in Prey Khvav village in Takeo province. She owns a general store in local village where she is able to earn a large profit to support her family. Now she has a lot of free time so she wants to start a new business, but she dioes not have enough money to support it. So Miss Hun N. is applying for a loan to buy a cow to breed. With the rest of the loan, she will buy pig food and two piglets to breed. She is single and lives with four household members.

loans.use: To buy a cow for breeding

loans.name: Bulbul

texts.en: Bulbul M. is 41 years old and lives with her husband and two teenage sons in Bayan-Ulgiy province of western Mongolia. She and her family live together in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. Her oldest son, 17, is a student and works and studies in Kazakhstan while her youngest son, 16, attends a local high school. Her husband works in a construction company. Bulbul operates a clothing retail trading business in her town. She used to work as a clothing salesperson where she sold other people's clothes and received a salary. Based on her experience, she started her own business in a rented stall at the Hurd trade center in 2008. She is planning to expand her business and import more clothing items from Erlian, a border city in China. She wants to open her own shop when her business reaches a sustainable level. Her earnings have enabled her to buy a new house after selling her old one. Bulbul is a very modest and hardworking woman and says, " All I want is to continue operating my business with success and provide for my children's education. " She is requesting a 3,000,000 MNT loan in order to purchase more clothes from China which she can sell in her market.

loans.use: To purchase more clothing

loans.name: Joice

texts.en: Joice S. is currently in the business of selling foodstuffs in her restaurant and is requesting a loan to stock more foodstuffs.  Joice is 20 years old and is married with a husband who is a farmer. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to expand the business.

loans.use: To stock more foodstuffs in her restaurant

loans.name: Yanet

texts.es:
Yanet tiene 35 años y vive en la ciudad del Cusco, Perú. Cusco es una ciudad encantadora que se remonta a los tiempos incas. Construida en la base de la antigua ciudad Inca. Yanet es casada y fruto de esta unión tiene dos hijos, ella tiene un puesto de venta en el paradero final de los buses “Wimpillay”, donde vende desayunos y otros platos de comida. Hace varios años que empezó este negocio y con un poco de capital pero ahora, ella tiene un pequeño kiosco y la pueden encontrar en su puesto de venta que está equipado con una cocina, platos, mesas, sillas y muchas cosas más, ella sale a vender todos los días desde las 7 de la mañana hasta las 11 de la mañana o hasta que se acabe la comida. 

Yanet desprende una imagen de una mujer trabajadora y responsable. Un flujo de clientes vistan el kiosco y el negocio se anima bastante durante la hora en que llegan los choferes y los ayudantes. Ella vende sus platos comida a un precio cómodo y accesible para los clientes y sobre todo de buena calidad, esto la distingue de la competencia. Con su próximo préstamo, Yanet espera recibir S/. 1000 nuevos soles. Por el momento, desea incrementar el capital del negocio y va comprar más insumos como por ejemplo, carne, papa, verduras, arroz y muchos productos más. 

Yanet pertenece al banco comunal “Mosoc Killa y se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Yanet is 35 years old and lives in the city of Cusco, Peru.  Cusco is a charming city which dates back to Inca times and was built on the site of the ancient Inca city.  Yanet is married and has two children.  She has a food stall at the last stop on the “Wimpillay” bus route where she sells breakfasts and other meals.  She started this business several years ago with a little capital but now she has a small kiosk and she is to be found at her stall which is equipped with a stove, plates, tables, seats and many other things.  She goes out to sell her food every day from 7 in the morning until 11 in the morning or until she runs out of food to sell.

Yanet is the very image of a hard-working and responsible woman.  A tide of customers visit her kiosk and her business gets very lively when the bus drivers and their assistants arrive.  She sells her meals at a price which is suitable and reasonable for her customers and, above all, she sells good quality food.  This is what sets her apart from the competition.  Yanet hopes to receive a loan for 1,000 nuevos soles,  She would like to increase her business capital and buy more supplies such as meat, potatoes, vegetables, rice and many other products.

Yanet belongs to the “Mosoc Killa” community bank and is grateful for the opportunity which she is being given.  She pledges to make her repayments in a timely manner.

loans.use: To buy more supplies such as meat, potatoes, vegetables, rice and many other products

loans.name: Leah

texts.en:
Leah is 35 years old and is a mother of 3, aged between 12 and 4 years.  She has been in the poultry business for 4 years and had previously accessed a loan of 30,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo.

She has applied for this loan of 40,000 KES with the same institution (Juhudi Kilimo) to expand her poultry business.  She believes the income generated will give her family food sustainability and educate her children.  She plans to be the major supplier of chicks in the area.  Her alternative source of income is maize farming.

She urges for interest waiver for those who service their loans consistently.

loans.use: To purchase poultry

loans.name: Bienvinida

texts.en:
Mrs. Bienvinida G. is from the Barangay of Tabid, Ozamiz City, Misamis Occidental. She is 53 years old, married to Rodrigo G. and blessed with 4 children of whom 3 of them are now at their adult age and the other 1 is still  school aged. To make a living, she is presently engaged in direct selling business particularly AVON Products and RTW dealing. Her husband is engaged in agricultural activity. She’s been engaged in this kind of business for 10 years. She’s earning an average amount of not less than P10,000.00 a month from this kind of business. 

In May 19,2008, Bienvinida joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Bienvinida as an active member of Paglaum MPC under the PDP-LP, a microfinance program that reached out to rural communities, has successfully repaid a loan amount of Php14,000.00. She is now requesting a loan of Php13,000.00 as her 5th loan which will be used for  additional capital for her direct selling of AVON Products and RTW dealing business. The future income of this business will be used to meet their basic needs, loan repayments and child’s education. She also joined PAGLAUM MPC because of the savings and insurance program offered by PAGLAUM MPC to its members. 

 About PMPC:
 Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. 

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Additional capital for her direct selling AVON Products and RTW dealing business

loans.name: Jessica

texts.en:
Jessica M., 34, is from the village of Salawagan, Quezon, Bukidnon. She is married and has six school-aged children. To make a living, Jessica runs a business buying and selling rice by the kilogram in the local community. Jessica has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2009, Jessica joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jessica has successfully repaid a previous loan of 11,000 PHP from HSPFI which she used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. Jessica is requesting a new loan of 14,000 PHP to purchase additional rice to sell. This will be her fourth loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional rice to sell.

loans.name: Rodolfo

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “ÑAUPASUNCHIS”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

El socio es el Sr. Rodolfo; el tiene 31 años de edad y es conviviente y tiene 1 hijo; El socio alterna sus actividades diarias con el trabajo de cheff de cocina, el socio prepara diferentes tipos de platos como tradicionales y de gourmet, el socio quiere tener un negocio de restaurant. El  socio solicita el préstamo para el mantenimiento de su casa.

El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This borrower belongs to the Ñaupasunchis communal bank. The bank is located in the district of Cusco, which belongs to the province and department of Cusco.

Rodolfo is 31 years old, has a common-law marriage and one child. He alternates his daily activities with his work as a kitchen chef. He prepares different types of dishes such as traditional and gourmet, and he wants to have a restaurant business. He is requesting the loan for housing maintenance.

Rodolfo is happy for the loan and promises to make his loan payments.

loans.use: Housing maintenance

loans.name: Keo

texts.en: Keo S., 28, is married and resides with her husband and two children in Takeo Province, Cambodia, an area known for pre-Angkorean temples. She sells groceries, earning an income of USD 5 per day. Her husband is a logger, earning an income of USD 3 per day to help cover the family expenses. Each month, the family has to spend USD 66 on food and USD 55 on other necessary expenses. S. is requesting a loan of USD 1000 to purchase more groceries to stock the store. In the future, she would like to use any additional income to repair her house. This will be her second loan from CREDIT, a longstanding Kiva partner.

loans.use: buy more groceries to stock the store

loans.name: Delfina

texts.en:
Delfina R. is 47, married and supports her family by operating two business ventures: a food production and sales operation, and a meat vending business.  She lives in Brgy. Camburoy, Samboan, Cebu. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2006 and has improved her living conditions with the help of loans from NWTF, and through her own efforts. By working hard in her businesses, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 5,000. Delfina is now borrowing PHP 12,000 to fund the operations of her business. This will be her sixth loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 12,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Delfina aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future wellbeing by following the Dungganon way.

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on www.kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: To fund the operations of food products businesses

loans.name: Subira Group

texts.en:
Theresia R., who is in her mid-twenties, is married with one daughter.  She has been running a bar at a place called Mpigi, a few kilometres from the city centre, for three years now.  She works from 10:00am to 10.00pm daily and she is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be Theresia's 2nd "motisha" loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. A "Motisha" loan is a product offered by Tujijenge Tanzania that allows borrowers with good credit ratings to pay back their original loans faster and receive extra money before their original loan term has ended. Theresia has paid back her 1st "motisha" loan successfully. She hopes to obtain a loan to start selling charcoal at wholesale prices.

Theresia will share this loan with her loan  group, "Subira", which has a total of 12 members.  The members of the group will hold each other responsible in paying back the loan.

In the picture, Theresia is second from left, front row, in a blue dress.

loans.use: To start selling charcoal at wholesale prices

loans.name: Esquipula Group

texts.es:
“Esquipula” este grupo esta ubicado en la colonia 5 de mayo en la ciudad de Pinotepa Nacional Oaxaca, este grupo esta integrado por 10 personas de las cuales 8 son mujeres y 2 son hombres cada quien tiene respectivamente una actividad económica diferente, todos ellos se conocen ya que son vecinos de la misma colonia.
El nombre que le denominaron a su grupo es porque la mayoría de los integrantes de este grupo son devotos del Cristo Negro de Esquipulas es muy conocido en el país de Centro America y el Sur de México.
La representante de este grupo es la señora Epifania T. Pérez de 45 años de edad es madre soltera de 2 hijos de 15 y 13 años de edad ambos estudian la secundaria, ella es estilista profesional desde hace 20 años, para realizar esta actividad ella tomo un curso en la ciudad de Acapulco, esta actividad la ayudado mucho económicamente ya que de ello a podido vivir modestamente y apoyado a sus hijos con su educación; A demás de esta actividad ella por la mañana se dedica a vender antojitos como: tostadas, enchiladas, molotes, tacos, quesadillas en la Secundaria 5 de Mayo lugar en donde estudian sus hijos. Epifania solicito el préstamo para comprar artículos de belleza para su estética.
Otra de las integrantes de este grupo es la señora Evodia Pérez Hernández de 67 años de edad esta casada con el señor Elías T. Sánchez quien tiene el oficio de campesino desde que era muy pequeño ya que fue la enseñanza que les dejaron sus padres. Evodia nunca fue a la escuela ya que sus padres no tenían la posibilidad de darle una educación ya que eran persona muy humildes que solo se dedicaban al campo y a los que quehaceres del hogar, ella tiene 9 hijos los cuales todos ya están casados. 
La señora Evodia solicito el préstamo para comprar insumos para la venta de tamales como son: hojas de plátano, totomoztle, manteca, harina, canela, entre otros, ya que ella vende diferentes tipos de tamales como son: dulces y de manjar, mole de pollo, cerdo, entre otros para realizar sus ventas tiene que ir al mercado publico que se encuentra  a 10 minutos de su casa, ella comenta que tiene mas ventas en el mes de diciembre ya que muchas personas van a realizar pedidos para esa fechas de fiestas cuando se realizan las posadas y la noche buena, Evodia aprendió esta actividad desde que tenia 15 años ya que su mamá le enseño a realizarlos y de igual manera con el paso del tiempo ha venido aprendiendo otras cosas, sus ventas son muy buenas ya que es muy conocida en su colonia de lo delicioso que son sus tamales. 
Además de sus ventas de tamales tiene un pequeño encierro en el cual cría gallinas y vacas este lugar esta ubicado a 45 minutos del lugar donde vive y lo va a visitar cada fin de semana, porque entre semana su esposo es el que cuida el lugar y cosecha diferentes tipos de productos como son el maíz, frijol, sandia, calabaza y chile que lo usan para el consumo personal. Evodia es la primera vez que pide préstamo a FRAC ya que anteriormente había pedido a otras fundaciones.
Las personas que integran el grupo Esquipulas son las siguientes:
Gudelia Agustina C. López: de 69 años de edad se dedica a la compra de pescado para la venta.
Evodia Pérez Hernández: de 67 años de edad se dedica a la compra de insumos para la elaboración de tamales para la venta.
Jorge Baños Rodríguez: de 57 años de edad se dedica a la compra de lubricantes para su camioneta para transporte.
Adriana Estela Hernández T.: de 30 años de edad se dedica a la compra de insumos para la venta de antojitos.
Nabor Nazario Baños Rodríguez: de 56 años de edad se dedica a la compra de refacciones para el servicio de transporte.
Epifania T. Pérez: de 45 años de edad se dedica a la compra de artículos de belleza para trabajar en su estética.
Ángela R. López: de 21 años de edad se dedica a la compra de insumos para la elaboración de atole para la venta.
María Felipa Velásquez López: de 39 años de edad se dedica a la compra de maíz para la elaboración de totopos para la venta.
Rosa P. H.: de 30 años de edad se dedica a la compra de insumos para la elaboración y venta de tamales.
Aura Luz T.: de 31 años de edad se dedica a la compra de insumos para la elaboración y venta de tamales.
texts.en:
Esquipula is the name of this group and it is located in the colony named 5 de Mayo, in the city of Pinotepa Nacional in the state of Oaxaca. The group is made up of 10 members, of whom 8 are women and 2 are men. Each member has their own unique business. They all known each other because they are neighbors in the same colony. 

They chose the name for the group because the majority of the members are devoted to Cristo Negro de Esquipulas, very well known in Central America and southern Mexico.

The representative of this group is Epifania T. P.. She is 45 years old and she is a single mother of 2 children, 15 and 13 years of age. They are both in high school. She has been a professional stylist for 20 years. To start her business she took a course in the city of Acapulco. this business has been a great financial support and she has been able to make a modest living through it, supporting her children and in their schooling. In addition to this business she also sells snacks in the mornings, such as: toasted tortillas, enchiladas, tacos, and quesadillas at the 5 de Mayo high school, the same school where her children go.

Epifania requested a loan to purchase beauty supplies for her business. 

Another of the members of the group is Evodia P. H.. She is 67 years old and she is married to Elias T. Sanchez. He has been a farmer since he was a boy and this was the knowledge inherited to him by his parents. Evodia never went to school because her parents did not have the ability to give her an education. They were very humble people who only worked in the fields and in the home. She has 9 children and they are all married.

Evodia requests a loan to purchase ingredients to make and sell tamales, including: banana leaves, corn, lard, flour, cinnamon, and other ingredients. She makes various kinds of tamales including sweet tamales, delicacy tamales, chicken and sauce tamales, pork tamales, and other types. To make her sales she goes to the public market, located about 10 minutes from her house. she says that she has more sales in the month of December and many people place orders for the holidays when they have parties and observe Christmas Eve. Evodia learned the business when she was 15 years old from her mother. She has been learning new things with the passage of time. Her sales are very good and she is well known in the colony for the delicious tamales she makes. 

In addition to her tamales sales she also has a small enclosure where she raises chickens and cows. It is located 45 minutes from the place where she lives and she visits them every weekend. During the week her husband is who takes care of them and he also harvests various types of products, including corn, beans, watermelons, gourds, and chilies, products that they use for their personal consumption. It is the first time Evodia requests a loan from FRAC (Kiva Field Partner) but she has had loans with other organizations in the past. 

The members of the Esquipulas group are the following: 

Gudelia Agustina C. L.: she is 69 years old and she buys and sells fish. 
Evodia P. H.: she is 67 years old and she will buy ingredients to make tamales.
Jorge Banos R.: he is 57 years old and he will purchase motor fluids for his public transport van.
Adriana Estela H. T.: she is 30 years old and she will purchase ingredients to make snack foods.
Nabor Nazario Banos R.: he is 56 years old and he will purchase spare parts for his transport service.
Epifania T. P.: she is 45 years old and she will purchase beauty supplies for her beauty parlor. 
Angela R. L.: she is 21 years old and she will purchase ingredients to make traditional hot drinks for sale.
Maria Felipa V. L.: she is 39 years old and she will purchase corn to prepare foods for sale.
Rosa P. H.: she is 30 years old and she will purchase ingredients to prepare and sell tamales.
Aura Luz T.: she is 31 years old and she will purchase ingredients to make and sell tamales.

loans.use: To purchase beauty products.

loans.name: Katiuska Giomar

texts.es:
Katiuska de 32 años, es una mujer trabajadora que tiene un negocio de bocaditos y venta de tortas. Con ayuda de sus hijos ha incrementado sus ventas ya que venden los bocaditos en una estación de buses. 

La mayoría de sus clientes son cristianos evangélicos  ya que les vende bocaditos y tortas para sus eventos. Trabaja desde la mañana hasta que termine la elaboración de todos sus productos. Tiene muchas aspiraciones con su negocio por eso quiere con el préstamo comprar harina, huevos, materia prima para tener un volumen de ventas mayor.
texts.en:
Katiuska is 32 years old. She is a hard-working woman who runs a snacks and cake sale activity. With the help of her children she has increased her sales, as she sells the snacks in a bus station.

The majority of her customers are Evangelical Christians, because she sells them snacks and cakes for their celebrations. She starts working in the morning and she goes on until she has finished preparing her products. She has many ambitions for her activity, and fort this reason she will use this loan to buy flour, eggs and other basic ingredients in order to increase her sales.

loans.use: To buy flour, eggs and other basic ingredients for her activity.

loans.name: Bukasa Kirabo Development Group, Mukono

texts.en: Joshua W. leads the Bukasa Kirabo loan group, all of whose members live in the town of Mukono. He is 33 years old, married and has three children, all of whom are in school. For more than six years, he has made a living as a bricklayer, and also sells maize on the side. He buys his maize from nearby farmers, and became a bricklayer after taking to a friend who was already employed in this line of work. He is very hardworking and needs a loan to be able to buy firewood for making the bricks he uses and sells.

loans.use: To buy firewood to use in making bricks.

loans.name: Tigran

texts.en: Tigran G. lives in Sisian, Armenia. He is engaged in agriculture. He gets his main income from selling milk. Tigran has applied to SEF for a loan  to increase the livestock. With the requested loan he plans to buy calves and get more income from selling calves and milk. With the profits,Tigran hopes to be able to repair his house and to get married.

loans.use: to pay for livestock

loans.name: Rana

texts.en:
Rana M. is a 30-year-old mom. She is married to Majdi and has two children. Rana and her husband started their own home business three years ago selling used shoes. Through these three years, she has applied for four loans to improve their business. Using these loans, she was able to open a separate store to sell used shoes for different ages as a second branch in another area and kept the main branch at her house. Now Rana has applied for her fifth loan to expand and re-decorate both shops.

Rana is a conservative person who didn't want her photo published on the internet. So, her husband Majdi appears in the photo, since he works at the second branch.

loans.use: To expand and re-decorate her shoe shop

loans.name: Richard Kanyagia

texts.en:
Richard, 34 and married to Jane Wangui, has practised farming in the town of Olkalou for the last three years. He was introduced to KADET LTD by one of our field officers, and this will be his second loan, having paid his previous one well and in good time. He plans to use the loan to buy seeds and fertilizer.

In the future, Richard hopes to become a leading farmer in the Olkalou area.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seedlings and to plough the land.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase bundles of beans, sacks of maize and sugar.

loans.name: Ernesto

texts.en: Ernesto is 30 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is widowed with three children. Ernesto provides motorela or habal-habal transportation services. He has had this business for three years. He has requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy tools needed for the maintenance of his motorbike. Ernesto has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Ernesto hopes to see his business grow.

loans.use: to buy tools needed for the maintenance of his motorcycle

loans.name: Lailyn

texts.en:
Lailyn is 38 years old and is married. She has a 14-year-old child.

Lailyn is engaged in farming. She helps her husband grow rice at their land. According to her, they have been growing rice for seven years now. Lailyn also does some hog-raising. Lailyn works hard to help grow their ventures. She also hopes for her child to have a bright future.

Lailyn will use her loan to purchase five sacks of fertilizers and other farm inputs. She hopes to start another business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase five sacks of fertilizers and other farm inputs.

loans.name: Shahin

texts.en:
Shahin is 44 years old, married, and has five children. Shahin is the sole provider for his family and earns his living by raising and selling cattle at the local market. Once every 2-3 months he purchases young animals from local villagers, raises them over a six-month period, and later sells the adult cows to local butchers. His monthly income is about $300.  

Today, Shahin is thinking about expanding his business, as his current earnings are not enough to provide for his family. He plans to purchase young cattle. That’s why he is requesting a loan of 1,200 AZN. He has a good client history and promises to repay his loan on time.

loans.use: to purchase three young cattle and fodder.

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en: Catherine is 45 years old and lives in Jacob town. She has two children age 5 and 14 years old. For the past six years, she has been operating a small shop where she sells drinks (soda, beer, energy drink etc), soap, and milk among other items. She is requesting a loan to purchase more drinks and other goods for her business. She hopes to buy a car in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase more drinks and other goods for her business

loans.name: Daniela Verónica

texts.es:
La Señorita. Daniela es socia del banco comunal Fuerza Trabajadora, vive por los alrededores de la ciudad de Cuenca, ciudad que fue nombrada como patrimonio cultural de la humanidad por su belleza arquitectónica, su gente mantiene la cultura y tradiciones, también tienen una gran variedad en su gastronomía. 

La Señorita. Daniela tiene 22 años de edad, es soltera y vive con sus padres quienes laboran como empleados privados, no tienen casa propia por lo que viven arrendando.
 
Nuestra socia se dedica a su negocio, ella tiene un restaurante hace 5 años, trabaja de lunes a sábados desde las 8 de la mañana hasta las 9 de la noche.
 
Se encuentra en su tercer ciclo en el banco comunal y su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en sillas, mesas y víveres para ampliar su negocio.
 
Su meta es tener un local más grande para vender su comida.
texts.en:
Daniela, 22, is a member of the Fuerza Trabajadora community bank. She lives on the outskirts of Cuenca, a city named a UNESCO World Heritage Site for its beautiful architecture. Its people maintain the area's traditional culture and traditions and the local cuisine is known for its great variety.
 
Daniela is single and lives with her parents, both of whom have jobs.  The house where they live is rented. 

Daniela has owned a restaurant business for 5 years.  She works Mondays to Saturdays from 8:00 in the morning to 9:00 at night.   

This is Daniela's third loan as a member of the community bank. She will use it to buy tables, chairs and other supplies that she needs to expand her restaurant.
 
Daniela wants a larger space to operate her business.

loans.use: to buy table, chairs and other supplies for her restaurant business.

loans.name: Jesus

texts.en:
It is really hard to be the head of the family. "I have to work hard and always look for other sources of income aside from farming just to meet the needs of my family," Jesus says. He is 47 years old, married and blessed with nine children. Jesus and his wife are helping each other to support their family's needs, especially their children's needs for school. Five of his children are going to school, while one is working abroad as an OFW [Overseas Filipino Worker] and the others have temporarily stopped their studies due to lack of financial support.

Jesus still wishes to send his children to school to finish their studies. He will do everything and look for additional sources of income to meet their needs. Jesus wanted a loan to buy piglets to raise. He looks forward to the success of this business.

loans.use: to buy piglets to raise

loans.name: Angelica

texts.es:
La  socia pertenece al banco comunal “FUENTE DE VIDA” el banco se encuentra ubicado en el Distrito de Huanchac, en la Provincia de Cusco y Departamento de Cusco.

La  socia Angelica; tiene 45 años de edad,  la socia es casada; la socia tiene 5 hijos de los cuales solo dos de ellos están bajo la responsabilidad de la socia;  ella se dedica  a la elaboración de comidas, la socia vende de manera independiente sus diferentes potajes hechos por ella misma, la socia ama la cocina su sueño es poner un restaurante propio, pero ella sabe que esto es muy costoso por esta razón la socia se mantiene de forma independiente, la socia desea el crédito para invertir en la compra de insumos como aceite al por mayor, papas, arroz en bolsa de 30 kilos, sal en sobres y de esta manera en otros ingredientes y productos más. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de insumos para la elaboración de comidas caseras.

La  socia agradece el apoyo que se le otorgara y así mismo se compromete a cumplir de manera disciplinada con los pagos de las cuotas.
texts.en:
Angelica is a member of the communal bank "Fuente de Vida" located in the district of Huanchac in the province and department of Cusco.  She is 45 years old, married and has 5 children, two of whom are still dependent.  She makes food for a living.  She sells the different Peruvian dishes she makes in an independent manner.  She loves to cook.   Her dream is to open her own restaurant but she knows that this is very costly and for this reason she continues to sell independently.  

She is requesting a loan to buy supplies such as wholesale oil, potatoes, rice in 30 kilo bags, salt in packets, and other ingredients and products to make her homemade foods.  She is grateful for the support given to her and is committed to making her payments in a disciplined manner.

loans.use: purchase supplies to make her homemade foods.

loans.name: Ganhuyag

texts.en: Ganhuyag is 49 years old and lives with his two children and wife in a ger—a Mongolian yurt—in Hovd province of Mongolia. His one son is a high school student and the other helps with the family business. Ganhuyag has been involved in repairing and servicing cars since 1996. He is one of the very few people who can fix car engines in their local town. He is a diligent and hard-working man and is also teaching his children how to fix cars. He is requesting a 1,300,000 MNT loan to buy spare parts of cars for his business.

loans.use: buy spare parts of cars

loans.name: Felomina

texts.en:
Felomina is 38 years old and married to a farmer. She just finished elementary schooling. Her education suffers because of the poor living of her parents. She doesn’t want to impart this fate to her three children, so she needs to work in order to provide for their needs. For almost a month, she has engaged herself in raising pigs. It is difficult at first because the fact is, she is still grasping this occupation.

The desire to lift their living condition into better, leads her to ask for a loan amount of 5,000 PHP to buy feed and pigs to raise. She said that, though it is difficult to care for several pigs, it leads to higher income soon. Felomina is patiently caring for pigs to provide a better future for her children.

loans.use: to buy feed for her pigs

loans.name: Miguel Angel

texts.es:
Miguel de 24 años de edad, es soltero, vive en su casa propia, no cuenta con servicios básicos, ubicada en el distrito de Paijan que pertenece al departamento de La Libertad.  Los pobladores de ésta zona se dedican a la agricultura y ganadería.

Miguel  maneja su mototaxi (transporte que se utiliza para movilizarse en distancias cortas, con un cupo máximo de 3 personas) desde hace 2 años aproximadamente, está actividad lo realiza en la misma zona donde vive, a pesar de la gran cantidad de personas que realizan el mismo trabajo, el trata en lo posible desde muy temprano movilizar una buena cantidad de pasajeros a sus diferentes destinos, y así tenga mayor cantidad de ingresos para solventar sus gastos y necesidades personales.

El crédito que ha solicitado a Edpyme Alternativa es de 1200 nuevos soles y su destino será para el mantenimiento  de su mototaxi  para seguir brindando un buen servicio a su clientela y mejorar su calidad de vida.  Miguel es una persona responsable y trabajadora  que lo único que desea es que a sus padres no les falte nada.
texts.en:
Miguel, 24, is single and lives in his own home, which lacks basic utilities and is located in the Paijan district of the department of La Libertad.  The residents of this area work in livestock and animal husbandry.

Miguel has been driving his mototaxi, (a mode of transportation that is used to move people short distances, which carries up to 3 people), for about 2 years.  He does this work in the area where he lives.  In spite of the many people who also do this type of work, he tries as much as possible to move a large quantity of people to their destinations each day, working from the very early hours.  This way he can have a better income to pay his bills and pay for his personal necessities.

He has requested a loan from Edpyme Alternativa for 1,200 Peruvian soles, which will be used for maintenance work on his mototaxi so that he can continue to provide good service to his customers, and improve his quality of life.  Miguel is a responsible and hardworking person; his main concern is to provide his parents with everything they need.

loans.use: to maintain his mototaxi so that he can continue to provide good service to his customers

loans.name: Finda

texts.en:
Finda is 40 years old and lives in the Paynesville area. She is married and has five children between 13 and 24 years old. All of them are in school and live at home.

For the past ten years, she has been operating a shop in her community. She makes a lot of profit that helps her to send her children to school. She is requesting a loan to purchase more tissue, toothpaste, milk and soap for her business. She hopes to build a house and support her children in school.

loans.use: to purchase more tissue, toothpaste, milk and soap for her business

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
A. is a 30-year-old married man and the father of one child. A. has worked in painting cars and vehicles since 11 years ago. This long experience has gained A. his customers' trust and confidence.

A. is requesting a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua in  order to buy new machines and tools necessary to improve his work.

A. is a man with a good reputation; he sacrifices his life for the sake of his family's living.

He hopes he can make a bigger family and expand his business as much as he can.

loans.use: To buy new, improved tools for his business.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy construction materials for resale.

loans.name: Sofia

texts.es:
Sofia tiene 62 años, es casada y fruto D. esta unión tiene cuatro hijos. Sofia nació en la ciudad D. Juliaca y ahora radica en la ciudad del Cusco. En la ciudad del Cusco Sofia desarrolla sus actividades cotidianas y económicas.   

Sofia se dedica a la venta D. butifarras (La butifarra es un sándwich típico D. la gastronomía del Perú en base a un preparado especial del chancho llamado localmente jamón del país.), ella venD. sus productos en la puerta D. su casa D. su hija mayor. Ya son varios años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. 
  
Sofia pertenece al banco comunal “Ñahupacman Purisun” D. la Asociación  Arariwa D. la ciudad del Cusco. En esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar cebolla, pan, jamón, tomates, rocoto y otras cosas más. 

Sofia se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Sofia is 62, married and has four children. She was born in the city of Juliaca and now lives in Cusco. There she conducts her business and other daily activities.

Sofia sells butifarras (a traditional Peruvian sandwich maD. from specially prepared pork, named locally the country’s ham). She sells her products in the doorway of her oldest daughter’s house. She has been engaged in this business for several years and it has been doing well thanks to the effort she puts into her work.

Sofia belongs to the “Ñahupacman Purisun”  communal bank of  Asociación Arariwa in Cusco. At this time she needs a loan to buy onions, bread, ham, tomatoes, hot peppers and other items.

Sofia is grateful for the opportunity provided her and is committed to making her payments on time.

loans.use: to buy onion, bread, ham, tomatoes, hot peppers and other items.

loans.name: Hanan

texts.en:
Hanan, a 33-year-old young married mother of three sons and two daughters, operates a grocery store. Because she wants to increase the range of products available to her customers, Hanan is requesting a loan of $1,000 from FATEN. The resulting product acquisition should increase her sales and income, thereby leading to better living conditions for her family.

Hanan is a conservative woman, so her 18-year-old son Mohammad is shown in the photograph.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to resell.

loans.name: Teresa De Jesus

texts.es:
Teresa, es comerciante de verduras, vive con su esposo, ella tiene más de 10 años de estar dedicado a la venta de verduras, posee un puesto en el mercado municipal, su esposo se dedica a cultivar las verduras en su terreno para evitar comprarla toda para la venta, así se ahorran una cuantas verduras en el negocio.
Actualmente está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de tomates, papas, güisquiles, yucas, zanahoria, este crédito le ayudara para tener todo lo necesario para cubrir sus gastos y aprovechar la temporada navideña.
La aspiración de Teresa es que este mes venidero sea bueno para la venta, que logre sacar el dinero necesario para pagar las cuotas, para un largo plazo quiere terminar la construcción de su vivienda.
texts.en:
Teresa is a vegetable vendor. She lives with her husband. She has been selling vegetables for more than ten years, and has a stall in the municipal market. 

Her husband grows vegetables on his plot of land, to avoid having to buy everything they sell. This way, they save having to buy a few vegetables through the business.

Currently, she is applying for the loan to buy tomatoes, potatoes, güisquiles (pear squash), yucas, and carrots. This loan will help her to have all she needs to cover her expenses, and take advantage of the Christmas season. 

Teresa's desire is that this coming month will be good for sales, so that she manages to get the money necessary to pay her instalments. In the long term, she wants to finish the construction of her house.

loans.use: To buy tomatoes, potatoes, güisquiles (pear squash), yucas, and carrots.

loans.name: Ma. Liberty

texts.en:
Ma. Liberty is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a videoke rental business in the Philippines. She is borrowing 10,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) through NWTF to buy tables and chairs, and to upgrade her videoke unit.

Ma. Liberty has been in this business for two years. She earns more income from food vending.

Ma. Liberty has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: To buy tables and chairs, and to upgrade her videoke unit.

loans.name: Philip

texts.en:
Philip is 33 years old and married and blessed with three children. Philip buys and sells charcoal in Kapsabet town and his business has been in operation for a period of 11 years, earning  him a monthly income of Kes 20,000.

He is requesting his first loan with KADET Ltd of Kes 30,000 and intends to use the amount to purchase more bags of charcoal for resale. The profits will be used to improve his business.

His dream is to become a timber distributor and prosper in business and have a happy family.

loans.use: To purchase more sacks of charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Crispus Hamisi

texts.en:
Crispus Hamisi is a 39-year-old livestock seller in Mariakani. He is the married father of three. He has been selling livestock for the past two years successfully. 

This is Crispus’ third loan from KADET. He plans to buy more cows, goats and sheep to resell to his customers. 

He will use the proceeds to educate his children and repay his loan. He hopes to have a successful business.

loans.use: to buy more cows, goats and sheep

loans.name: Sort's Group

texts.en:
Sort, 38, lives in a village of Battambang province’s Moung Russey district, Cambodia. To make a living, she has been farming rice and catching fish for several years. She can earn about 50,000KHR per day. 
Sort has been with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund, for three loan cycles and completely paid back the loans. With the loans from VisionFund, she has managed to improve her livelihood. She is now leading her group to apply for another loan. As the leader, Sort will use her portion to buy fertilizer and seeds for her farmland. She hopes to make more crops from her current business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seeds for her farmland

loans.name: Eulitah

texts.en:
Fifty two-year-old Eulitah does not boast of any academic papers from a higher learning institution but he is an accomplished farmer from the Kitale area of Kenya and commands a lot of respect. She she has 8 children, whom she really loves and cherishes. Eulitah and her husband work as a team, supporting each other, and have practiced mixed farming for the past twenty years. Eulitah often says, “I have always had an affinity for farming, and it runs in my blood.” Because of the liking that she has for farming, she has even nicknamed one of her cows which makes her a very proud farmer, especially when she is milking her cows. From her dairy cow, She is able to get between 10 and 20 liters of milk a day, and this helps her support her family.

Eulitah also practices crop farming, but she has not been making good profits because of poor farming inputs; that is why she is kindly seeking a loan to buy farm inputs. Through the loan, she will be able to buy high-quality seeds, good fertilizer and pesticides that she will use to greatly improve her crop production. Modern farming requires the use of modern techniques; and therefore, using high-quality seeds will assure him of a bumper harvest and hence, increased profit levels. Eulitah is very visionary, and her goal for the season is to boost her crop production and be able to get more crop output than the previous year. Eulitah believes that through the loan, she will turn around her family life and be able to give her children a solid education background. This loan will be Eulitah’s way out of poverty.

loans.use: to buy high-quality seeds, good fertilizer and pesticides that she will use to greatly improve her crop production.

loans.name: Charity

texts.en:
Charity  is married woman with four  children, one  of whom attend school. She owns a house that  has  no electricity but has  piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. 

For the past 13 years, she has operated a cereals shop business, selling to her neighbours and passersby. She mentioned seasonality and theft as her major challenge. Charity  dreams of establishing a wholesale shop in the future.

With the Kshs 20,000 she wants to purchase maize flour, rice, beans, cooking fat oil. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase maize flour, rice, beans, cooking fat oil

loans.name: Tala

texts.en:
Tala is married with two children. 
She manages a taro plantation which also produces cocoa. She exports the cocoa, sometimes to new Zealand, sometimes to American Samoa.

She has paid back four loans to SPBD and is now on her fifth loan. SPBD loans have assisted not only with capital expense and other expenses on her plantation but also with home improvement.

loans.use: Pay farm labor, fix vehicle and buy fertiliser and seed

loans.name: Miguel

texts.en:
Miguel is a retired worker and the only income he gets is the pension he receives for the years he worked. This amount is very little because in Mexico, pensions are low. Miguel has always liked to be doing something, so he categorizes himself as an active person. Now that he has no work, Miguel decided to open a grocery store. His wife is the only person that keeps him company, and he would like to offer her a better quality of life, because he believes there are still many more things he can do in life. Miguel and his wife have 8 sons and daughters, they are all married and left home to live with their own families.

Miguel is very happy with what he has accomplished in life, yet he would like to live a better quality of life with his wife. This is why he is requesting a US$475 loan; to buy merchandise for his store and see it grow. Miguel awaits your collaboration and generosity, expecting to return the loan within 6 to 12 months.

Translated from Spanish by Isabel Tan, a Kiva volunteer.

Miguel es un trabajador retirado, que ahora solo vive de la pensión que recibe por los años de trabajo, siendo esta pensión muy poca, ya que en México las pensiones son muy bajas. Miguel es una persona que durante toda su vida le ha gustado estar haciendo algo, por lo que el se cataloga como una persona muy activa, y ahora sin trabajo, decidió poner una tienda de abarrotes. Él tiene actualmente como única compañía a su esposa y desea darle una mejor calidad de vida ya que aún siente que puede hacer muchas cosas más en la vida. Miguel y su esposa tienen 8 hijos quienes están casados y dejaron su hogar para vivir con sus respectivas familias.

Miguel está muy contento con lo logrado en la vida pero desea tener una mejor calidad de vida para el y su esposa, por ello esta solicitando de un préstamo de US$ 475 para comprar mercancía para su negocio y hacerlo crecer. Miguel espera su colaboración y generosidad, esperando devolver el préstamo en un período de 6 a 12 meses.

loans.use: compra de mercancia

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To invest in the maintenance and repair of her shop.

loans.name: Sandra

texts.en:
Sandra F. A. is 22 and married in civil law. She recently became independent from her mother and went to live with her husband. Though very young, she runs a convenience store that attracts many customers.

She sells all types of products, including drinks, meats, breads, and fruits. She also sells household goods, stationery items, and some clothing. She started her business 5 years ago with her husband. Her husband helps in the store and also sells vegetables to many other convenience stores. He uses his vehicle to deliver vegetables and to run general errands for the convenience store.

The vegetable business is going well. Her husband now delivers vegetables not only in the city but also to surrounding areas. Even though the convenience store does not yet have an established clientele, it is the biggest one in the area and attracts many customers.

She would use the loan to restock the store with beverages, including wine and beer, which are best sellers. She needs to restock because she closes the store late and has many evening customers.

loans.use: To restock the store with beverages

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
Juana is married and has four children. Her husband works on ovens and their eldest son, who is 28 years old, helps him in the ovens business. She sells used and new clothing, and she started her business because she had to contribute income to help her husband with the family's expenses that could not be covered with his salary. Juana has worked selling used and new clothing for more than 6 years. She started selling to her relatives and neighbors and over time she had the option of buying lots of clothing and now she sells in temporary moving markets on different days of the week. She carries the clothes in her van and sells directly to the people.

Juana asks for a loan of US $250 to buy merchandise for her business and she offers to pay the loan in 3 months, since she wants to buy clothes for the season and she knows it will sell very quickly. Juana and her family thank you for your support in helping them make progress.

Translated from Spanish by Eliana Colunga, Kiva Volunteer

Juana está casada y tiene cuatro hijos, su esposo trabaja como hornero y su hijo mayor de 28 años le ayuda en el negocio, ella se dedica a la venta de ropa nueva y usada, y ella empezó con su negocio por que tenía que aportar ingresos para ayudar a su esposo en los gastos familiares que no podía cubrir con el sueldo de su esposo, hace ya mas de 6 años que ella se dedica a esta actividad, inició vendiéndole a sus familiares y vecinos y con el tiempo tuvo la opción de comprar pacas de ropa y ahora vende en mercados rodantes en diferentes días de la semana, lleva su ropa en su camioneta y hace su venta directa a las personas.

Juana solicita un préstamo por la cantidad de US $ 250 para comprar mercadería para su negocio y ofrece pagarlo en 3 meses, ya que ella quiere comprar ropa de temporada y sabe que la va a vender muy rápido. Ella y su familia te agradecen el apoyo que le das para salir adelante.

loans.use: Buying merchandise (clothing)

location.town: San Nicolás de los Garza, Nuevo León

loans.name: Rosmery Leonor

texts.en:
Here we see Ms. Rosmery L. in her Keyla Beauty Salon, showing us a sample of her great ability and skill as cosmetologist. Because of her skill, she has generated a lot of clients, and thanks to this effort she has also been able to open a small grocery store in her home, where she passes time when not immersed in the demands of the beauty shop. The limited space of her beauty parlor, the large number of clients and above all the many needs of her children, has created the desire to change the current location of the salon that she runs to expand and implement it in a better way, so she can continue providing full support and love to her two children of 12 and 7 years (she is the sole breadwinner as a single mother). Conducting these projects demands a greater investment, therefore, she is appealing to your generous hearts in asking for a loan.
