They know each other through family, neighborhood and friendship ties.  They are engaged in truck farming and charcoal and condiment sales.  The women in the Wilikateme group are on their second solidarity loan which will be used to buy charcoal and condiments.  The first loan was repaid without any problem.  
SALIMATA plans to buy 30 sacs of charcoal from retailers at the Marka-Coungo market.  She sells her products in the village of Massoukou and at the Marka-Coungo market, in cash or credit, to a clientele composed of men and women.  She anticipates making an average monthly profit of 15,000 CFA which will be used to make the loan payments and the remainder will be invested in her truck farming business to diversify her business.

loans.use: To buy charcoal

loans.name: Hoa

texts.en:
Hoa was born in 1956. She lives in Dai Bi village with her husband. She has 4 children who have been married.  Her husband sells things which are made of paper to burn for the dead such as paper money, paper houses, and paper umbrellas. 

Miss Hoa has a restaurant in the market where she sells rice, noodle, cobbler, etc. She has had this job for 10 years. Her family has a monthly income of about 7.000.000 Vietnam dong (VND). Hoa likes paying loans per week. So, she has participated in SEDA since 2006 and repaid punctually. During the last cycle she borrowed 6.322.000 VND and repaid this loan. In this loan cycle, she would like to borrow 8.938.000 VND to expand her restaurant.

loans.use: to expand her restaurant

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles has practiced farming in Ndunyu Njeru town for the last twenty one years.  He is 42 years old, married to Lucy and they have eight school age children.  

He was introduced to KADET by one of our field officers and this will be his third loan.  He paid all of his previous loans off and in good time.  He plans to use the loan amount to buy potato seeds, fertilizer and spraying chemicals.  He will sell his produce at the local market as he does small scale farming.

In the future Charles hopes to buy more land and practice large scale farming in the Ndunyu Njeru area.

loans.use: To buy seeds, fertilizer and spraying chemicals

loans.name: Franciska

texts.en:
She is 41 years old and married. She has four children and three of whom are in school.

She has been in this business of selling g_nut paste for one year. She took a loan through BRAC south sudan with the hopes of expanding her business.  With the extra profits from her loan, she will be able to pay school fee for her children.

loans.use: selling  g_nut paste

loans.name: Mabel

texts.es:
Mabel tiene 34 años de edad. Vive con su esposo y 2 hijos en la parte rural del distrito de Tambogrande en Piura. La comunidad, en la que Mabel vive, es de condición humilde pero con muchos deseos de superación.

Mabel se dedica a la crianza y venta de ovinos. Actualmente cuenta con 28 de estos que una vez que alcancen tamaño y peso ideal, los comercializará en el mercado local y a los pobladores de su caserío. Mabel también cría aves de corral, para su venta.

Mabel solicita a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 500 nuevos soles para comprar el alimento balanceado que sus ovinos y aves requieren. Además, quiere realizar mejoras en el corral donde cría as sus animales para que estos tengan un mejor crecimiento.

Mabel es una clienta conocida de nuestra entidad, su primer crédito lo canceló puntual y responsablemente.
texts.en:
Mabel is 34 years old.  She lives with her husband and two children in the rural part of the Tambogrande district in Piura.  The community where Mabel lives is in humble condition but it has a great desire to improve.

Mabel works raising and selling sheep.  She currently has 28 sheep, and when they reach their ideal weight and size, she sells them in the local market and to the people in her town.  Mabel also raises poultry to sell.  

Mabel asked Edpyme Alternativa for a loan of 500 nuevos soles to purchase the feed that her sheep and birds require.  She also wants to do some repairs in the corral where the animals stay so that they will have a better growth.

Mabel is a well known client of our bank.  She repaid her first loan punctually and responsibly.

loans.use: to purchase animal feed.

loans.name: Gustavo Adolfo

texts.es:
Es de la ciudad de Managua, el señor Gustavo Adolfo es soltero, tiene a su cargo tres personas, es  responsable, tiene buenos valores y principios  morales, que lucha para sacar adelante sus hijos para un futuro mejor. 

A esta oficina de ceprodel se presento  a solicitar crédito que será utilizado para  remodelación de su vivienda, en reparación de un cuarto,  para darle más seguridad  a su familia y agradece a ceprodel la oportunidad con este desembolso compra materiales de construcción tales como bloque, hierro, cemento, arena.
texts.en:
Gustavo, from the city of Managua, is single, and takes responsibility for 3 persons. He is very responsible, in fact, and has good values and moral principles, and he puts great effort into advancing his children towards a better future.

Gustavo came to this Ceprodel office to request a loan for remodeling his home -- repairing a room -- to achieve greater security for his family. He is very grateful to Ceprodel for the opportunity to borrow for the purchase of construction materials such as cement blocks, iron, cement, and sand.

loans.use: to buy construction materials to repair a room of his house, and increase his family's security.

loans.name: Vivian

texts.en:
Vivian has a sand and gravel business. She is 37 years old and widowed with one child. She lives in Clarin, Misamis Occidental. Vivian earns approximately 2,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) each month doing her work. She has requested a loan of 3,000 PHP to purchase more sand and gravel. 

Vivian has been a member of PMPC for three months. In the future, Vivian hopes to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more sand and gravel

loans.name: Roy Gabriel

texts.es:
Roy es un señor de 30 años de edad, el cual vive con su esposa e hijos, en  la Fuente, en la provincia de Cartago. El principal sistema de drenaje de esta zona es el río Reventazón que nace en el Cerro Cuericí. Por la fertilidad de sus suelos volcánicos y aluviales, Cartago es el centro de población que tiene en la agricultura y ganadería sus principales fuentes económicas.

Desde hace varios años que Roy tiene este negocio del ganado lechero, ya que cuenta en estos momentos con el propiedad que le heredaron sus padres, pero le falta lo principal para que su negocio surja y para que los vecinos de su comunidad se vean beneficiados.  El proyecto le es muy interesante.

Actualmente Roy está solicitando un micro crédito de ¢500.000 (quinientos mil colones) para la compra de materiales de construcción para su lechería. Con esto el espera hacer crecer su negocio, ya que su meta es tener un mejor lugar de trabajo donde se pueda instalar bien con sus animales y mejorar tanto su calidad de vida como la de su familia. 

Roy es socio de la Empresa de Crédito Comunal de Delirio, una de las 110 organizaciones socias de EDESA en Costa Rica. Este será su primer préstamo y con él espera continuar creciendo a nivel personal y económico además de participar activamente en la organización de crédito en su comunidad.
texts.en:
Roy is a 30-year-old man who lives with his wife and children in La Fuente, Cartago province. The main drainage system in this zone is the Reventazón River, which stems from the Cerro Cuericí. Due to the fertility of its volcanic and alluvial soil, Cartago is the population center whose main economic sources are agriculture and ranching.

Roy has had this dairy business for several years, and he now has property which he inherited from his parents. However, he does not have the necesary capital to build up his business and for the neighbours in his community to benefit. This project is very interesting for him.

Roy is now requesting a micro loan of ¢500.000 (five hundred thousand colons) for the purchase of construction materials for his dairy. In doing so, he hopes to expand his business, as his goal is to have a better place to work where he can settle down with his animals and improve his quality of life and that of his family.

Roy is a member of the Empresa de Crédito Comunal de Delirio, one of the 110 member organizations of EDESA in Costa Rica. This will be his first loan, and with it he hopes to continue growing on a personal and economic level, as well as participating actively in his community's credit organization.

loans.use: to build a dairy

loans.name: Harriet

texts.en: Harriet is 39 years old and is married with 3 children aged 3 to 8. She lives in her own house in Hoima, Uganda. She has been operating a motorcycle business for 6 years and this has facilitated payment of school fees for her children. Her major hardships include the failure of hired drivers to remit their weekly earnings on time and mechanical breakdown. Her dream is to own at least three motorcycles. Harriet wants the money to repair her motorcycle..

loans.use: to repair her motorcycle.

loans.name: Mira

texts.en:
This is Mira, 45. She is a resident of Dasmariñas, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Benjamin, a jeepney (transport) operator, and is a mother to her two children. She, together with her husband and children, manages their household while operating the business.  At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Mira operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store that retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, 5-pesos worth of cooking oil or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Aside from this, they have a jeep (public utility vehicle) that her husband manages. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 1,300 Philippines pesos (php) in sales every day. 
    
To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php 12,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Mira hopes her business grows in the coming years and dreams to be able to give her children a good and high quality education through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week, where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Baterdene

texts.en: Baterdene is 31-years-old and lives with his wife in the Darhan-Uul province of Mongolia. Lender has his own well and plants his vegetable in his back yard. He started his business in 2009 by doing taxi service in the Darhan-Uul province. He has already gained recognition from his clients and customers. He is planning to upgrade his car due to the condition of his present car. He is a hardworking and diligent man who says, "I have a plan to expand my business by participating in local transport tender." He is requesting a 2,300,000 MNT loan to buy a new car for his taxi business.

loans.use: To buy a new car.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to source farming inputs such as seeds and fertilizer at low prices for the 2012 planting season

loans.name: Rita

texts.en: Rita has 4 children with her husband, who is a driver by profession. She sells cooked rice and also sells provisions at Takoradi. Rita’s income is used to help pay the school fees of the children. Rita will use the loan to obtain rice and provisions to sell. With the new profits from her expanded business, Rita plans to stock the provision shop.

loans.use: to obtain rice and provisions to sell.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is a 26-year-old married woman and has one child, not in school. Rose has had a business of selling charcoal in Yei, South Sudan for 4 years.

Rose requested this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase charcoal. She says that the extra income from this loan will help her to build a house in the future.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal for sale

loans.name: Luis Fernando

texts.es:
Luis, es un joven soltero de 21  años de edad,  él se dedica a brindar el servicio de transporte el joven eligio este tipo de trabajo ya que le gusta tratar con la gente y porque le parece muy rentable.

Luis vive y trabaja en Ica, Perú. Ica is located in the Sechura Desert about four hours south of Lima, the country's capital, and is hailed by Peruvians as "The Land of the Sun." It is known in Peru for its frequent earthquakes (an 8.4 in 2001 and 8.0 in 2007), its production of grapes, asparagus, and olives, and perhaps most notably, as the source of Peruvian's traditional national drink, Pisco. In this hot, arid climate we find the client's home and business.

Luis es un joven trabajador luchador , responsable y muy trabajador con muchas ganas de salir adelante. Luis empezó a brindar este servicio en el año 2007 , gana semanalmente  un promedio de S/.315 nuevos soles. Con el préstamo de S/. 1000 soles que recibirá gracias a KIVA, Luis invertirá este crédito para la darle mantenimiento general a su moto,. El  sueño del Joven Luis es tener su propia empresa de colectivos  y hacer crecer su negocio para que en futuro llegue a  ser un gran empresario de Transportes y para darle una mejor calidad de vida a su Madre ya que ella sufre de la enfermedad de diabetes, su asesor cree es que un excelente cliente y que pagara sus cuotas puntualmente .
texts.en:
Luis is 21 years old and single.  He has a transport business and chose this line of work because he enjoys talking to people and believes this business is very profitable.

Luis lives and works in Ica, Perú. Ica is located in the Sechura Desert about four hours south of Lima, the country's capital, and is hailed by Peruvians as "The Land of the Sun." It is known in Peru for its frequent earthquakes (an 8.4 in 2001 and 8.0 in 2007), its production of grapes, asparagus, and olives, and perhaps most notably, as the source of Peruvian's traditional national drink, Pisco. In this hot, arid climate we find the client's home and business.

Luis is a very responsible, hard-working young man who wants to get ahead.  He began his business in 2007 and earns an average 315 PEN per week.  The 1,000 PEN he receives from KIVA will be used for general maintenance of his motortaxi.  Luis would like to have his own long-distance taxi business some day so he can give his mother a better lifestyle.  She suffers from diabetes.  Luis is considered to be an excellent borrower who makes his loan payments on time.

loans.use: To pay for general maintenance for his motortaxi.

loans.name: Stella

texts.en:
This 40 year old married woman, hit the ground running in her cosmetics sales business at the beginning of last year.  It was however not until the middle of last year that everything got in its stride.  She still has to bear with the fact that she has few items to sell at her outlet, but she is not in the least apprehensive.  Stella says she is determined to succeed, despite the odds stacked against her.
From its humble beginnings, Stella's business has been making gradual inroads as more and more clients become partial to her good service delivery. 
Stella is a laid back, light hearted and down to earth woman, who is also a proud mother of three buoyant kids who are all in school and doing well. 

At her outlet, she sells hair products, petroleum jelly, hair oils and other cosmetics.
Stella wants to open better horizons for her business once she gets this loan.  Her hope is that she will be able to expand into offering beauty salon services in the not so far future.
Her sales income is about UGX 40,000 weekly.
Stella also has a side income from a small farming business.
Stella will use her loan to purchase more cosmetics and hair products to resell.

loans.use: to purchase more cosmetics and hair products to resell.

loans.name: Gerardine

texts.en: Gerardine is 27 years old and has five children aged between 3 and 5. For the past 3 years, she has worked with her husband selling meat. Geraldine has requested this loan to buy cows for slaughtering to get meat to sell. She expects to use the profits generated from this loan to build another house. She dreams of reaching 2 million RWF of capital.

loans.use: To buy more cows for slaughtering for meat

loans.name: Esther

texts.es: La señora Esther  cuenta con domicilio propio, se dedica al tejido de chambras (chompas de bebe) a mano, vive con su esposo, este mismo esta tramitando su jubilación, viven solos los dos en su casa, mientras tramita se jubilación el esposo de la señora Esther es ella quien esta manteniendo su hogar ya que corre con todos los gastos incluso con los gastos de la tramites, el crédito lo necesita para comprar variedad de lanas y así  tejer otro tipo de ropa de bebe para poder diversificar su oferta de prendas, estas mismas las vende en los distintos mercados de la ciudad d Cochabamba, también entrega según pedidos ya que  deja a clientes ya asiduos de la señora, la Sra. es una persona muy trabajadora se siente feliz por la oportunidad que le brindan ya que esta es su única fuente de ingresos.
texts.en:
Esther owns her house and works knitting “chambras” (baby sweaters) by hand.  She lives with her husband who is processing his retirement.  The two of them live alone in their house.  While her husband is processing his retirement, Esther is the household’s sole source of support since all the expenses, including the retirement paperwork, is her responsibility.

She needs the loan to buy a variety of yarn so that she can knit another type of baby clothes so that she can diversify her offerings which she sells in various markets in the city of Cochabamba; she also sells based on prior orders from her regular customers.  She is a very hardworking woman who feels happy about the opportunity she’s being offered since this is her only source of income.

loans.use: to buy yarn.

loans.name: Ama

texts.en: Ama  is married and has no children. Ama produces palm oil for sale  at Ankako, which she has done to some time. Her husband is a farmer. Ama uses her income to help her husband to pay their utility bills. Ama will use the loan to buy more palm fruit for the production of palm oil for sale. With the new profits from her business, Ama plans to produce more palm oil.

loans.use: buy more palm fruit for the production of palm oil for sale

loans.name: Persévérance Group

texts.fr: Le groupe LA PERSÉVÉRANCE est composé de trois personnes qui sont dans le même groupe de tontine. C'est la première fois que ce groupe sollicite l'aide financier de ALIDé, afin d'élever le niveau de leur activité. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Anondé Jacqueline est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo, et a très peu fréquenté l’école. Anondé Jacqueline est âgée de 35 ans et vit au Bénin. Anondé Jacqueline est mariée à un chauffeur du nom de Isaac. Le couple a quatre enfants, dont certains scolarisés et tous à leur charge. Les diverses charges de la famille sont supportées par le couple. Pour cette raison, Anondé Jacqueline vend depuis dix ans du riz et du gari (farine de manioc). Anondé Jacqueline s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaire et son revenu, Anondé Jacqueline ensemble avec les membres du  groupe LA PERSÉVÉRANCE, sollicite un premier crédit auprès de  ALIDé.

loans.use: Acheter des bassine de gari et des sacs de riz.

loans.name: Mushviq

texts.en: Mushviq has been married for 10 years. He is 31 years old and has two children. One of them is  6 years old daughter who is in the primary school and the other is 2 years old. His wife is a housewife. His family is an IDP (Internally Displaced Persons) from Fuzuli city and now they are living in Baku region. Mushviq started a café business three months ago. He wants to buy tables and chairs for his cafe. Now he needs his first loan in the amount of  2000 AZN (Azerbaijan New Manat). In the future he wants to increase the size of the cafe and his monthly income. He also want to provide a better future for his children.

loans.use: to buy tables and chairs for his cafe

loans.name: Ilham

texts.en:
Ilham has been engaged in this business for 2 years. He has his own  grocery store. This single man was born in 1979 in Salyan region Yenikand village. He is hard worker. Having borrowed the loan amount of $200 from Komak Credit Union he built the grocery store .The second time he borrowed $400 and bought foodstuffs: sugar, tea, rice and etc.
Now he wants to expand the area of his grocery store and to buy the foodstuffs .He is very optimistic about the future of his business.

loans.use: to buy foodstuffs

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Faith Naserian would like to buy different varieties of bead materials for her business.

loans.name: Tati

texts.en: Tati  is 43 years old, and is married with one daughter. To supplement her husband’s income, Tati sells various snacks in her small store at the front of her house. She also sells clothes on credit by going around her village. In a day Tati can earn $5 and eventually she can earn about $100 in a month. She needs a loan of $100 to buy more goods to sell and thus approximately double her income so that she and her family can have a better life.

loans.use: To buy more goods

loans.name: Chum

texts.en:
Mrs. Chum L. is 44 years old and lives with her husband in Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. Her husband is an intermediary. He buys motorcycles and resells them near an open-air market where he usually makes up to $10 each day. Mrs. Chum L. stays at home and has to take care of her eight children.

Her husband would like to increase his inventory by adding more motorcycles, but she faces financial constrains. As a result, this couple is now requesting a loan to help the growth of their business.

loans.use: Needs to increase inventory of motorcycles

loans.name: Tuy

texts.en:
Mrs. Tuy P. is a 30-year-old housewife living in the Kampong Cham Province of Cambodia with her 31-year-old husband and their two children (both students). Her husband earns $5.50 a day selling the bananas that he grows on a small plot of land .

Tuy P. would like to use this loan to purchase a plot of land so that her husband can grow more crops. She intends to use the rest of the money to purchase a motorcycle so that he can more effectively transport his crops to market.

loans.use: to purchase a plot of land and a motorcycle to transport crops

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy merchandise and make improvements to his store

loans.name: Tahira

texts.en: I am a very ambitious entrepreneur. After my husband’s accident, when he had to quit his business due to serious injuries I became determined to make my business a success and provide for my five children. I make and sell blankets. I also contract women in my neighborhood to help me with the work. My husband obtains orders from the markets and then buys the necessary materials including cloth and threads etc for us to make blankets. I have being very good at my work and I make decent profit out of this business. Please lend me $675 to expand my business, because it is a high season and demand for blankets has risen sharply. I intend to save the extra profits for my daughter’s marriage who is already engaged.

loans.use: Expand business

loans.name: Olinda

texts.es:
Olinda, member of the Communal Bank for Enterprising Women, lives in Moyobamba in the San Martín region of Peru. Her business is located in a popular market where she has sold desserts, fresh cheese and yogurt for the past four years. She is very well known for having high-quality products, which has allowed her to generate a strong clientele.

With the $425 loan, which she'll pay back in six months, she will purchase milk by the liter to prepare the cheeses and yogurt, and she will also buy flour and sugar by the sack, eggs, oil, butter and other products to help make the various popular desserts of the region.

She is 62 years old, widowed, and has six children, all who live on their own. She likes he work, but her goal is to have a well-stocked clothing and convenience store.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

La señora Olinda, socia del Banco Comunal Mujeres Emprendedoras, vive en la región San Martín provincia y distrito de Moyobamba. El negocio está ubicado en el mercado Ayaymaman donde comercializa, desde hace 4 años, dulces, queso fresco y yogurt. Es muy conocida por brindar productos de muy buena calidad, lo que le ha servido para ganarse una buena clientela. Con el préstamo de S/.1,200.00, el cual pagará en 6 meses, comprará leche de vaca en litros para la preparación de los quesos y yogurt, además comprará harina y azúcar en sacos, huevos en jabas, aceite en litros, mantequilla en paquetes y otros productos para la preparación de variados dulces propios de la región. La señora Estela tiene 62 años, es viuda y tiene 6 hijos, todos ellos independientes. Le gusta el trabajo que hace pero anhela tener una tienda de abarrotes y vestidos bien surtida.

loans.use: Purchase milk, flour, sugar, eggs, etc.

loans.name: Jumanazar

texts.ru:
Jumanazar H. lives in Qurgan-Tube. He is 50 years old, married and has 2 children. Jumanazar has a college degree in engineering. He works at hydroelectric power station Sangtuda. In addition, for 12 years, Jumanazar has been engaged in cattle farming. He buys, raises and then resells cattle at the local market. Jumanazar plans to use this loan to purchase additional animals. He plans to repay the loan within 6 months.

Translated from Russian by Aleksandr Zhuk, Kiva Volunteer.

Хаитбоев Джуманазар житель города Курган- Тюбе. Возраст 50 лет , женат имеет 2 детей. Образование высшее, по специальности инженер. Работает на ГЭС Сангтуда. Кроме того занимается животноводством. Планирует получить кредит для покупки крупно рогатого скота. После покупки животных клиент откармливает их и перепродает жителям своей местности, что помогает покупателям и продавцу не тратить деньги на транспорт до рынка. Опыт в этой сфере клиент имеет 12 лет. Погасить кредит клиент планирует за 6 месяцев.

loans.use: To purchase young bulls

loans.name: Rebeca Argentina

texts.es:
Rebeca is 33 years old, single, doesn’t have children, and lives in the Unidad de Propósito neighborhood, with her mother whom she takes care of with much love. In order to make a living, for the past 4 years she has been selling clothing and shoes for children, teens, and adults of all ages as a traveling salesperson. With her small income she earns from selling to people in their homes she has been able to cover her household expenses and basic needs. The type of business and Rebeca’s pleasant personality have enabled her to gain a good number of faithful customers that also buy from her and ask her to acquire various personal use products such as perfumes and cosmetics. Rebeca hopes in a few years to put a store in her home, where she will be able to take care of her mother and be able to grow her microbusiness. Today she has little merchandise and has many orders for clothing, so she is asking for a loan to buy summer merchandise, clothing for women, children, and men, sunscreen, perfume, as these are the products her customers are asking for at this time.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

Doña Rebeca tiene 33 años, es una joven soltera, no tiene hijos y habita en el barrio Unidad de Propósito, con su madre a quien cuida con mucho amor. Para ganarse la vida hace 4 años se dedica a vender de manera ambulante ropa y zapatos para niños, jóvenes y adultos de todas las edades, los ingresos de su pequeño negocio a domicilio le ha permitido cubrir los gastos de su casa y llevar una vida humilde pero sin carencias. El tipo de negocio con el que cuenta la señora y su agradable personalidad le ha permitido capturar un buen número de clientes fieles que siempre le compran y le encargan diversos productos de uso personal como perfumes y cosméticos. La señora espera en unos años montar su tienda en su casa, en donde le permita cuidar de su madre y de esta forma poder ir creciendo como microempresaria. En estos momentos posee poca mercadería en existencia y cuenta con varios encargos de ropa, la señora solicita un préstamo para comprar mercadería de verano para esta época, ropa para dama, niños y varón y cremas protectoras de sol, perfumes, siendo estos los productos que más demandan en esta época sus clientes.

loans.use: Purchase clothing for men and women, children's shoes, and perfume.

loans.name: Rukia's Upendo Center Group

texts.en:
Rukia is 35 years old and is divorced. She takes care of 1 person, age 56. Rukia is a firewood seller; she started her business in 2007. Every day she works from 6:00 AM to 7:00 PM at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $50 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more firewood for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup member Tajiri, who has a business dealing in fish selling.

loans.use: To buy more firewood for her business

loans.name: Sheiku

texts.en: Sheiku S. is 52 years old and has been working as a teacher for 35 years.  With his small salary, he could not save enough to build a house for the family.  It took him years to save to be able to purchase the blocks.  A friend  who accesseda loan from Kiva told Sheiku about the Kiva program and he approached SMT and  requested a loan of $350 to purchase Iron sheets and doors to complete the construction.  He  hopes is to complete the house for the family to have sufficient living space.  Sheiku will repay the loan from his monthly salary.  He is married with eight children.

loans.use: Purchase Iron sheets and doors for completing the construction of the family house.

loans.name: Kong

texts.en: Mrs. Kong S. lives in Krang Sromor Village in Kampong Chhnang Province. She is a subsistence farmer and a vegetable seller. She also sells fish. Her husband, Mr. Pin Boch, is a farmer and a construction worker. They have three children, two of whom are attending a local school while the youngest one is too young to work or enroll in school. The whole family relies on Mrs. Kong S. and her husband. They would like to build a new house to replace an old one, and are requesting a loan for this purpose.

loans.use: To buy more lumber to build a house.

loans.name: Ama Egnonam

texts.fr:
Born on March 16, 1974 in Atakpamé, Togo, Mrs. Ama Egnonam O. now lives in Lomé and is married with two children. She never received an education, but she knows how to get by in life. Starting in 2004, she got into the charcoal business, a field in which she is an expert. She learned how to make charcoal when she was young from her mother, who also made charcoal. Thus, she knows how to discern high quality charcoal, which she then offers to her customers. She buys charcoal from the surrounding villages that she then resells in Lomé. The only problem that Mrs. Ofriman has encountered is that she does not have enough money to buy sufficient quantities of charcoal. She has to travel often to buy charcoal, which increases her costs. Thus she is requesting her first loan so she can increase her working capital and decrease her costs as a result.

Translated from French by Manuel Carreiro, Kiva Volunteer

Née le 16 mars 1974 à Atakpamé au TOGO, madame O. Ama Egnonam vit aujourd’hui à Lomé, mariée et mère de deux enfants. Elle n’a jamais fréquenté mais elle sait se battre dans la vie. Depuis 2004, elle a commencé le commerce de charbon, un domaine qu’elle maîtrise très bien. En effet elle a appris à faire du charbon depuis son jeune âge auprès de sa maman qui en fabriquait. Ainsi elle sait distinguer la bonne qualité qu’elle met à la disposition de sa clientèle. Elle en achète dans les villages environnants qu’elle revend ensuite à Lomé. Le seul problème que rencontre madame OFRIMAN, c’est qu’elle ne dispose pas d’assez de fonds pour en acheter en quantité suffisante. Elle fait alors régulièrement le déplacement ce qui augmente ses charges. C’est ainsi qu’elle sollicite ce premier crédit pour augmenter son fonds de roulement afin d’amoindrie ses charges.

loans.use: Purchase of charcoal

loans.name: Kikelomo

texts.en: Kikelomo M. is 48 years old, is married, and has six children. Kikelomo sells kerosene and has been in business for over twenty years. She learned this business from her mother and she started her own business when she got married. She started by selling door-to-door around her community until the business grew to what it is now. She has lots of customers. She needs a loan of $700 to buy more kerosene to sell.

loans.use: Purchase of more kerosene to sell

loans.name: Thap

texts.en: Thap O. is a 58-year-old fisherman who works on the Tunle Sap Lake in the Sieap Reap Province of Cambodia.  He lives with his wife, Lin Shot, and two unmarried daughters (out of seven children in all), in Anlong Somnor Commune.  Together they manage a small farm and earn about $4.25 and $1.75 each day, respectively.  Many years of experience have taught Thap that good tools lead to good work, and therefore he is a requesting a loan of $375 to help him purchase a new fishing boat, which will improve his ability to catch fish on Tunle Sap Lake.

loans.use: To purchase a fishing boat.

loans.name: Felipa

texts.es:
Felipa M. vive en la Avenida Franz Tamayo, zona Villa Ingenio de la ciudad de El Alto
 
Felipa es casada y tiene una hija de 1 año, toda la familia vive en un solo cuarto que tomaron en alquiler

Ella trabaja como vendedora ambulante de mates y empanadas en horarios matinales por las calles donde se realizan ferias diariamente. 

El crédito lo destinara  para compra de insumos al por mayor, así disminuirá sus costos
 
Es su primer  crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada la califica para otorgarle el préstamo.
texts.en:
Felipa M. lives on Franz Tamayo Avenue, in the Villa Ingenio zone of the city of El Alto. Felipa is married and has a 1-year-old daughter. The whole family lives in a single room that they are renting out. She works as a street vendor, selling mates (a type of South American herbal tea) and empanadas (stuffed pastry) daily during the morning hours on the streets near the markets. The loan will be used to purchase wholesale supplies, thus she can cut down on her costs. This is her first loan with Impro. Her credit evaluation qualifies her to receive this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Work capital

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Rose C. is a single parent and has one child. She has received schooling through to junior high school. Rose sells groceries like Milo and milk. She also sells cosmetics and fabric at Atam in Cape Coast, which she has done since 1998. Rose uses her income to pay for school fees, utility bills and also food for the table. Rose will use the loan to increase her capital to buy more groceries, fabric and cosmetics for sale to meet her ever-increasing customers. With the new profits from her expanded business, Rose plans to give quality education to her child.

loans.use: To increase her capital to buy more groceries, fabric and cosmetics for sale

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary Edullanates is a 45-year old mother of 2 children and a resident of Catalunan Grande, Davao City. Her husband is  a jitney driver and her children are still attending school. Their limited income could not address all her family needs.

Mary started raising pigs as well as chickens in 1996 and supplies some of the meat retailers in the town market. Her earnings from this business have greatly helped her stretch the family income.She is requesting an additional loan of $150 from CEV to purchase more chicks, piglets and feed for her poultry.  

Mary wanted to expand her poultry and hog-raising project to augment  her income. Now she is enjoying the credit assistance, trainings as well as insurance coverage CEV offers.

loans.use: To purchase additional number of chicks, piglets and feed.

loans.name: Catana

texts.en:
Catana M. is 25 years old. She lives in the village of Carabatovca, in the Basarabeasca district. Her main activity is industry and agriculture. Her family owns 2.64 hectares of agricultural land, which it inherited from parents. They have worked this land since 2006. 

The family does not own advanced agricultural equipment. She pays for mechanized plowing and sowing, provided by a village service. They take care of the manual work themselves and hire a journeyman to help with the weeding.  This year she planted 1.5 hectares of wheat. In spring she will devote an additional 0.5 hectares to a sunflower plot. She will use the loan to pay for mechanized plowing and sowing of her wheat fields, to buy 300kg of mineral fertilizers, and to buy sunflower seeds.

loans.use: To pay for mechanized plowing and sowing and to buy fertilizers and sunflower seeds.

loans.name: Sarong

texts.en:
Mrs. Sarong T. is a villager in Dork Pong village in Takeo province. She is a coconut seller. Since her business is going well, she wants to expand it; thus, she has decided to request a loan to buy more coconuts, using the rest of the money to buy a cart to transport her coconuts to sell door-to-door. She hopes to increase her income and improve her family's living conditions with this loan.

Her husband, Mr. Pho Sokun, is a farmer who owns a piece of land where he cultivates rice. Mrs. Sarong T. is 55 years old and the mother of two children, one of whom is a worker in a petroleum station while the other is employed in a garment factory. Her husband is also presented with her in the picture.

loans.use: To buy more coconuts, using the rest of the money to buy a cart to transport her coconuts to sell door-to-door.

loans.name: Ibrohimjon

texts.en:
K. Ibrohimjon is a young man and single. He lives with his parents. The father of Ibrohimjon has been working as a cook for 20 years. Now, he has a small restaurant which has become a family business and Ibrohimjon helps his father. They serve breakfast, lunch and dinner. As their place became more popular, Ibrohimjon was able to dedicate his whole time to the business. 

Ibrohimjon wants the loan so he could invest in tables, chairs and a refrigerator. He is asking for a loan $ 800 USD with the term of 12 months. With this money, Ibrohimjon will be able to expand their family business, to earn more profit and in near future, to get married. The well being of this family is in your hands.

loans.use: To purchase tables, chairs and refrigerator for expanding his cafe business.

loans.name: Viviana

texts.es:
Viviana trabaja como artesana tiene una maquina de tejer a lana, confecciona mantas para señoras de pollera, el esposo es empleado en una empresa de carga. Ellos tienen dos hijos, no tiene casa propia y viven en la casa de sus padres ubicada en la zona Loreto de la Ciudad de El Alto.

El crédito lo destinara para la compra de materia prima (lana) de esa forma podrá satisfacer la cantidad de demanda que tiene en su mercado.
 
Es el primer crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada califica para la aprobación del préstamo solicitado por la prestataria.
texts.en:
Viviana works as an artisan. Working on her own loom, she makes traditional woolen blankets and ponchos for local women. Her husband works for a shipping company.She and her husband have two children but do not have their own home. Currently, they live with Viviana's parents in Loreto, in the city of El Alto. This loan will be used to buy wool so that Viviana can satisfy the demand that exists for her products. This is her first loan from Impro, but she has been fully evaluated as a client and has been deemed eligible for the loan she is requesting.

Translated from Spanish by Sara Sultan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy wool

loans.name: Santos Sabina

texts.es:
La señora Santos Sabina P. P.  tiene 29 años de edad, vive en el distrito de Moche, provincia de Trujillo, departamento de La Libertad.
Ella estudio hasta el 2do año de educación secundaria, tiene 2 hijos los cuales dependen económicamente de ella.
Santos, se dedica al diseño y confección de manualidades  así como a la venta de productos de belleza. El negocio ha ido variando inicio haciendo carteras de allí adornos en macramé , los cuales los vende a personas o clientes conocidos, el negocio lo desarrolla en su casa.
Con el primer crédito de 300 soles, que recibió de su Banco Comunal “Santa Lucia II”, lo invirtió para adquirir los productos de belleza y materiales para manualidades.
Con el crédito de 800 soles , que será cancelado en 6 meses, lo invertirá en la compra de telas para sus manualidades, así como en útiles para sus hijos.
Santos tiene como sueño, instalar un taller de manualidades y brindarle recreación a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Señora Santos Sabina P. P. is 29 years old and lives in the Moche district, in Trujillo province, in the apartment La Libertad. She studied in high school for two years and has two children that are economically dependent on her.

Santos designs and makes handicrafts, as well as sells beauty products. The business has diversified. At first she sold purses adorned with macrame. She sold them to people or established customers. The business was based in her home. With the first loan of 300 Soles from the Communal Bank "Santa Lucia II" she bought beauty products and materials for handicrafts. With this loan for 800 soles, that will be repaid over 6 months, she will buy fabric for her handicrafts, as well as supplies for her children.

Santos dreams of opening a handicraft workshop and allowing her children recreational time.

Translated from Spanish by Rebecca Morey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a variety of fabric and supplies for her children

loans.name: Rayhonoy

texts.ru: Райхоной – молодая женщина 32 лет, замужем и мать 3-х детей. Её муж занимается купле -продажей скота на скотном рынке. А она откармливает крупнорогатый скот дома. У нее есть одна дойная корова и два быка. Конечно ей трудно смотреть сразу за 3-мя детьми и еще делать домашнюю работу, но ей приходится, чтобы хоть немного заработать деньги. Она помогает мужу в развитии его бизнеса. За счет займа они хотят увеличить количество скота и развивать свой бизнес.
texts.en:
Rayhonoy is a young woman of 32 years of age, married and is a mother of three children. Her husband is buying and reselling cattle on the cattle market and she feeds the cattle at home. She has one milk cow and two calves. Of course it is difficult for her to watch after three children at once and also do housework, but she has to do it to earn just a little bit of money. She helps her husband in the development of his business. She wants to use the loan to increase the amount of cattle and expand their business.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To expand business

loans.name: Amparo Del Socorro

texts.es: La Señora Amparo del Socorro C. Jarquín tiene la edad de 60 años, su estado civil es casada. Doña Amparo tiene 4 hijos y todos trabajan. Su actividad económica es la comercialización de mercadería en general. Hace más de 11 años que se dedica a este negocio. Ya que cuando inicio fue con muy pocos productos, como pinturas y ropa para niños. La ubicación del negocio de Amparo es de manera ambulante, y con el tiempo decidió incrementar su mercadería. Por lo que recurre a Fundación León 2000 y las organizaciones amigas ya que solicita es para capital de trabajo y así realizar la compra de los productos como pantalones, camisas, faldas, bolsos y cosméticos. El sueño de Amparo es establecer un negocio en su casa de habitación para ofrecer a sus clientes un mejor servicio.
texts.en:
Señora Amparo del Socorro C. Jarquín is 60 and married. She has 4 children, all of whom are working. She has sold general merchandise for more than 11 years. When she started, she had very few products like paintings and children's clothing. She works as a street vendor and has increased her amount of merchandise over time. She is turning to Fundación León 2000 so she can increase her working capital and purchase products like pants, shirts, skirts, bags, and cosmetics. Amparo's dream is to establish her business in her home so she can offer her customers better service.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Baroat

texts.ru: Ашрафова Бароат 1970 года рождения ,  имеет семью 2 детей. Закончив школу сидела дома, на поступление в университет денег не хватило, после замужества муж  также был против работы. Со временем когда дети подросли жить стало трудно и дорого.  Уговорив мужа начала торговать нитками , иглами и детской одеждой. В Микроинвест обратилась 2006 году. На рынке торгует более 10 лет.
texts.en:
Baroat A. was born in 1970. She is married and has 2 children. After graduating high school, Baroat stayed at home having no money to go to college. After she got married, Baroat's husband was against her going to work. Later, as Baroat's children were growing up, living become more difficult and expensive. Baroat persuaded her husband to let her start a business. For more than 10 years, she has been selling sewing supplies and clothing for children at a local market. Baroat has been a MicroInvest client since 2006.

Translated from Russian by Aleksandr Zhuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase store inventory

loans.name: Hardyal

texts.en:
Hardyal has recently started a recycling business that exports scrap metal to India. He is quite fulfilled in his business because he sees it as a win-win situation. There is a high surplus of scrap metal in the U.S. and a high demand for scrap metal to be used for construction in India. 

Hardyar came to ACCION USA to find the capital for start-up costs and was approved for a loan. This is his first loan through ACCION USA and he plans to expand very soon. He enjoys this work because it comes easily to him and he loves to be able to set and achieve his own goals for his business. 

Thanks to the flexibility of his job as a cab driver, he has time to find metal through the internet and create a contract with business partners in India to buy the metal. Business has gotten off to a good start, he says. He trusts that within the next two years it will be booming and he can take it on full-time.

loans.use: To purchase scrap metal

loans.name: Hiqoyat

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 


Пулатова Хикоят- женщина  1961-го года рождения, замужем , имеет 4-х детей. Год  назад  её муж Шокиров Абдусалим  вернулся  из  Российской  Федерации,  куда  он  ездил  на  заработки.  На  вырученные  деньги  они  с  женой  решили  заняться  куплей  и  продажей  скота. В  начале  бизнеса  у  них  было  небольшое  количество  скота.  Узнав  про  нашу  организацию  Пулатова Хикоят   обратилась  к  нам  за  кредитом  для  расширения  своего  товарооборота.  Сейчас  она  может  купить   двух  бычков  по  хорошей  цене.  Она благодарна КИВА за подержкую.
texts.en:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand” “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan.

Hiqoyat P. is a woman born in 1961, married and has four children. One year ago her husband Abdusalim Shokirov returned from the Russian Federation where he went as a laborer. Together with his wife they decided to use the earnings to start buying and selling cattle. In the beginning of their business they had a very small amount of cattle. Once they found out about our organization Hiqoyat P. has come to us for a loan to increase the circulation of cattle. Right now she can buy two calves for a good price. She is thankful to Kiva for the support.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy two calves

loans.name: Rosa Maria

texts.es: La Señora Rosa María B. C.. Tiene la edad de 31 años su actividad económica es la venta de  ropa ambulante, vende sus productos sus comarcas, por lo que todos los días, se levanta muy temprano para vender todos los días y retorna a su hogar muy cansada y agotada. Hace más de 10 años que se dedica a este negocio. Cuando Rosa dio inicio a este negocio no tenía mucho tiempo para dedicarle a esta actividad, ya que tenía que brindarle la atención necesaria para sus hijos por la tarde. Es una madre muy responsable por lo que esta realizando este tipo de sacrificios para que sus hijos logren asistir a la universidad. El préstamo que solicita es para invertir en su negocio. Su deseo es que sus hijos logren finalizar sus estudios.
texts.en:
Mrs. Rosa Maria B. C.. She is 31 years of age and her economic activity is the sale of clothes as a walking saleswoman. She sells her clothes throughout the area, she gets up early every day to sell and returns to her home very tired and exhausted. She has been working in this business for over 10 years. When Rosa began this business she did not have much time to devote to this activity, since she had the responsibility of caring for her children in the afternoon. She is a very responsible mother and because of this, she is making a sacrifice to help her children attend college. The loan she is seeking is to invest in her business. Her dream is that her children succeed in completing their studies.

Translated from Spanish by Mariana Hungria, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital for her business

loans.name: Zaujath

texts.en:
Zaujath is a member of the Upendo North borrower group in Kinyanambo, Iringa. She is 29 years old, married, and the mother of 2 children. Her children are aged 8 and 3 years. She also cares for 2 other dependents.

Zaujath started her own business selling chicken 5 years ago. She works 12 hours a day and earns a monthly profit of approximately 60,000 Tanzania shillings.

This is Zaujath’s first loan from BRAC Tanzania. She has requested 300,000 Tsh in order to buy more chickens. With the additional profit she gains from the use of this loan, Zaujath hopes to save money and expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more chickens

loans.name: Fustina

texts.en:
Fustina B. is married and has two children. She has received schooling through junior high school.

Fustina has a small grocery shop where she sells tinned tomatoes and oil at Essuman near Secondi, which she has done since 2007. Her husband is an electrician. Fustina uses her income to assist her husband with the family's expenses.

Fustina will use the loan to expand her business by buying more groceries for resale. With the new profits from her expanded business, she plans to reinvest.

Fustina was out of stock at the moment the picture was taken so she gathered a few samples of what she trades in.

loans.use: To expand her business by buying  more grocery items

loans.name: Adilia Del Socorro

texts.es: Adilia del Socorro A. Juárez tiene 50 años. Su actividad económica a la que se dedica es la venta de cerdo. Hace más de 12 años que se dedica a este negocio. Por lo que sus inicios fueron muy difíciles ya que no tenía muchas personas que le ayudaran con este negocio, además Adilia ha sufrido muchos desafíos como lo fue poco espacio que tenía en su vivienda, ya que no tenía mucho espacio para mantener a sus cerdos, por lo que  buscaba la venta de manera inmediata, algunas veces tenía que venderlos a un precio mucho más bajo y esto le generaba pocos ingresos pero, con el paso del tiempo fue logrando ampliar su vivienda. Ahora solicita un financiamiento para capital de trabajo para la compra de cerdo y alimentos ya que este es muy caro. Su deseo es proporcionarle mejoras a su vivienda

loans.use: capital de trabajo

loans.name: Leah

texts.en: Leah A. is a 27-year-old mother of three school-age children.  Her husband is employed with a power generating company.  She lives with her family in Manyatta Kisumu, Kenya.  She is the proprietor of a salon which she started in 2006.  Due to her limited resources, she has not been able to acquire essential equipment and the materials needed for her business.  This has affected her ability to service her clients as well as her income. She has applied for a loan of 20,000 KES to enable her to acquire the necessary materials so she can improve her business.

loans.use: Buy stock of cosmetics

loans.name: Prisca

texts.en:
Prisca A. is now 63 years old and happily married to her husband Eusebio A. now 68 years old. In the long years of their marriage they were blessed with plenty of childrens and all of them are now in the legal age. Most of them attain a low level of education because most of them are only a high school graduate. This is one of the frustrations of Prisca as well as her husband. She doesn’t want this to happen to her grandchildren that is why they’ll do their best to improve their way of living.

Main source of their income now is her variety store business so she wants this to grow more to give them enough income for their big expenses. When she joined Kiva field partner Ahon sa Hirap Inc. (ASHI she use her first loan to her variety store. Now she wants again to use her second loan for her variety store, she will buy things that really needed in the store for selling like different groceries.

Now, one really dreams of Prisca is to turn her variety store into a grocery store that sell more items and goods for them to earn more income for them to build a big and stable house for their big family, for them to move and rest comfortable. And also she wants her neighborhood to benefit to it if this happen, they will never go to a far place just to buy the things they needed.

loans.use: To finance her variety store business

loans.name: Edwin

texts.en:
Edwin F. is from the village of Madasigon, Suarez. He is 36 years old and single. To make a living, Edwin owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector. The main source of income for the business comes from selling mineral water. Edwin has been engaged in his business for over four years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2009, Edwin joined Kiva partner HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Edwin is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be his first from HSPFI.

About HSPFI
HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Joao

texts.pt:
João Manhiça nasceu em Boane, Província de Maputo, tem 42 anos de idade, casado e pai de 4 filhos de 22, 18,12 e 06 anos de idade, todos vão a escola. Fez 7ª classe apenas, não foi possível continuar na altura devido a guerra. Vive numa casa própria, com a família e a sua mãe.

Saiu do bairro da Massaca (pertencente ao mesmo distrito) para a vila de Boane no tempo de Guerra. Actualmente trabalha como serralheiro mecânico condutor tarefas que aprendeu na escola de artes e ofícios na Moamba há 18 anos. Tem um rendimento mensal de cerca de 5.000.00mt e poupa algum no banco, depois de todas despesas de casa. 

Nunca teve empréstimos com outras instituições de crédito, conheceu a Hluvuku através de sua irmã, que também é cliente desta instituição. Este é o seu 1º empréstimo no valor de 13.000.00mt, com o qual pretende comprar material de construção (cimento, areia, ferro e barrotes) para fazer a sua casa e uma oficina de trabalho.

Compromete se a pagar devidamente o empréstimo, para poder aceder a mais créditos e finalizar as suas obras.
texts.en:
João Manhiça was born in Boane, Maputo Province, in Mozambique. He is 42 years old, married and the father of four children aged 22, 18, 6 and 6, all of them students. He finished 7th grade but couldn't keep studying because of the war. He lives on his own house with his family and his mother. He works as a millwright and makes 5.000,00MT (U$170) and after covering his household expenses, he still saves some money. This is his first loan and his asking for 13.000,00MT (U$450) in order to buy construction supplies (cement, sand, iron, etc) to build his house and a workshop. He hopes to pay this loan without a problem.

Translated from Portuguese by Mariana Dauwe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of Construction Supplies

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase used clothes in bulk

loans.name: Bomkapre

texts.en:
This is Bomkapre K.. She is a 40-year-old married from So-so Town Lane in Waterloo. She has four children: two boys and two girls; two are in secondary school, and the rest two are in primary school.

Bomkapre has been a LAPO client for some time now and has taken two previous loans. She is a member of a LAPO union (a credit group that acts as a collective collateral and guarantor). This is the first loan she will be receiving with the help of Kiva lenders.

Bopmkapre sells her fish in the village market. With her previous loans she expanded her business by purchasing additional stocks of fish. With her new loan, she hopes to add more fish to her business and expand even more.

loans.use: To purchase more fish to sell

loans.name: Alai

texts.en:
Alai M. is currently in the business of selling fresh vegetables at the market and is requesting a loan to stock bags of beans, maize flour and rice to sell. Alai is 28 years old and is married to a soldier. She has four children and her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to pay school fees for her children.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To stock bags of beans, maize flour and rice to sell

loans.name: Thoeun

texts.en: Mr. Thoeun C. and his wife are both are shown in the photo. This young couple has been married a year and hope to have their first child next year.  In order to earn enough to support a family, Thoeun C. and his wife work at a garment factory, earning over $200 a month, and Thoeun C. also hopes to invest in a new enterprise in order to make his family income more stable. Thoeun C. requests a $700 loan which he will use to buy rice in bulk to resell at a profit.

loans.use: To buy rice in bulk for resale.

loans.name: Betty's Group

texts.en:
L. Betty is the leader of her lending group in Lugazi. She is married with three children ages 16-22 years old, who are all in school, and she takes care of her siblings.

Betty has a retail shop on the Lugazi market street and although there is a lot of competition from other sellers, she is able to make 50,000/= (shillings) as weekly profits that help her sustain her family, with the help of her husband.

Betty is so grateful for her loans because they enable her to have increased stock as well as having quality products for sale. She sells carpets and bags in her shop plus belts and she would need a loan to be able to restock her shop.

loans.use: To buy more carpets and bags for increased stock.

loans.name: Borei

texts.en:
Mrs. Borei Y. is a farmer who owns a small piece of land to cultivate rice to earn a living. Her husband, Mr. Sun Mao, helps her with the farm. Mrs. Borei Y. is the mother of four children who are all attending the local school. They live in Roneam Tnaot village in Takeo province. 

Mrs. Borei Y. now faces a small problem, because her field has infertile soil, so she decided to ask for a loan to buy more fertilizers to support the field and produce a larger crop. She will use the rest of the loan to buy rice seeds to cultivate during the dry season.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and rice seeds

loans.name: Mamadou

texts.fr: Monsieur Mamadou S. est un tailleur qui habite dans la localité  de Camberene. Il exerce cette activité depuis plus de 30 ans. Il est sociétaire de la caisse de l’U-IMCEC Camberene depuis aout 2002 et  a déjà rembourse 7 prêts antérieurs. Il sollicite un crédit de 250 000 frs .L’objectif de ce crédit est l’achat d’une seconde machine à coudre dans le but de rendre plus performante son activiste de couturier et par conséquent d’accroitre sa clientèle. L’augmentation de ses profits lui permettra de mieux prendre en charge les dépenses de survie de sa famille. Monsieur S. est marie et père de 5 enfants.
texts.en:
Mr. Mamadou S. is a tailor who lives in the village of Camberene. He has been carrying out this acitivity for more than 30 years. Since August 2002 he has been a shareholder-member of the savings bank in Camberene which belongs to the U-IMCEC (a Senegalese association of mutual loans and savings institutions), and he has already repaid seven previous loans. He is applying for a loan of 250,000 francs. The purpose of this loan is to buy a second sewing machine in order to make his sewing activity more productive and thereby enlarge his customer base. The increase in his profits will allow him to cover his family's living expenses more easily. Mr. S. is married with five children.

Translated from French by Alison Le Bras, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Investment

loans.name: 28 De Noviembre Group

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal 28 D. Noviembre, inicia su octavo ciclo con 17 socias, las socias son del Distrito D. Acosvinchos.

Las socias realizan diferentes negocios como la venta D. abarrotes en general, comida, tara, carnes, animales menores, cereales.

Como es el caso D. la señora Rosa que es casada, tiene 4 hijos y 47 años, Rosa tiene un restaurante en su casa ubicada en la plaza principal del Distrito, actividad que realiza todos los días, Rosa necesita un préstamo D. 300 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra D. arroz, azúcar.

Las socias necesitan diferentes montos D. prestamos como 300 soles, 600soles, haciendo un total D. 12,100 soles D. prestamos en el Banco Comunal. 

Sus prestamos serán invertidos en la compra D. arroz, azúcar, tara, trigo, cebada, carne, animales menores.

Los sueños D. las socias son tener casa propia, hacer crecer su negocio y brindar una buena educación a sus hijos.
texts.en:
The communal bank 28 of November began its 8th cycle with 17 members from the District of Acosvinchos. The members all work in different businesses such as sales of grocery items, meat, food, small animals and grains.

This is the case of Rosa, 47 years old and married with 4 children. Rosa has a restaurant in her house, located in the main plaza of the district. She runs her restaurant every day, and she needs her portion of the loan to purchase ingredients such as rice and sugar.

Each member needs a different amount from the total loan, such as 300 soles, 600 soles, etc. They will use their portion of the loan to invest in rice, sugar, flour, meat and small animals. The members share the dream of owning their own homes, growing their businesses and providing a good education for their children.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Charnes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase various ingredients and products to help grow their respective businesses

loans.name: Tang

texts.en:
Tang M., 56, is widowed who lives with her child in Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia.  Tang sells a variety of groceries from her home and earns about $5 per day to help cover family expenses. 

Tang's quality of living has been improving. She is requesting a loan of $1000 to purchase a printer and a photocopy machine for her child to start a business. This is her second loan from CREDIT, a partner of Kiva.

loans.use: Buy a printer and a photocopy machine.

loans.name: Yoeurn

texts.en:
Mrs. Yoeurn T., who is a villager in Kor village in Kandal province, was born in 1972. She is a housewife and her husband is a motorbike repairer in the local village who is able to earn some money from this business. Her husband is on the right in the photo.

Since her husband’s business is going well, Mrs. Yoeurn T. wants to expand it. Thus, she decided to seek a loan to buy more motorbike supplies to sell.

Through this activity, they support two children, one of whom is enrolled in the local public school, while the other is too young to go to school or work.

loans.use: To buy more motorbike supplies to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: BUYING MORE DECORATIVE ITEMS OF PLASTER TO SELL FOR MOTHERS DAY

loans.name: Ashur

texts.ru: Даминов Ашур проживает в районе Дж. Руми. Возраст, 62 года. Женат, имеет одного ребенка. Жена, домохозяйка. Сам Ашур более 20 лет занимается растениеводством. Имеет небольшой участок земли, где выращивает овощи. Кредит берет для закупа минеральных удобрений.
texts.en:
Ashur D. lives in the J. Rumy district. He is 62 years old, married and has one child. His wife is a homemaker. Ashur has been involved in agriculture for over 20 years. He has a small plot of land, where he grows vegetables. He is requesting this loan for the purchase of mineral fertilizers.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of mineral fertilizers

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase beauty products

loans.name: Priscilla

texts.en:
Priscilla is 37 years old, married with five children who are between 3 and 19 years old. Priscilla takes care of one dependent who is 20 years old; this one is a relative. Priscilla's husband is a motor bike taxi driver, and they both work hard for the development of their family. 

Priscilla owns a business selling cow meat; her business is well-known as well as organized. She employs two people as helpers so that her business runs smoothly. Priscilla has an experience of 16 years in her business and the hours of her business are from 6 in the morning to 7 in the evening every day.

Priscilla is now requesting her first loan from KIva lenders via Vision Finance Company in order to purchase many cows which will help Priscilla to satisfy many customers of cow meat. With this satisfaction, Priscilla will be able to earn more profits to be reinvested in her business.

loans.use: Expanding her business

loans.name: Abida Perveen's Group

texts.en:
Abida perveen is the wife of S. A. who has a bangles shop in the market. They live in a city called Vehari, Pakistan, and have four children, all of whom are getting their education.

Abida also sells bangles by visiting different areas of the town. Her income is good but she is facing problems of low stock these days.

Abida is applying for a loan to buy more bangles for her business. In this way she will not only increase her income but she will also be able to put aside some stock for later use.

In the photo, Shagufta, a group member, is showing clothes from her clothes business.

loans.use: To purchase more bangles to sell

loans.name: Edison Jeovanny

texts.es:
Edison Jeovanny G. R. tiene 36 años.  Es casado y vive en la Comunidad de Matilde Esther  en el cantón Chillanes provincia de Bolívar. Tiene 2 hijos, Bayron (11) y Joel (8).

Edison es un socio de la ventanilla rural Rey de Reyes, que está ubicada a hora y media de Chillanes. Son 23 socios en total, que en la mayoridad se dedican a la agricultura. Esto es el primer préstamo que ellos sacan con la Cooperativa San José.

Edison  se dedica a la agricultura, tiene sembrado cacao, naranja, piña y además tiene un bus de transporte. Realiza sus compras cada mes en la misma comunidad sus productos los vende en el Cantón Bucal cada 15 días.

Solicita el préstamo para invertir en los cultivos de cacao, naranja y piña. Piensa que el crédito es una oportunidad para salir adelante. Sus sueños son tener más producción  y tener una casa para su familia. Enfrenta desafíos como plagas. 

Le gusta caminar por los cultivos mirando el desarrollo de su producción.
texts.en:
Edison Jeovanny G. R., 36, is married and lives in Matilde Esther, Chillanes canton, Bolívar province. He has two sons: Bayron, 11, and Joel, 8. Edison is a member of the Rey de Reyes (King of Kings) communal bank which is located an hour and a half from Chillanes. It has a total of 23 members most of whom are farmers. This is the first loan they have gotten from Cooperativa San José. Edison is a cacao, orange and pineapple farmer. He also has a bus for transportation. He makes his purchases monthly in his same community and sells his products every two weeks in Bucal canton. He is asking for funds to invest in his cacao, orange and pineapple crops. He feels that the loan is a way of getting ahead. His dream is to have more production and to have a home for his family. He faces challenges like pests. He enjoys walking among his plants observing their development.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To invest in cacao, orange and pineapple crops.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy farming supplies such as fertilizer,  insecticides, etc.

loans.name: Faith

texts.en:
Faith T. is from the village of Poblacion 4, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 28 years old. Faith is single. To make a living, Faith owns & operates a business providing motor transport "habal-habal" services. Faith has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Faith joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Faith has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from GDMPC. Faith is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP, which will be used to repair an existing vehicle for better service. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Faith from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To repair existing vehicle for better service

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
Elena B. is from the village of Soyung Echague. She is 53 years old, married, and has four adult-aged children. To make a living, she makes and sells snacks such as juice, pancit  (noodles), banana cue (deep-fried banana covered with carmelized brown sugar) and others to the local members of the community. Elena has been engaged in her business for over thirty years and earns approximately $88 a month for these activities.

In 2010, Elena joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be her 1st loan from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful micro-finance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Khit's Group

texts.en:
This group loan has four members who live in Trapeang Roka village in Takeo province. Mrs. Khit S. is the group leader, born in 1948 and selected by the other members who will each use their portion of the loan for different purposes. She and her husband are farmers who own a 2-hectare plot of land to cultivate rice on to sell to support their family. Her husband also owns an agricultural machine.

 Her problem is that her field has infertile soil, but she does not have money to amend it. So, to improve rice production, Mrs. Khit S. is seeking a loan to buy fertilizer and pesticide. She is the mother of a child who is a laborer.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and pesticide

loans.name: Elvira

texts.en:
Elvira M. is from the village of Medina, in Misamis Oriental. She is 51 years old, married, and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Elvira owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for the business comes from selling both food & daily use products, and also buying and selling gasoline in the local community. Elvira has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Elvira joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI, which was used to to purchase additional products to sell. She is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional inventory & as working capital. This will be Elvira’s 2nd loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand it. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory & as working capital

loans.name: Zainab

texts.en:
Zainab is married and has two children who are 8 and 15 years old. In 2004, Zainab established her food vending business. She began her business to  generate income, maximize her profit and educate her children. Working seven days a week and ten hours a day, she earns about Le 1,200,000 every month from this business. She would like a loan in the amount of Le 4,000,000 to purchase more goods in bulk, including rice, onions and tomatoes. Zainab plans to travel to neighboring countries to purchase these goods at a lower cost. 

She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately Le 800,000. In the future, Zainab plans to generate more income and educate her children. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To purchase more goods in bulk, including rice, onions and tomatoes

loans.name: Gregoria

texts.es:
Gregoria pertenece al banco comunal “Juntas y Unidas” D. la Asociación Arariwa D. la ciudad del Cusco y vive en la misma ciudad. Cusco es una ciudad encantadora que se remonta a los tiempos Incas. Construida en la base D. la antigua ciudad Inca. 

Gregoria tiene 63 años, es casada y fruto D. esta unión tiene cuatro hijos, ella alterna sus actividades del hogar con su pequeño negocio D. venta D. comestibles, ella tiene un tienda D. abarrotes en su domicilio donD. venD. sus productos a sus vecinos. Ya son varios años que se dedica al negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. Gregoria desprenD. una imagen D. una madre trabajadora y responsable. Con su próximo préstamo, Gregoria que espera recibir $ 500 USD. Por el momento,  desea incrementar el negocio y va comprar comestibles como por ejemplo arroz, azúcar, fideos, leche, etc.
 
Gregoria se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Gregoria belongs to the “Juntas y Unidas” (Together and United) communal bank of the Arariwa Association in the city of Cusco; she lives in the same city. Cusco is a beautiful city that goes back to Incan times; it was built in the base of the ancient Inca city.

Gregoria is 63 years old, married and through her marriage she has four children. She interchanges her activities in the home with her small business, selling foodstuffs. Gregoria has a small grocery store in her home where she sells her products to her neighbors. It has been a few years that she has been involved in this business and she does very well thanks to the hard work that she puts into her business. Gregoria is a picture of a hardworking and responsible mother.
