With the next loan that Gregoria hopes to receive of $500 USD, she hopes to expand her business and will buy foodstuffs like rice, sugar, spaghettis, milk, etc.

Gregoria is very grateful for the opportunity given to her through this medium and is committed to meet with the payments agreed according to schedule.

loans.use: She hopes to expand her business and will buy foodstuffs like rice, sugar, spaghettis, milk, etc.

loans.name: Felipe De Jesus

texts.es:
Felipe de 58 años, tiene una panadería surtida con algunos víveres de primera necesidad. Vive son su esposa en una zona urbana llamada Guasmo y caracterizada porque la mayoría de sus habitantes son comerciantes. 

Inicialmente el era albañil pero en el momento que hubo la dolarización en Ecuador se quedo sin trabajo y tuvo que trabajar con su hermano haciendo panes. Se independizo alquilando un horno para hacer panes por lo que en la actualidad trabaja en su propia panadería. Hace panes y cada uno los vende a $ 0.10cv, también ha surtido su tienda con algunos víveres de primera necesidad como arroz, enlatados, bebidas. 

El quiere comprar con el préstamo una amasadora para hacer con más rapidez lo panes ya que por ahora todo hace manual y harina. En el futuro quiere agrandar su negocio y poder construir mejor su casa.
texts.en:
Felipe is 58 years old.  He has a bakery stocked with some convenience store items.  He lives with his wife in an urban district called Guasmo which is characterized by the fact that most of its inhabitants are tradesmen and salespeople.

Initially, Felipe was a bricklayer but when dollarization occurred in Ecuador he no longer had a job and had to work with his brother baking bread.  He became independent, hiring an oven so that he could make bread.  Now he works in his own bakery.  He makes loaves of bread and sells them for $0.10.  He has also stocked his store with some convenience store items such as rice, canned goods and drinks.

He would like to use his loan to buy a kneading machine so that he can make his bread faster since right now he makes it all by hand.  In the future, he would like to expand his business and be able to  build his home a bit better.

loans.use: Kneading machine, flour, dairy products

loans.name: Heang's Group

texts.en:
Four people are sharing this group loan.  They are living in Chong Preaek village in Kandal province. Mrs. Heang S., a 29-year-old married woman, was selected as the group leader for this loan by its members.  With the loans, they hope to increase their income to improve their family. 

Mrs. Heang S. is a farmer who owns a plot of peanut field to cultivate peanut. She doesn’t have enough money to cultivate it, so she decided to ask for a loan to buy peanut seeds and to hire farming laborers to cultivate peanut. Her husband, Mr. Srou Rem, 30 years old, works as a farming laborer and also helps his wife with her farm.

This couple has two children -- one is attending the local school while the other is 5 years old and is not in school yet.

loans.use: To buy peanut seeds and hire farming laborers to cultivate peanut

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more bags of charcoal

loans.name: Ivelisse

texts.en:
Ivelisse is an entrepreneur whose business has improved as a result of a loan for her small beauty salon.  She also sells miscellaneous items, including phone cards. Ivelisse lives and does business near Hato Mayor, an agricultural area. This area, like nearly all impoverished areas of the Dominican Republic, lacks reliable electricity and potable running water. Ivelisse makes her home in a simple structure with her husband and their 4 children. 

She has had her business for about 2 years, starting when she received her first loan from Esperanza and bought her first clothing merchandise. Ivelisse plans to use this loan to invest in her business by purchasing clothes, women's handbags, and calling cards. She will use the profits to re-invest in her business, because she needs to buy a hair dryer. 

Ivelisse says that her most difficult challenge is to buy a plot of land in the town to start building a house. In the meantime she plans to continue enjoying working in her beauty salon. Her story is generally representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients (many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti).

loans.use: To buy clothing, women's handbags and phone cards

loans.name: Marcellah Longacha

texts.en:
Marcellah Longacha K. is a woman of 26 years, married and the mother of four children. Her husband is a businessman in Lodwar. She also has a business selling mobile phones and accessories in Lodwar Town. She has been in this business for two years now and makes a monthly income of 10,000 shillings.

This will be Marcellah's first loan from KADET and she plans to use the entire loan to buy different types of mobile phones and accessories for resale. With the income she makes, she wants to expand her business by buying more phones for resale. In the future she would like to be financially stable and support her family.

loans.use: To add stock, e.g., different types of mobile phones and accessories for resale

loans.name: Vizminda

texts.en:
Vizminda I. lives in the city of Panta-on, Ozamis City. She is 31 years old, married and has six school-aged children. For more than six years, she has made a living by providing transport services and makes about 2,600 PHP a month from her work.

In 2008, Vizminda joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her life and ability to engage in business. She has successfully repaid three loans from GDMPC and is applying for a new one, for 10,000 PHP, to repair her vehicle so that she can provide better service to her customers. She plans to use the additional revenue made possible by this loan to improve her family's living conditions.  

About GDMPC:
GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fishermen and women, and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partners to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to repair existing vehicle for better service

loans.name: Kirui

texts.en:
Kirui is a dairy farmer from the town of Litein in Rift Valley, Kenya, where he has been farming for eight years. He sells his milk to a local cooling plant. He also earns income selling eggs at the local market. He has requested a loan of 30,000 Kenyan shillings through Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. The extra income from this loan will enable him to pay school fees for his children and meet the basic needs of his family.

Kirui is 27 years old and married with two children, ages 1 and 3 years old.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Magda Simona

texts.es: Este cliente es originario de la comarca el jicarito, es casada, solo tiene una  hija la que estudia en la universidad en león, esta señora actualmente esta laborando en el colegio del jicarito desempeñándose como secretaria de dicho colegio, del cual tiene 11 años de laborar, además esta señora ha sido clienta desde el 2002 con los créditos convencionales, este es el segundo que obtiene atraves del convenio firmado con dicho colegio, ya que en total son 8 financiamientos los cuales le han ayudado a mejorar las condiciones y nivel de vida.
texts.en: She is originally from the community of Jicarito. She is married and she has only one daughter and she is in university at Leon. She is currently employed at the school in Jicarito, working as a secretary. She has 11 years in the position and she has also been the recipient of loans since 2002. This is the second loan she has access from Convenio through the school, and in total there have been 8 loans. They have helped her improve her living conditions and their quality of life.

loans.use: To buy school supplies and pay tuition fees.

loans.name: Fatima Gabriela

texts.es:
Fatima Gabriela M. es una joven emprendedora y dedicada a su negocio que es la venta de ropa usada america, distribuye su producto a varias personas, le encargan todas las semanas de los lugares como Duyure, El Espino, San Francisco.
Tiene un gran numero de clientes, tambien vende en su casa de habitacion.
Fatima los fines de semana hace trabajos de modista, elabora blusas, faldas, pantalones etc.
estos trabajos los realiza a varias mujeres de su comunidad, tiene mucha demanda ya que hace la ropa a la medida.
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de fardo de ropa usada.
texts.en:
Fatima Gabriela M. is an enterprising young woman whose business is selling used, American clothes.  She distributes her products to a number of people who make orders with her every week from places such as Duyure, El Espino and San Francisco.  She has a large number of customers and also makes sales from her home.

On weekends, Fatima works as a dressmaker.  She makes blouses, skirts, pants, etc.  She does this work for women in her community and has a lot of demand because her clothes are custom-made.

Fatima will use her loan to buy a bundle of used clothing.

loans.use: to buy a bundle of clothes

loans.name: Gladys Yolanda

texts.es:
GLADYS YOLANDA G. M., tiene 40 años de edad, es casada, vive con el esposo y con los  5 hijos, vive en San Miguel  en el Recinto Tangara perteneciente a la Provincia de Bolívar.

Esta Ventanillas se llama CAMPECINOS UNIDOS  esta ubicada en el recinto Tangara y se encuentra a unos 15 minutos del Cantón San Miguel, los miembros de esta ventanilla se dedican a la agricultura y al comercio.

Gladys se a la agricultura a la siembra de maiz y trigo ademas vende electrodomesticos por medio de pedidos como fuente de ingresos para la failia.Comprar sus productos en San Miguel y los vende en la Feria del mismo Cantón y los electrodomesticos los comprar en la ciudad de Guayaquil.

El crédito lo solicita para la comprar de insumos agrícolas fertilizantes y semillas ademas comprar electrodomesticos para vender, el crédito apoyado en el negocio familiar ya que produce mas y se tiene que trabajar para pagar la deuda. Su sueño es ampliar su negocio de venta de electrodomesticos.

Los desafíos que se enfrenta son plagas y enfermedades en los cultivos. Le gusta hacer deporte y trabajar en la tierra.
texts.en:
GLADYS YOLANDA G. M., 40, is married living with her husband and five children in San Miguel’s Recinto Tangara, Bolívar Province.

This communal bank is called CAMPESINOS UNIDOS (United Farm Workers) and is located in Recinto Tangara 15 minutes from San Miguel Canton.  Its members are farmers and merchants.

Gladys is a corn and wheat farmer and also sells home appliances on order as a source of family income.  She buys her products in San Miguel and sells at the Canton’s market.  The home appliances she buys in Guayaquil.

She requests the loan to buy farming supplies, fertilizer and seed, and also to buy home appliances to sell.  The loan is supported by the family business because it produces more and one has to work in order to repay the debt.  Her dream is to expand the home appliance sales business.

Infestations and crop illnesses are the challenges she faces.  She enjoys playing sports and working the land.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, seeds and home appliances.

loans.name: Sergei

texts.en:
Sergei is a private businessman from Novomoskovsk. He owns a vending location in the local marketplace called Slavyanskyi. Sergei sells sportswear items. His vending facility is known for the best assortment of merchandise among other market vendors working with similar type of inventory. Sergei has been in this business for over 5 years. Presently, he has about 50,000 Grivnyas in inventory. 

Sergei is seeking a 20,000 Grivnya loan to purchase caps and sweatsuits to diversify his merchandise this spring season. He is hoping to continue growing his business and generate stable income this summer to be invested in a purchase of a vending facility in fall. His business is the only source of income for the family.

loans.use: to purchase caps and seasonal sportswear to resell

loans.name: Bahati

texts.en:
Bahati is a married woman with six children, five of whom attend school. She lives in a house that she owns that does not have electricity nor piped water.  Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. 

For the past three years, she has operated a vegetable stall, selling tomatoes, bananas, onions, green vegetables and kale. She sells them from home to her neighbours and passersby. Bahati faces a major challenge of price fluctuation of vegetables in the market. She dreams of expanding and increasing her sales volume in the future.

With the Kshs 40,000 she is requesting she wants to purchase sacks of tomatoes, bananas, cabbages, onions and green vegetables for sale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of tomatoes, bananas, cabbages, onions and green vegetables for sale.

loans.name: Tujikwamue - Kiburuga Group

texts.en:
Mwanahadhi, who is in her late twenties, is married and has two children.  She has bee running a business of selling fabrics since 2010. She works from 4.00 am to 6.00 pm daily and she is able to make a small monthly profit. This will be Mwanahadhi's first loan fron Tujijenge Tanzania.  She is requesting a loan to buy more fabrics. Her dream is to own a food cafeteria.

Mwanahadhi will share this loan with her loan group Tujikwamue Kiburugwa, which has 15 members who hold each other accountable in paying back their loans.

In the picture Mwanahadhi is in front holding a baby.

loans.use: To purchase fabrics

loans.name: Enrique

texts.es: Enrique, de 49 años, es un hombre muy sincero y trabajador, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposa Gladis de 44 años y está dispuesto a trabajar muy duro para mejorar su calidad de vida. A lo largo de su vida, Enrique ha trabajado en muchos oficios, actualmente se decida al trabajo de la albañilería y es muy solicitado por sus vecinos, cuando se tiene que techar o tarrajear una pared de alguna casa de la ciudad de Pucallpa. Él es el albañil con más experiencia, al que todos recurren. Disfruta mucho la actividad de construcción que realiza, sabe que con esta digna profesión puede brindarle una buena vida a su esposa. Lleva 12 años realizando esta profesión y considera que lo más difícil de su trabajo es cargar los pesados ladrillos y tener que manejar el cemento hasta con las manos, y eso ha provocado que se dañen más su piel. Por ello solicita de su ayuda para poder comprar nuevas herramientas y con ello mejorar el trabajo que ejecuta. Este sería su décimo primer crédito con MFP y por tal no quiere dejar de pagar sus cuotas, por ello busca más trabajo para ganar más dinero y cumplir con ustedes. Con los mil quinientos nuevos soles solicitados, comprará tablas de madera y comprar más  puntales metálicos, con lo cual podrá trabajar en construcciones.
texts.en: Enrique is a very sincere and hard-working 49-year-old man. He lives in his own home along with his wife Gladis, 44, and is willing to work very hard to improve their quality of life. For most of his life, Enrique has worked in many trades. He currently makes a living in construction and is very sought-after by his neighbors when they need to put up a roof or a wall at some home in the city of Pucallpa. He is the worker with the most experience, so everyone comes to him. He really enjoys the work that he does and knows that with this dignified profession he can provide his wife with a good life. He has been doing this job for 12 years, and the thing he considers to be the most difficult is carrying the heavy bricks and having to work with the cement with his hands, which has cause a lot of damage to his skin. He is requesting your help so he can purchase new tools to better carry out his work. This will be his 10th loan with Kiva partner MFP, and he doesn't want to default on his payments so he can continue looking for more work and making more money and do right by the people who made this loan possible. With the loan of 1,500 soles he is requesting, he plans to purchase wooden planks and metal post so he will be able to do construction jobs.

loans.use: to purchase wooden planks and metal posts.

loans.name: Winelda

texts.en:
The borrower is a single 57-year-old woman who lives in the Philippines.  She has a retail shop that sells canned goods, eggs, and snacks.  She has been in this business for 20 years.  

The borrower is a new member of HSPFI and she has requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy snacks, canned goods, milk, eggs, and beverages.  She hopes this loan will improve the future of her business.

loans.use: to buy snacks, canned goods, milk, eggs & beverages

loans.name: Alvard

texts.en: Alvard lives in the Shirak region of Armenia in the town of Artik.  Her current financial means are insufficient to make the necessary investments in her business.  Therefore she is working with microfinance loans.  Alvard is a hardworking honest person who has been raising livestock for the past three years.  She is also a trained nurse which was quite helpful raising her three sons (twenty-eight, thirty and thirty-two years old).  Alvard wants a loan to purchase additional livestock.  This investment should increase her income by twenty percent.  Alvard plans to use some of the proceeds to construct a new cattle shed.  She enjoys the nature of her town and living near her relatives.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Trephina

texts.en:
Trephina is married to a lovely husband and she is the lone wife to the husband.  She has six children with none of them below the ages of fifteen; she has four rooms in her house with each person per room.  She lives in Aluminum which is located in the North West Region of Cameroon.

She has faced major challenges in life such as sickness, accidents and the death of her relatives, especially the death of her daughter.  Her in-laws would not let her live a peaceful life, that notwithstanding, she also has the problem of inadequate capital to start up a good business for income generation. 

She has taken and repaid loans 10 times since she joined GHAPE in the year 2002.  The amount she is requesting will be used to buy motor spare parts to add to what she already has.  She thinks she will succeed in the business because of the expertise she has gotten and the marketing techniques acquired in relation to this business venture.  Her activity will help the community since car owners will buy parts to repair their cars at cheaper rates. 

With the profit obtained from this loan she will use it to improve on her standard of living, pay tuition fees for her children and improve her family's financial problems.  She prefers a loan from GHAPE because it is easy to obtain a loan from GHAPE and with low interest rates and the period of repayment is gradual.

The Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE) is a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon.  GHAPE works towards the empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a highly multi-faceted approach.  Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profits and losses, and family values.  Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement.  GHAPE instils a sense of family and community within its clients and staff and has developed a strong bond of trust between the organization and its clients.

loans.use: To purchase of automobile spare parts

loans.name: Malila Group

texts.en:
Fatuma, who is in her early 50s, is married with four grown-up children and two grandchildren who go to school.  She has been selling fabrics, bed sheets and children's clothes, which she sells from door to door, for one year now. She works from 9.30 a.m. to 6 p.m. daily and is able make a small monthly profit.

This will be her third loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  She used the previous loans to increase her clothing business and has paid back all her loans successfully.  She hopes for a loan to buy more fabrics, bed sheets and children's clothes to sell. Her dream is to one day be able to buy land.

She will share this loan with her loan group "Malila", which has a total of 15 members who will hold each other accountable in paying back their loans.

loans.use: To buy more fabrics, bed sheets and children's clothes to sell.

loans.name: Mercedes Donaldo

texts.es: Este cliente trabaja para una institución del estado, desempeñándose como vigilante, también se dedica a siembra de maíz y frijoles en sus tiempo libre, el dinero lo solicita para la compra de insumos para la siembra de cultivos, es el segundo crédito que se le ha financiado lo cual le ha ayudado de mucho para el crecimiento de su familia.
texts.en: This borrower works as a security guard for a government institution. He also grows corn and beans in his free time. The money he is requesting will be used to purchase supplies for planting his crops. This is the second loan that he has taken out. The loans have helped a great deal with the growth of his family.

loans.use: to buy supplies for planting his crops

loans.name: Rosalita

texts.en:
Rosalita is 31 years old and lives in Tacloban, Siquijor.  She is married with two children.

To earn a living, Rosalita has a business selling of fresh coconut juice.  She earns about PHP P 4,000.00 each month doing this type of work.  She has requested a loan to purchase fresh coconut juice to sell.

Rosalita has been a member of Paglaum Multi Purpose Cooperative for 8 months.  In the future, Rosalita would like to gain more income from her business.

loans.use: To purchase fresh coconut Juice to sell

loans.name: Yanet

texts.es: Yanet de 31 años de edad, casada con  Heber de 34 años con quien tiene 2 hijos, ellos viven en su casa propia, ubicada en el barrio de parque industrial del distrito de Pichari.Cuando ya un negocio o actividad al cual uno se dedica  ya no es rentable es necesario cambiarlo de inmediato, porque sino el poco capital que uno tiene lo podría perder, este es el  caso de Yanet, quien a tiempo  se dio cuenta que su negocio de venta de abarrotes ya no le era rentable, porque en la cuadra por donde vive existe muchas tiendas de abarrotes,  es por tal razón que ella, decide dedicarse a comprar y vender animales menores en su propio local que antes era una tienda de abarrotes.Ella está obteniendo una buena cantidad de clientes en el poco tiempo que lleva.  En su tienda no solamente vende este producto si no que a ello añadió  la venta de especerías molidas  por la cual también viene obteniendo buenos ingresos.Ella esta emocionada por el buen ingreso que viene obteniendo  hasta el momento gracias al apoyo de su esposo y sus clientes tan recurrentes.Este es su segundo crédito con MFP, por lo que ella ratifica su compromiso de pagar puntualmente sus cuotas.Con los 2,500 ella incrementara su capital de trabajo.Este es su segundo crédito con MFP, por lo que ella ratifica su compromiso de pagar puntualmente sus cuotas.Ella es la más alegre en su banco comunal.Con los 2,500 ella comprará mas animales para su posterior venta.
texts.en: Yanet is 31 years old, married to Heber, 34 years old, with whom she has 2 children.  They live in their own house located in the Parque Industrial neighborhood of the Pichari district.  When a business or activity that one is involved with is no longer profitable, an immediate change is necessary, if not, whatever capital one had invested could be lost.  This is the case with Yanet, who in time noticed that her business of selling groceries was no longer profitable because on the block where she lives there are many stores selling groceries.  That is why she decided to buy and sell small animals in her space that previously was the grocery store.  She has acquired many customers in the small time that she has been in business.  She not only sells animals but also added the sale of ground spices which has also provided a good income.  She is excited about the good income that she is earning up until now with the help of her husband and her repeat customers.  This is the second loan with MFP, and she reaffirms her promise to pay her installments on time.  The 2500 PEN will increase her working capital.  She is one of the happiest people at her community bank.  With the 2500 she will buy more animals for their later resale.

loans.use: to purchase more animals for resale.

loans.name: Dickson

texts.en:
Dickson is 33 years old, married to Miriam. Together they have two children. He is a livestock trader in the area of Enkaroni Bissil, Kenya where he sells livestock to butchers. He has been in this business for the past three years receiving a monthly income of 10,000 KES.

He was introduced to KADET by another KADET client. He intends to use the loan to purchase more livestock. He will use the extra profit to start a ranch. He hopes to have a large ranch and to sell livestock to KMC (Kenya Meat Commission), Athi River. He is hardworking and ambitious.

loans.use: To purchase more livestock.

loans.name: Jessie

texts.en:
At her young age of 25, Jessie is already blessed with two children. She was not given an opportunity to enter into college due to lack of finances to sustain her education, so she was involved into early marriage. To generate income, her spouse provides motorcycle transport services to the people in the village. Daily income of PHP300 is used for daily allowances for the children and meals.

Jessie has to pay for franchise renewal and to buy accessories, such as side mirrors, for the motorcycle in order to ensure safeness of passengers and to allow her husband to continuously operate the business. She is now asking for a loan of PHP12,000.

In the future, Jessie would like to earn consistent profits for the college education of her children and to someday pursue their chosen career.

loans.use: to pay for franchise renewal and to buy accessories, such as side mirrors, for the motorcycle.

loans.name: Febe

texts.en:
Febe is 38 years old. She is married and has one child who is currently going to school. Febe works very hard to provide for her family.

Febe runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 30000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock to sell.

Febe has been in this business for two years. She sells a variety of items such as canned goods, soap, spices, noodles, eggs, etc.

In the future, Febe would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock to sell.

loans.name: Mbekh

texts.fr: Madame Mbekh est âgée  de 55 ans. C’est une veuve qui s’active depuis un an dans le commerce et la vente de petit déjeuner et diner. Elle a choisi son activité par opportunité et a profité de l’ouverture d’une nouvelle boulangerie dans la localité ou elle habite pour s’installer à ses abords et développer son activité. Elle est membre de l’un des guichets de l’U-IMCEC depuis avril 2005. Elle a déjà bénéficié de 7 prêts  antérieurs au sein de l’institution. Elle sollicite un crédit de 100 000 frs prévu pour l’achat et la mise en place d’un stock de denrées afin de pouvoir dégager une marge bénéficiaire plus intéressante. En    même temps elle veut  lutter contre les fluctuations du marché. L’accroissement de ses bénéfices lui permettra de mieux soutenir ses enfants orphelins.
texts.en: Mbekh is 55 years old and is a widow who has been active selling breakfasts and dinners for the past year. She took advantage of an opportunity when a new bakery in the town opened; she set herself up nearby and developed her business there. She has been a member of one of the branches of U-IMCEC since April 205 and has already had seven loans from the institution. She is requesting a loan of 100,000 francs to buy and install a stock of groceries in order to make a more interesting profit margin. At the same time she wants to be able to contend with fluctuations in the market. The increase in her profits will allow her to support her fatherless children more easily.

loans.use: to buy groceries

loans.name: Fedaa

texts.en:
Fedaa is a 29-year-old housewife who has two sons and one daughter. It has been three years now since she started to bring in some goods and sell at her house to her friends and neighbors. Most of the goods she sells are clothes and blankets.

Since there is a holiday season that is coming in the next two months where everyone goes shopping for new clothes especially for kids, and because she already knows among her friends and neighbors who prefers to buy from her than go out for shopping in crowded places, Fedaa wants to bring in more clothes and items to be prepared for those holidays and reach her customers' expectations. That’s why she has applied for this loan.

loans.use: to purchase more clothes and items to sell

loans.name: Metameta Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Metameta Group in Western Kenya! Dorcas is the facilitator of the Metameta group. This group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Dorcas takes care of five children at home. She joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and because One Acre Fund has the best prices. In the recent 2011 season, Dorcas had very good maize yield, harvesting 10 bags on 1 acre of land. Before joining One Ace Fund, Dorcas was only able to harvest 9 bags of maize on 1 acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Dorcas and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from maize sales, Dorcas will save for the future and invest in livestock rearing.

In 2012, the members of Metameta group will each plant  between ½ and 1 acre of maize.

In the photograph above, Dorcas and her group members are pictured.

loans.use: To source farming inputs such as seeds and fertilizer at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Nancy Dixiana

texts.es:
la señora Nancy Dixiana tiene 29 años de edad y esta casada, altualmente se dedica a la venta de desayunos, almuerzos, golosinas y refrescos, atiende a sus clientes de lunes a domingo, dixiana es una mujer emprendedora de buenos principios y con deseos de superarse, el credito lo utilizara para mejorar su negocio,  desea ampliarlo y comprar algunos utencilios de cocina, el resto lo utilizara en la compra de productos para elaborar sus comidas.
la meta de Nancy es que los clientes que le visiten y se sientan satisfechos y que siempre regresen.
texts.en: Nancy Dixiana is 29 years old and married.  She currently sells breakfasts, lunches, candy, and soft drinks.  She serves her customers from Monday until Sunday.  Dixiana is an enterprising woman with strong principles who wants to better herself.  She will use the loan to improve her business; she wants to expand it and to buy cooking utensils.  She will use the rest to buy products to make her foods.  Nancy's goal is for her customers to visit her, feel satisfied, and always return.

loans.use: to buy chairs, tables, pots, frying pans, beef, pork, and chicken, vegetables, condiments, disposable plates and cups, napkins, soft drinks, juice, bread, beans, rice, sugar, lard, oil, potatoes, and yucca.

loans.name: Sandra Patricia

texts.es: La señora Sandra a sus 37 años de edad es madre de un hijo de 5 meses de edad. La señora Sandra es una emprendedora quien hace 8 años decide iniciar su propio negocio de confección y comercialización de bolsos. El taller de la señora Sandra está ubicado en su casa y los bolsos los comercializa con sus amigos, familiares  y referidos. La señora Sandra requiere de la compra de insumos como telas, cierres e hilos para la confección de sus bolsos que aumentará gracias a la temporada de fin de año. Con lo anterior, los ingresos de la señora Sandra aumentarían y de esta forma podría mejorar la calidad de vida de su bebé y de su esposo. El sueño de la señora Sandra es tener su empresa de bolsos muy bien posicionada en el mercado y generar empleos directos en su comunidad.
texts.en:
Sandra, at 37 years old, is the mother of a five-month-old child.  Sandra is an entrepreneur who decided eight years ago to start her own business making and selling purses.  Sandra's workshop is located in her house, and she sells the bags to her friends, relatives, and referrals.

Sandra needs the loan to buy materials such as fabric, clasps, and thread to make her bags, which she will increase thanks to the end-of-the-year season.  With this, Sandra's income would increase and in this way she would be able to improve the quality of life of her baby and of her husband.

Sandra's dream is to have her bag business very well positioned in the market and to generate direct jobs in her community.

loans.use: to buy supplies.

loans.name: Jose Esteban

texts.es:
José, es peluquero, vive con su esposa y dos hijos, solamente él trabaja en la familia, aprendió la peluquería con unos amigos, trabaja en lo propio y tiene su puesto en el mercado municipal.
Él solicita un préstamo para la compra de herramientas para la peluquería, maquinas de cortar cabello, gelatinas, talcos, cremas, y todo lo demás que le ayuda a dar un buen servicio a los clientes, ya que con este dinero del préstamo espera atraer más clientes con su mejora en el negocio.
La aspiración de José es que sus clientes aumenten, ser más reconocido en la zona, mejorar las instalaciones en la peluquería.
texts.en:
José is a hairdresser who lives with his wife and two children.  He is the only one who works in his family.  He learned hairdressing with some friends.  He works for himself and has a stand in the town market.  He is requesting a loan to buy tools for his hairdressing business: clippers, gels, talcs, creams and everything else that helps him to provide good customer service.  With his loan money, he hopes to attract more customers by improving his business.

José's aspirations are to increase his number of customers, to become more well known in his area and to improve his hairdressing business.

loans.use: to buy clippers, gels, talcs and creams

loans.name: Leonarda

texts.es:
La señora Leonarda es una mujer empeñosa y dedicada, a diario ella se dedica a la venta de zapatillas y sandalias en la ciudad de Camaná, ubicada en el sur del Perú, un oasis extenso y seco ubicado en el desierto de Sechura que domina la costa en la parte sudoeste del país. Camaná ha sido históricamente un importante destino turístico en el Perú, sin embargo, los frecuentes y fuertes terremotos y tsunamis en la última década (un 8,4 en 2001 y 8,0 en 2007) diezmó la ciudad, destruido la industria del turismo en Camaná, y costando muchos de sus puestos de trabajo, los medios de subsistencia, y los hogares. Pero el resultado de un desempleo es que crea un ambiente preparado para las microfinanzas. El microfinanciamiento permite a las personas que no tienen muchos recursos y cuentan con un pequeño negocio tener una oportunidad como negociante en el mercado laboral.

Su esposo es maestro de construcción lo que le permite tener un mayor incremento de ingresos en su hogar, este dinero está destinado a la inversión de su pequeño negocio y la educación y cuidado de sus pequeños hijos, uno de apenas 2 años de edad y el mayor de 8. Ella nos comenta que uno de sus platos favoritos en el “Chupe de Camarones”, en la ciudad de Camaná es más fácil poder degustar de este sabroso plato debido a que esta se encuentra muy cerca al mar, lo que permite garantizar la frescura del producto.

Leonarda es una mujer que trabaja en promedio 11 horas diarias y esto le permite obtener una ganancia de S/.130 diarios, con este dinero ella puede pagar el costo original de los zapatos, ella piensa que su negocio tiene éxito por el buen trato que brinda a sus clientes y por su gran carisma. Gracias a los prestatarios Kiva, ella podrá comprar nueva mercadería para vender, lo que le permitirá mayor atención por parte de sus clientes y en consecuencia mejores ingresos. Su sueño es poder ampliar el tamaño de su pequeño negocio y así lograr incrementar sus ingresos para poder techar su vivienda.
texts.en:
Señora Leonarda is a hard-working and dedicated woman. She sells shoes and sandals every day in the city of Camaná, located in the south of Peru. This area is a vast and dry oasis in the Desierto de Sechura, which dominates the south-eastern coast of the country. Camaná has historically been an important tourist destination in Peru. However, the frequent and strong earthquakes and tsunamis in the past decade (an 8.4 in 2001 and an 8.0 in 2007) decimated the city, destroyed the tourist industry in Camaná, as well as jobs, livelihoods, and homes. The result of this unemployment has been the creation of an atmosphere ripe for microfinancing. Microfinancing gives people with small businesses and few resources business opportunities in the labour market.

Leonarda's husband is a master builder, and this brings in a good income. They use this money to invest in the small business, as well as in the care and education of their little children. The youngest is barely two years old, and the oldest is 8. Leonarda tells us that one of her favourite dishes is “Chupe de Camarones” [Shrimp Chowder]. In Camaná it is easy to find and enjoy this delicious dish because they are very close to the sea--this guarantees the freshness of the product.

Leonarda is a woman who works an average of eleven hours a day. This allows her to make 130 Soles per day. With this money, she is able to pay the original cost of the shoes. She thinks that her business is successful because she provides good customer service and is very charismatic. Thanks to the Kiva lenders, she will be able to buy new merchandise to sell. This will allow her to provide better customer service, thus making a better income. Her dream is to be able to expand the size of her business and therefore increase her income in order to be able to thatch the roof of her home.

loans.use: to buy shoes and sandals to sell.

loans.name: Amelia

texts.es: Amelia tiene 58 años de edad es viuda y tubo 5 hijos pero ella vive sola ya que ellos están casados. Platica que es originaria de una localidad muy rica en naturaleza ya  que las personas de su localidad resguardan los bosques debido a que hay talamontes que cortan los arboles sin permiso. Dice que en su comunidad la gente preserva sus raíces ya que hablan y visten el mazahua lo cual es un orgullo para ella. Doña Amelia dice que desde hace mas de 2 años empezó a cultivar  aguacate ella comenta “aunque es un negocio a largo plazo me agrada cultivar este fruto por que se presta a las condiciones del clima de mi localidad y no es muy difícil de cuidar ya falta poco para que se den los frutos en el mes de mayo si Dios quiere voy a tener mi primera cosecha aunque ya varios de los arbolitos empezaron a dar fruto”. Dice que  ahorita como no tiene ganancias de los aguacates se dedica hacer artesanía de ocoshal como son servilleteros, paneras, tortilleros, alhajeros, fruteros, jarrones para decoración y los saca a vender al santuario de la mariposa monarca ya  que muy cerca de su localidad se encuentra. Amelia esta pidiendo un crédito para comprar insecticidas, abono orgánico, fertilizantes, calidra y arboles de aguacate. La meta de doña Amelia es seguir haciendo crecer su huerto y cuando empiece a tener ganancias quiere poner la cerca nueva para que los animales no se le metan a comer sus arboles. Dice que ella esta muy contenta con trabajar con la financiera por que gracias a esta su negocio si esta funcionando y espera nunca defraudarla ya que le tendieron la mano cuando mas lo necesitaba.
texts.en:
Amelia is a 58 year old widow.  She had five children, but she lives alone because her children are married.

She says that she is from a place that is rich in nature.  The inhabitants safeguard the forests because the loggers cut the trees without permission.  She says that in her community the people preserve their roots.  They speak and dress “mazahua” (an indigenous people of Mexico), which they are proud of.

Amelia says she started to grow avocadoes over two years ago.  She says that, “even though it is a business in the long term, it pleases me to grow this fruit because it is well suited to the climate.  The crop is not difficult to take care of, and shortly they will bear fruit in May.  God willing, I will have my first harvest even though various little trees started to bear fruit.”  

She says that now, as she does not have any income from the avocados, she makes crafts from “ocoshal” (dry leaves that come from a pine tree).  She makes things like napkin rings, bread baskets, jewelry cases, fruit dishes, and decorative vases.  She takes them to sell at the Monarch Butterfly Sanctuary because it is very close to her area.  

Amelia is asking for a loan to buy insecticides, organic fertilizer, fertilizers, Calidra (brand of hydrated lime powder), and avocado trees.   Amelia’s goal is to continue making her orchard grow.  When she starts to have income she wants to put up a new fence so that the animals do not get in and eat her trees.  

She says that she is very happy to work with the loan because, thanks to the loan, her business is functioning.  She hopes to never let the lenders down because they lent a hand when she needed it most.

loans.use: to buy insecticides, organic fertilizer, fertilizers, Calidra (brand of hydrated lime powder), and avocado trees.

loans.name: Zoila Rosa

texts.es: Zoila de 24 años fue educada por su madre con mucha responsabilidad y valores morales en los que enmarca su vida, pues al quedar huérfana vio como su madre los sacó adelante y la llevó a lograr su licenciatura en matemáticas. Zoila contrajo matrimonio  en el año 2009 con su novio licenciado en idiomas, y trabajan mediante contratos profesionales en instituciones educativas, además de ser los propietarios de una panadería ubicada al suroccidente de la ciudad de Barranquilla, negocio que crearon para fortalecer los ingresos y planear su futuro con mayor éxito. En la actualidad está planeando Zoila acceder a un credikiva con el cual comprará materias primas e insumos como harina, queso, huevos en mayores proporciones y de contado, con el cual planean incrementar su capital de trabajo y ganar descuentos por las características de su compra lo que supone una inversión muy exitosa, porque conocen muy bien su negocio y gozan de la aceptación y del cariño de su clientela ubicada a sus alrededores y que en general son tiendas ubicadas en diversos barrios del sector.
texts.en:
Zoila, age 24, was raised by her mother with much responsibility and the moral values that have defined her life.  Upon becoming motherless she saw how her mother got them ahead and led her to obtain her degree in mathematics.

Zoila married her fiancé in the year 2009.  He has a degree in languages, and they work through professional contracts at educational institutions.  They are also the owners of a bakery in the southwestern part of the city of Barranquilla.  They created this business to enhance their income and to plan their future with greater success.

Zoila is currently planning to get a Kiva loan.  She will use the loan to buy raw materials and supplies like flour, cheese and eggs.  She will buy in greater quantities and for cash.  She plans to increase her working capital and to get discounts for the terms of her purchases.  She imagines that the investment will be very successful because they know their business very well.  They enjoy the recognition and affection of their customers in the surrounding areas.  Generally speaking there are stores in the different neighborhoods of the sector.

loans.use: to buy supplies like flour, cheese, and eggs in greater quantities for cash.

loans.name: Aïchatou's Group

texts.fr: Ce groupe est un groupe composé de trois personnes qui résident dans le même quartier. Afin d'élever le niveau de leur activité, ce groupe sollicite pour la deuxième fois l'appui financier de ALIDé. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Aïchatou (celle qui a la main levée sur la photo) est âgée de 24 ans. Aïchatou a arrêté l'école au niveau secondaire. Aïchatou est mariée à un certain Emmanuel. Le couple a deux enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Aïchatou vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Les diverses charges de ménage sont supportées par Aïchatou et son mari. Pour cette raison, Aïchatou vend des produits cosmétiques et des cartes de recharges téléphoniques dans sa région depuis deux ans, ce qui lui permet de mieux faire face aux besoins de ses enfants et à leur éducation. Aïchatou s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaire et son revenu, Aïchatou sollicite ensemble avec les membres de son groupe un deuxième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Le crédit reçu antérieurement a été bien remboursé.

loans.use: Acheter des produits cosmétiques.

loans.name: Thủy's Group

texts.en:
Mrs Thủy is 38 years old and she is married with 3 children.
 
She has had a manufacturing business sewing clothes for more than 10 years.
Thủy lives in Hau Loc district, a  rural town in Thanh Hoa province.
Her household was recognized by local government as poor, moreover the market need is low in this region. 
The main hardship that Thủy faces is lack of capital.  She is requesting a loan to purchase more cloth and machine to do tailoring service.
This is Thủy first loan with Thanh Hoa microfinance institution.
She is the group leader of the 02 Lạch Trường,Hải Lộc, which consists of 5 members.
With her business profit, Thủy hopes for her children to do well in school, for her family to be healthy and happy, and for her business to do well.

loans.use: to purchase more cloth and machine to do tailoring service.

loans.name: Lilia Rocio

texts.en:
Lilia is a 37-year old woman, honest, responsible and a very hard worker. She lives in Tampico, Tamaulipas where she has been selling shoes for the past six years. With her earnings she helps her husband with the household costs and supports her children, all of which are now going to school. With the schedule she keeps she has been able to tend to her home on her free time. Lilia wants to keep helping her husband, and most importantly, her children, for which she needs a loan of $275USD to buy merchandise.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer.

Lilia es una mujer de 37 años, honesta, responsable y muy trabajadora; vive en Tampico Tamaulipas y se dedica a la veta de calzado, lleva más de 6 años con su negocio y este le ha permitido no solo apoyar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar, si no que también Lilia ha podido ofrecer a sus hijos una mejor educación ya que tiene 3 hijos y todos se encuentran estudiando; también le ha permitido estar al pendiente de su casa ya que no tiene un horario establecido y esto hace que su trabajo lo realice en su tiempo libre. Lilia quiere seguir apoyando a su esposo y principalmente a sus hijos, por lo que necesita un préstamo de $275 USD para comprar mercancía.

Ella comenta que esta temporada navideña es la mejor época para vender por lo que espera de tu ayuda y no desaprovechar la oportunidad de hacer crecer su negocio. Lilia Agradece tu cariño y generosidad. ¡Apóyala!

loans.use: Purcha Merchandise

loans.name: Zipporah

texts.en:
Zipporah is married with nine children, all in school. She completed her first loan of $159 with PEMCI successfully. She is the secretary and a very active member of Tumaini self-help group which is a member of Pemci. She has done a lot to build her team by bringing cohesiveness to the group.

Zipporah ensures that members repay their loans in a timely fashion in order not to jeopardize the group's position. Her business mainly involves selling fish in the local community market. She has been in the business for a number of years and through it, she has been able to help her husband by paying school fees for their 9 children.

With the help of this 2nd loan from PEMCI (1st with Kiva) Zipporah intents to increase her fish stock and to act as a distributor to other small traders. She has been an inspiration to the women in her community through her hard work and determination.

loans.use: Fishmonger (selling fish)

loans.name: Rosmiati

texts.en: Rosmiati is 28 years old and married with two children. To supplement her husband’s income, Rosmiati sells various snacks from her small store in front of her house. Rosmiati can earn about $1 a day, reaching around $25 in a month. She needs a loan of $100 to buy more goods to sell at her store. Thus, she hopes to approximately double her income and create a better life for herself and her family.

loans.use: To buy more goods

loans.name: Víctor

texts.es:
Business Description

Víctor started his business 3 years ago, and he sells basic foods such as vegetables, fruit and sweets. He works every day from 6am – 10pm.

Loan Use

Víctor needs a loan to invest in new and existing products. In this way he will be able to offer more variety to his clients, expand his business and offer jobs to his children.

Personal Information

Víctor is 39 years old and has 4 children, 3 of which are studying. His wife works in the business. Victor started with a few savings which he obtained working in fields. For his business he needs a rented store. His house is near his business and is made of a mixture of materials. He hopes to improve and grow along with his business so that he can give a better education to his children and show them that the best gift is education and work.

Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva volunteer

Descripción del Negocio

Víctor inicio su negocio hace 3 años. Los productos que vende son: Víveres de primera necesidad, legumbres, Frutas, confitería. La atención de su clientela la realiza de manera personal todos los días desde las 6am-a -10pm.

Uso del Préstamo

Víctor necesita del préstamo para invertir en la adquisición de más víveres y nuevos productos. De esta manera ofrecer nueva variedad de productos a sus clientes. Aprovechando la oportunidad de expandir su negocio y ofrecer empleo a sus hijos.

Información Personal

Víctor tiene 39años. Tiene 4 hijos 3 que están estudiando. Su esposa trabaja en el negocio. Víctor inicio con un poco de capital que logro obtener en base a los pequeños ahorros fruto del trabajo en el campo. Para su negocio ocupa un local rentado. Su casa queda cerca de su negocio es de de construcción mixta. Aspira mejorar y crecer junto con su negocio. Para de esta manera lograr brindar una mejor educación a sus hijos y demostradles que la mejor herencia es la educación y el trabajo.

loans.use: To buy new and existing products/Comprar mas viveres y nuevos productos

loans.name: Siti Mariyah

texts.id:
Siti Mariyah has a business as a street vendor at the Gilimanuk Port. Her husband works as a hard labor at the Gilimanuk Market. Siti Mariyah has 2 children, the oldest one is in highschool and the youngest one is in primary school.

To finance her family's daily needs and the cost for her children's school, Siti Mariyah has to work hard. When she opened her stall for her street vendor business, she spent her saving of Rp 550,000 (US$ 58) to bought the merchandise. Three years later her business started to generate income for her family. Siti Mariyah daily profit in average is Rp 30,000 (US$ 3). As she wants to improve the wellfare of her family, she wants to improve her busines. However she doesn't have enough working capital to do so.

If she gets the loan from DINARI, she can improve her business. She will be able to stock more inventories and merchandise. She will also be able to buy new and cleaner plywood to be used to improve the condition of her wooden stall.

Siti Mariyah believes that her revenue will increase.

Translated from Indonesian by Antonius Gunadi, Kiva Volunteer.

Siti Mariyah mempunyai usaha sebagai Dagang Asongan di pelabuhan Gilimanuk. Suaminya bekerja sebagai buruh di Pasar Pagi Gilimanuk. Siti Mariyah memiliki 2 orang anak, yang pertama sudah duduk dibangku SMA dan yang kedua di bangku SD. Untuk membiayai kebutuhan keluarga dan keperluan sekolah anaknya, Siti Mariyah harus bekerja keras. Pertama kali membuka usaha, Siti Mariyah hanya bermodalkan tabungannya sebesar Rp. 550.000.- dan semuanya itu dipergunakannya untuk membeli barang dagangan. Setelah usahanya berjalan kurang lebih 3 tahun, usahanya sudah menampakkan hasil bagi keluarganya. Dalam sehari, Siti mariyah bisa mendapat keuntungan Rp. 30.000.-.Sebagai wanita yang ingin mensejahterakan keluarganya, Siti Mariyah ingin meningkatkan usahanya. Namun Siti Mariyah kesulitan modal untuk mewujudkan rencananya. Setelah mendapat pinjaman dari Dinari, Siti Mariyah segera memperbaharui dagangannya. Dengan tambahan barang dagangan dan penampilan yang baru dengan rak kayu yang bersih, Siti Mariyah yakin akan mendapat pendapatan yang lebih baik dari sebelumnya.

loans.use: To buy supplies/ merchandise and to buy clean plywood to improve her wooded stall.

loans.name: Rocío

texts.es:
The money Rocio's husband made was not enough to cover all the expenses and their 5 daughters. Their daughters were growing, and their need for food, clothes, and schooling were growing too and it was hard for them to cover those needs. Aware of this need, Rocio decided it was time for her to look for extra money for the household expenses. That is why in August 1999 she started helping a friend with collecting payments for the ceramic products her friend sold, and Rocio received 20%. Later, Rocio realized she could have her own business, and starting in 2004 she began to invest in small quantities of ceramics, and later, with the help of her daughters, she has been increasing her business.

Rocio's intent is to keep growing and to be able to consolidate her business. This is why she is requesting a loan for US $ 575 to be paid in a period of 6 months. With this money, Rocio will be able to buy more merchandise to offer to her clients, especially during the nearing Christmas season, during which people buy lots of decorations for their house. With your help, you'll help Rocio make her dream come true.

Translated from Spanish by Eliana Colunga, Kiva Volunteer

El dinero que ganaba el esposo de Rocío no era suficiente para cubrir todos los gastos y sus 5 hijas, puesto que estaban creciendo, y por lo mismo, las necesidades de sustento, ropa y estudio eran cada vez más grandes y se les dificultaba cubrir dichas necesidades. Viendo esta necesidad Rocío decidió que era momento de buscar dinero extra para los gastos del hogar. Y fue así que en Agosto de 1999 comenzó a ayudarle a una amiga a cobrar la cerámica que ella vendía y le pagaba el 20%. Después se dio cuenta que ella podía tener su propio negocio y a partir del 2004 empezó a invertir en poquita cerámica y desde entonces con la ayuda de sus hijas ha ido creciendo el negocio.

Pero la intensión de Rocío es seguir creciendo y poder consolidar su negocio y es por eso que está solicitando un crédito de US $575 para pagarlos en un plazo de 6 meses y con ese dinero Rocío podrá comprar más mercancía para poder ofrecer a sus clientes, sobre todo para esta época navideña que ya se acerca y la gente compra muchos adornos para su casa. Con tu ayuda lograrás que Rocío pueda hacer su sueño realidad.

loans.use: Buying ceramic figurines as merchandise for her business.

loans.name: Mavjuda

texts.en: Mavjuda M. lives in Mastchokh; she is married and has 6 children. She has been a client of MicroInvest since 2004 and is a serious client who trusts the MicroInvest loan procedures.  Mrs. M. is engaged in the business of selling childrens wear and toys. She has a wide-side assortment of clothes and toys. She is very polite and has permanent clients who want to buy only from her. She is very experienced in the business. She wants to widen her existing inventory with new imported models. Now Mrs. M. requests a loan of US$1025 for business development. She wants to widen the business to increase the family income so that her children can get a good education.

loans.use: For business development

loans.name: Martha Yolanda

texts.es:
Martha Yolanda is 44 years old. Martha completed high school and has 6 children, 3 of which still live at home. She lives in Ricardo Palma in the district of Mache, in the province of Otuzco, in the state of La Libertad. Martha owns a small grocery store in which she sells cooking oil, rice, milk, sugar, etc. In addition to these goods she purchases curds, animals and cereals (barley, wheat, etc) to sell whole sale in the more populated area, Campo Bello.

When Martha was single she had her own restaurant and a store in Campo Bello. After marrying her husband, she moved with him to their current home. For this reason she had to leave her other businesses and she began to plant and harvest agricultural goods. These she sold and over time raised enough to open a new store.

Martha is a member of the Communal Bank “Women of Mache,” from which she obtained her first loan of S/. 300.00 ($100.00). She used the first loan to purchase 50 kilos of curds. With the new loan of S/. 1,000.00 ($350.00), which will be prepaid in 4 months, Martha will purchase a young milk cow and use the milk to create cheeses.

Martha is the fiscal manager of the communal kitchen, “Santa Rosa,” in Ricardo Palma and she is the secretary of the Mother’s Club in this same community. Her dream is to open a business in the city of Trujillo.

Translated from Spanish by Casey Unrein, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Martha Yolanda tiene 44 años de edad, estudió secundaria completa, tiene 6 hijos en total, pero sólo 3 aún dependen de ella, vive en el caserío Ricardo Palma del distrito de Mache, provincia de Otuzco, departamento de La Libertad. Tiene una bodega en la que vende abarrotes como aceite, arroz, leche, azúcar, etc. Además compra cuajada, animales y cereales (cebada, trigo, etc.) para venderlos al por mayor en la ciudad de Trujillo. Cuando era soltera tenía un restaurante y una tienda en el centro poblado Campo Bello, luego de casarse su esposo la llevó a vivir en su actual vivienda, por ese tiempo tuvo que dejar su negocio y se dedicó a la siembra, lo que cosechaba lo vendía y con las ganancias poco a poco fue reabriendo su tienda. La señora Martha es socia del banco comunal “Mujeres de Mache” , lugar donde obtuvo su primer préstamo de S/. 300.00, el cual lo invirtió comprando 50 kilos de cuajada. Con el préstamo de S/. 1,000.00, el cual pagará en 4 meses, comprará una vaca lechera tierna y de esta manera aprovechará su leche para hacer quesos. La señora Martha es fiscal del comedor popular “Santa Rosa” del caserío Ricardo Palma y es secretaria del club de madres de esta comunidad. Su sueño es poner un negocio en la ciudad de Trujillo.

loans.use: Purchase of a milk cow.

loans.name: Namayira Centre F Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Irene A.. She is currently in the business of local beer brewing and is requesting a loan to expand business. Irene is 30 years old and is married. Her husband is a teacher. She has 5 children ranging from age 2 to 17 and her children go to school. Each week, Irene makes approximately UGX 35000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to meet basic needs. Irene has taken a loan from BRAC Uganda before in the amount of UGX 200000 in order to increase stock and the loan was paid back on time.

Irene is joined in her small group by Tapie M., Edith A. and Siida N. . Tapie M. has a business running a retail shop and wants to purchase a fridge. Edith A. is currently operating a business in used clothing sales and wants a loan to increase stock. Siida N. sells art and craft and wants to boost her craft business.

loans.use: To add to brew business

loans.name: Shahnaz

texts.en: Shahnaz T. lives in Beylagan, a small city in Azerbaijan. She is 33 years old, married, and has two children. She and her husband are selling men's shoes in the Beylagan city bazaar. They established their business five yeas ago. (Her husband is pictured, he is on the left). Shahnaz applied to the Normicro Beylagan Branch for a $700 KIVA loan to purchase more kinds of shoes and develop her business.

loans.use: To expand business

loans.name: Christina

texts.en:
Christina is 20 years old and is married with 1 child, age 6. Christina is a cloth seller; she started her business in 2005. Every day she works from 9:00 AM to 6:00 PM at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $35 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more cloth for her business.

loans.use: To buy more cloth for her business

loans.name: Thy Phlang Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Thy P. is the Village Bank President in Popeal Khaer Village, Kandal Province. There are 33 members in her group.

She is 34-years-old and has two children, both of whom are too yO. to work or study. Mrs. Thy P.’s second child has malaria and takes frequent trips to the hospital. Thus, Mrs. Thy P. has unforeseen expenses.

She is a subsistence farmer and her husband, Mr. Heourn C., is a farmer and fisherman. Mrs. Thy P. is requesting a loan to purchase a fishing net and would use additional money to buy more fertilizers and pesticides for her plantation.

loans.use: To purchase a fishing net, fertilizers and pesticides for crops

loans.name: Jeremias Mauli

texts.pt:
Jeremias is 33 years old, and a native of Boane, a town in the province of Maputo, 30 km from the capital. He is married and has three children, ages, 11, 8, and 6. All three attend school. Jeremias completed high school at IMAP in Matola, a town 10 km from Boane, and has worked as a teacher for 10 years. He currently teaches in the Escola dos Antigos Combatente in Boane from 7:00 to 12:30. He lives with his family in his own home, which is still under construction. The construction was financed by loans.

Previously, Jeremias received a loan in the amount of 10,000 MZN from another microfinance institution named Pro-Credito. It was after he completed this loan and after he heard about Hluvuku from friends that he decided to pursue a loan from Hluvuku, which is closer to his home and work. Jeremias’s first Hluvuku loan was for 10,200 MZN, and it was also used for home construction. This will be his second loan with Hluvuku and his first with Kiva. With the amount of 13,000 MZN, he plans to buy more construction materials and continue his dream of one day finishing his home. In the future, Jeremias would like to furnish his home and also build a wall around the house.

Translated from Portuguese by Steve Fogel, Kiva volunteer.

Jeremias tem 33 anos de idade e é natural de Boane, uma vila a 30Km de distancia da capital Maputo na província Maputo. Jeremias é casado maritalmente e pai de três filhos: primeiro com 11 anos, o segundo com 8 anos e caçula com 6 anos. Todos vão a escola. Jeremias completou o ensino médio no IMAP da Matola (vila a 10Km de Boane) e trabalha como professor fazem 10 anos. Atualmente dá aulas na Escola dos Antigos Combatente em Boane das 7:00h as 12:30h. Jeremias vive em sua própria casa com sua família, casa esta ainda em construção a base de empréstimos. Primeiramente Jeremias contou com um empréstimo de outra instituição de microfinanças chamada Pro-Credit no valor de MTn 10,000. Foi apos a conclusão deste empréstimo e apos ouvir sobre a Hluvuku por amigos que decidiu pedir um empréstimo na Hluvuku que era mais perto de sua casa e trabalho. O primeiro empréstimo de Jeremias na Hluvuku foi de MTn 10,200 e também foi usado para a construção da casa. Este será o segundo empréstimo de Jeremias na Hluvuku, e o primeiro no Kiva. Com o valor de MTn 13,000 pretende comprar mais material de construção e continuar o seu sonho de um dia terminar a casa. No futuro Jeremias gostaria de construiu um muro ao redor de sua casa e também mobiliar a casa.

loans.use: Purchase of construction materials for borrower's home

loans.name: Maimouna

texts.fr:
Maimouna N., 39, is married with 5 children in her care. She has been a member of the village bank of Santhiaba for a year and a half. She has a little shop in Boucotte open-air market where she sells unisex clothing, toiletries, underwear, cloth, and shoes. Maimouna wants to bolster her business and help her husband to cope with family expenses. She is requesting a loan that will be reimbursed at the end of six months in one single repayment.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Maimouna N., 39 ans, mariée avec 05 enfants en charge est membre du banc villageois de Santhiaba 1 depuis 1 ans et demi. Elle dispose d'une cantine au marché boucotte ou elle vend des habits unisexe, effets de toilette, linge de corps, tissus et chaussures. Maimouna veut renforcer son commerce et aider son époux sur les différentes charges familiales . Elle sollicite un prêt qui sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance.

loans.use:
buying and selling clothing and toiletries

Achat et revente d'habit et effet de toilette

loans.name: Vurgun

texts.en: Vurgun is married, with 3 children. He is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory in the Kalbadjar region of Azerbaijan. He is now settled in the town of Khirdalan. Vurgun uses an excavator to dig ground for house foundations.  He has been in this business for 4 years. Now he needs a loan of $1200 to buy spare parts for improving his business.

loans.use: To buy spare parts

loans.name: Vu Thi

texts.vi: Chị Hải  năm nay 30 tuổi, Gia đình chị hiện có H. con còn nhỏ. Ngoài chăn nuôi và trồng trọt gia đình chị Hải còn có thêm nghề may găng tay vì đây là nghề đang phát triển tại địa phương nơi gia đình chị đang sinh sống. Hàng tháng ngoài nguồn thu nhập từ chăn nuôi, trồng trọt gia đình chị còn có thêm thu nhập khoảng 2,5 triệu /tháng từ công việc máy găng tay.  Vòng vốn tới anh chị muốn vay thêm vốn về để lấy vải may gang tay bán và đầu tư mua thêm một chiếc máy khâu mới
texts.en:
Ms. H. is 30 years of age and has two small children. Beside raising livestock and caring for her family, she is also into the hand-gloves making business. Glove-making is a growing trend in the community in which she lives. Every month, she is able to bring in 2.500.000d. This is in addition to the revenue she receives from raising livestock. This next loan, she is requesting an amount in which she plan on purchasing materials and a stitching/sewing machine.

Translated from Vietnamese by Lynn Nguyen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy new sewing-machine

loans.name: Vaimaila

texts.en:
Vaimaila T., 55 and married with five children, has many years of experience in the fish business, selling to the village and general public four days per week while her husband and two boys do the actual fishing. She has received two previous loans with SPBD, her only access to capital because she has never been able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks.

Vaimaila expects her weekly net cash flow to soon rise to $208, and she plans to use both her earningss and the loan she is currently requesting to improve her business and help out the family through some home improvements.

loans.use: To purchase a new boat, goggles, spear, cement, bricks, and timber

loans.name: Felicita

texts.es: La señora Felicita tiene 28 años está casada y tiene 2 hijos, ella es propietaria de un  negocio que vende todo tipo de bebidas y productos de consumo diario y está dedicada a éste rubro hace más de 5 años.nElla comenta que estuvo enferma y con reposo por 1 mes aproximadamente y eso le generó mucho gastos y una descapitalización de su negocio, pero gracias a los préstamos que le otorgó la Fundación Paraguaya pudo nuevamente tener ese capital y así pudo comprar todo tipo de mercaderías como ser azúcar, leche, carne, bebidas de todo tipo, yerba, arroz, fideo, aceite, etc, hoy nuevamente esta  surtido su negocio, además posee  clientela formada que siempre está pendiente de los productos que ella vende.nTiene proyecta realizar trabajos adicionales y en paralelo al actual , esa actividad consiste en la venta de ropas para la temporada de verano, como asi también prendas deportivas.n
texts.en:
Mrs. Felicita is 28 years old, married and has two children. She is the owner of a business that sells all types of beverages and staple products, and she has been working at this business for more than five years. She says that she was sick and had to rest for one month. This generated a lot of expenses and her business lost money, but thanks to the loans that the Paraguay Foundation gave her, she was able to regain this capital and thus could buy all sorts of merchandise such as sugar, milk, meat, all types of beverages, yerba mate (tea), rice, noodles, oil, etc. Now her business is newly stocked, but she always has current customers who are waiting for the products that she sells. She plans to do additional work and at the same time run her current business. The additional work will be to sell clothing for the summer season, as well as athletic apparel.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Westin, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Para la compra de galleta, azucar, leche, bebidas,yerba, carne, frutas, verduras, etc..

loans.name: Paok

texts.en: Mr. Paok N. lives in Moeun Tom Rang village in Takeo Province. He is a farmer who owns a small piece of land on which he makes a living by cultivating rice. His wife, Mrs. Kuth Ly, is a motorbike taxi driver. Even though they both work, they can not support their family well. That is why Mr. Paok N. has decided to apply for a loan to buy ducklings to start a duck-breeding business. He will also use a portion of the loan to buy food for the ducklings. He is 44 years old and he and his wife have six children, three of whom are employed in garment factories. The other three are enrolled in the local school.

loans.use: To start a duck-breeding business.

loans.name: Eyo Mawuli

texts.fr:
Cette dame de vingt cinq ans (25) habite le quartier d’Adidogomé.  Elle a appris le métier de la coiffure mais à côté de celà elle s’est engagée dans le commerce de produits de beauté pour pouvoir mieux  subvenir à ses besoins et à ceux de sa famille. Elle a ouvert une boutique de tresse et coiffure qu’elle a nommée « COIFFURE DJODJINA » depuis 2004. Elle n’a jamais obtenu de crédit de WAGES et sollicite ce premier crédit pour s’approvisionner avec des produits de beauté surtout en cette période de fêtes de fin d’année où les femmes achètent beaucoup de ces produits.
Elle est mariée avec monsieur AKOTA Yawo qui est maçon, ils ont ensemble trois enfants qu’ils ont à leurs charges.
texts.en:
This twenty-five-year-old woman lives in the neighborhood of Adidogomé. She has learned to be a hairdresser, and sells beauty products on the side in order to better meet her needs and her family's. In 2004, she opened a braiding and hairdressing salon called Coiffure Djodjina. She has never had a loan from WAGES, and requests this first one to stock up on beauty products in time for the end of the year, when there are many parties, for which women buy many such products. She is married to Mr. Yawo Akota, a mason. Together, they have three dependent children.

Translated from French by Jonah Durning-Hammond, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of beauty products

loans.name: Pann

texts.en: Pann P., 53, lives in the province of Siem Reap, Cambodia, where she owns and runs a plot of land next to her house, growing both rice and vegetables. She can plant her crops twice a year, and she was taught this by her grandfather. She is currently a good mother of seven children: five are single and two are married and live away from home. To help meet a little more of the family's needs, one her single sons is employed as a construction worker. She is married to Soun Hol, age 51, who is a domestic construction supervisor. P. hopes to have a suitable investment for her son to invest in a business of carving wood. Therefore, she decided to ask for a $500 to buy a carving machine for her son to carve the wood from the forest for sale.

loans.use: To buy a carving machine

loans.name: Nuru

texts.en:
Mambo from Tanzania! This is 33-year-old Nuru L. from Dar es Salaam. She is married with two children, ages 10 and 13. Additionally, she is responsible for supporting two dependents because they are orphans. Nuru has been running a grocery business since 2008. She works at the business 13-16 hours per day, seven days per week. Nuru currently earns about US$300 from her business. She is requesting a loan to purchase grocery items. In the future, she plans to increase the quantity and range of her stock. Nuru thanks you for your support!
	
SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro leasing is that is allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase grocery items.

loans.name: Evenezer En Cristo Group

texts.en:
In the photo are Magdalena L. and her group, Evenezer en Cristo. Magdalene is the mother of three of the ages of 2, 4, and 6 and runs a business selling a variety of things including clothing, charcoal, and fried food. Her partner's name is Andres, and they have lived in a town near Puerto Plata called Monte Llano for about three years after emigrating from Haiti. She was invited to participate in this bank by a friend that lives in her neighborhood. Between raising her three children and working, she does not get much free time.

Some of her future goals are to grow the business and to own her own house, because she currently rents. This will be Magdalena's third loan through Esperanza.

On behalf of Magdalena L., the Evenezer en Cristo group, and the entire team here at Esperanza International, we thank you for your support and awareness of the global issue of poverty, in which your efforts are helping to make a difference.

loans.use: to buy supplies and goods to sell

loans.name: Octavia

texts.es: Octavia tiene 50 años de edad, vive con su pareja por más de 30 años, con el que tiene 9 hijos, 2 de ellos aun viven en su casa. Ella y su esposo siembran papa y alverjas, la agricultura les han dada mucha satisfacciones económicas, comodidades en su hogar y la educación de sus hijos, los que ahora ya son hombres de bien para la sociedad. En este año han sembrando con 30 sacos de semilla en chacras de regadío y 20 sacos en chacras temporales, y eso gracias a la ayuda de sus hijos que aun le acompañan. Ambos se sienten muy satisfechos y agradecidos a la tierra que les provee sus frutos, una vez acumulada su cosecha contratan un camión para transportarla a los diversos mercados para su comercialización, recuperar su inversión y volver a sembrar la próxima campaña. En su banco comunal, siempre ha tratado de asistir a todas las reuniones y en caso de faltar, pedía permiso anticipado a su asesora de crédito. Este es su 8vo préstamo con MFP, y en todo este tiempo ha demostrado ser una buena cliente. El dinero que solicita los derivará a la compra de fertilizantes para sus chacras sembradas, de ese modo ayudar a las plantas para su buena producción.
texts.en:
Octavia is 50 years old. She has lived with her partner for more than 30 years. With him she has three children, two of whom still live at home. She and her husband plant potatoes and peas. Agriculture has given them economic fulfillment, comforts in their home and education for their children, who are already good members of society. This year they have planted 30 sacks of seeds in irrigated fields and 20 sacks in seasonal fields, thanks to the help of their children who still accompany them. Both feel very satisfied and thankful to the land that provides them its fruits. Once they have collected their harvest, they will contract a truck to transport it to various markets for its sale, recuperate their investment and return to plant the next field. They always try to attend the meetings at their community bank, and when they miss one, they ask permission from their credit assessor. This is their eighth loan with MFP, and they have always shown to be good clients. The money that they request will be diverted to the purchase of fertilizers for their planted fields to assure a good harvest.

Translated from Spanish by Rebecca Towle, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fertilizers

loans.name: Ganbold

texts.en:
Ganbold L. is 39, married, and the father of four. All his children are attending elementary school. In 2007, he started running a retail business with his spouse. Ganbold buys sheepskin from herders and treats the skin so that it can be used for clothing. His wife, Tsetsgee, sews deels with the sheepskin to be worn in the harsh winter, when temperatures regularly fall below -20 degrees Celsius. A Deel is a Mongolian traditional cloak that men, women and children wear. Tsetsgee also sews many other clothes and Mongolian traditional shoes.

Ganbold's family lives in Arhanghay, one of Mongolia's central provinces. They have many repeat local clients, including herders. During the last two years, Ganbold's family business capital has increased from 50,000 tugrugs to 300,000 tugrugs ($1.00 USD = 1,450 MNT). He requests a loan to buy more raw materials for his business.

loans.use: To buy more raw materials for his business

loans.name: Patricia Mabeth

texts.es: La Joven Patricia Mabeth C. M. tiene la edad de 29 años, su estado civil es casada. Doña Patricia tiene 2 hijos y todos estudian. La actividad económica de Patricia es la venta de mercadería en general. Como todo negocio inicio con pequeños encargos, hace más de 6 años que se dedica a este negocio. Por lo que anteriormente no tenia el capital suficiente, y con el paso del tiempo ha logrado incrementar con su clientela. Patricia tiene los propósitos de mantener a sus clientes para que su negocio siempre este activo y ofrecer una variedad de productos. Patricia solicita el financiamiento destinado específicamente para capital de trabajo y así realizar la compra de perfumes, calzado, ropa, bolsos ya que el viaje lo realiza en Managua. El sueño de Patricia es obtener una tienda ubicada en su vivienda.
texts.en:
Patricia Mabeth C. M., 29, is married and has two children who go to school. Patricia sells general merchandise. Like all businesses, she started out with small orders.
