She has been in this business for more than 6 years. Previously she did not have enough working capital. In time she was able to get more customers. Patricia plans to keep her customers in order to maintain an active business and offer a variety of products. She is asking for a loan for working capital to buy perfume, footwear, clothes and purses. Since she travels to Managua, Patricia’s dream is to have a store located in her home.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Jovelyn

texts.en:
Jovelyn Z. is a married, 20-year-old woman. Her husband is 57 years old, and they are blessed with two children. At present, she is trying to help her husband generate additional income in order to pay for their family's daily expenses.

Her husband supports her ready-to-wear (RTW) clothing business. Fortunately, there is very high demand for the items Jovelyn sells. Therefore, Jovelyn is seeking a loan in the amount of $125 (5,000 PHP) so that she can expand her business.

loans.use: To expand her business by purchasing additional ready-to-wear clothes for resale purposes

location.town: Purok 1-B, Del Carmen, Iligan City, Lanao del Nort

loans.name: Baleria

texts.es: Baleria tiene 37 años, vive junto a su esposo y sus dos hijos, quienes son su mayor adoración y por quienes se sacrifica diariamente. Viene trabajando desde hace 4 años en la venta de cosméticos, actividad que realiza con mucha alegría, ya que tiene la posibilidad de obtener buenas ganancias, pero para incrementar sus ventas tiene que salir a visitar a sus amistades y parientes quienes son sus clientes regulares. Esta labor la realiza desde las nueve de la mañana hasta las seis de la tarde, siendo muy cansado debido las distancias que tiene que recorrer, tratando de realizarlas rápidamente para  llegar a tiempo de apoyar a sus hijos en las actividades educativas. Es por ello, que ha decidido  utilizar los ahorros de muchos años para adquirir un motocarro, el cual alquilará para transporte público, y administrará las ganancias desde su hogar, y así tener un ingreso extra, que compense las horas que dedicará más tiempo a su familia sin salir a vender sus cosméticos. Este es su primer crédito individual, pero sigue trabajando muy gustosa en el banco comunal al que pertenece desde hace muchos años en MFP, donde está muy comprometida por el crecimiento de su grupo. Con los 3000 soles que solicita adquirirá el motocarro que requiere para realizar sus proyectos.
texts.en:
Baleria is 37 years old and lives with her husband and two children, who she greatly adores and for whom she sacrifices on a daily basis. She has worked for four years selling cosmetics, a job that she does with much joy, as she has the chance to make a good income. In order to increase her sales, she has to go out and visit her friends and relatives, who are her regular clients. She does this work from 9am until 6pm, and she becomes very tired from the long distances that she must travel, trying to make the trips quickly so she can arrive home with time to support her children’s educational activities. For this reason she has decided to use her savings of many years to buy a moto-car which she will use for public transport. She will administer the earnings from her home, and in this way will have extra income, which will make up for the additional time that she will dedicate to her family without having to leave to sell her cosmetics. This is her first individual loan, but she continues working happily with the communal bank, Kiva partner Microfinanzas Prisma, to which she has belonged for many years and where she is very committed to the growth of the group. With the 3,000 soles that she is requesting she will buy a moto-car that she needs to move ahead with her projects.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Westin, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy a moto-car

loans.name: Jesusa

texts.en:
Jesusa R. works in a family member's business making and selling specialty food products in her community. She is 37 years old, separated from her spouse and has adult children. She is from the village of Canitoan, Cagayan de Oro City. Jesusa is just starting this business.

In 2008, Jesusa joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Jesusa has successfully repaid a previous loan of 11,000 PHP from HSPFI. Jesusa is requesting a new loan of 14,000 PHP which will be used to purchase ingredients for the food products she makes. This will be her fourth loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue to support the education of her children.

About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand product offering

location.town: Canito-an, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Flor

texts.en: Flor B. is from the village of Brgy. Yumbing Camiguin. She is 25 years old, married, and has four school-aged children. Flor owns and operates a specialized retail business, primarily selling clothing and shoe products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over seven years and earns approximately 3,200 PHP a month. In 2009, Flor joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Flor is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP which will be used as additional capital for her business. This loan will be her 2nd from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the income of her family.  About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To use as additional capital for her business

loans.name: Saveniana

texts.en:
Saveniana N. is a 44-year-old single mother of 2 adult children who both live with her. Her oldest son is already earning for himself and the other one has just finished a nursing degree in college.

Saveniana and her husband parted ways almost two decades ago. She was left to care for and rear her 2 sons. But this never hindered her from moving forward. She went into business. She owns a general store, which has been running for the last 7 years. And just last year, she opened a store for RTW (ready-to-wear) clothes in Cartimar. She used her savings as capital for this new business. She makes P25,000.00 a month out of the combined proceeds of her businesses.

Saveniana joined Center for Community Transformation (CCT) Credit Cooperative in 2002. Since then, she has been enjoying the benefits it provides to its clients. Through the years, she became an inspiration to CCT members, old and new, especially by showing her endurance to her trials and challenges as she raised her sons and supported their education.

Saveniana has applied for a new loan of P17,000.00. She will use these funds to purchase additional inventory (clothes and beauty accessories) for her bazaar. At this point of her life, Saveniana could never ask for more. She is very thankful to the Almighty for giving her the strength to move on.

About CCT

The Center for Community Transformation (CCT) is an organized Christian response against poverty and social injustice. This response is carried out through the fusion of social development initiatives and evangelical mission in a uniquely Filipino context. CCT serves urban and rural poor communities throughout the Philippines, in pursuit of its desire to see changed lives, strong families, and transformed communities centered in the Lordship of Jesus Christ.

loans.use: To buy clothes and beauty accessories for her bazaar

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es: Carmen tiene 46 años, es una mujer caracterizada por su gran valor para sacar adelante a sus seres queridos, así como ser un apoyo para su pareja en los diversos roles que tienen como padres de sus 2 hijos, con quienes vive en la casa que con mucho esfuerzo lograron construir. Hace 5 años tuvieron la posibilidad de adquirir 3 motocarros, los cuales son de gran ayuda para la economía dentro de su hogar, Carmen es la encargada de administrarlos y velar por su buen funcionamiento. Estos vehículos los alquilan a diversas personas, generalmente jóvenes muchachos, quienes se dedican al transporte de pasajeros en la modalidad de taxi. Por tal motivo, Carmen se cerciora de que sean personas responsables y usen sus motocarros de manera adecuada. Por otro lado, las reparaciones y mantenimiento de las motos son esenciales y trata de hacerlas mensualmente, pues si hay una falla mecánica mayor, ésta evitará que se trabaje con una de las motos y afectaría su situación económica. Para un futuro cercano, Carmen espera ahorrar para comprar un motocarro adicional, con el que pueda cubrir los gastos si uno de ellos está siendo reparado. Ella trabaja de manera individual en Microfinanzas PRISMA y este es el segundo crédito que solicita, con el cual espera seguir mejorando su negocio. Los 3000 soles que requiere le permitirán comprar algunos repuestos para las motos y no tener ninguna dificultad futura con sus vehículos.
texts.en:
46-year old Carmen is a strong woman, determined to see her family get ahead in life. She is also a source of support for her husband in the various roles they have, such as parents of two children who live with them in the house which they managed to build after a great deal of effort. Five years ago they had the chance to acquire three ‘motocarros’ (three-wheeled motorized carts), which are a great help in making ends meet. Carmen manages the business and makes sure the motocarros are working properly. The vehicles are rented to various people, generally young men, who earn a living by transporting passengers in these ‘taxis’. For this reason Carmen checks that they are responsible people and use the motocarros in an appropriate manner. Repairs and maintenance are essential, and she tries to have them done every month to avoid a major breakdown which would affect their economic situation. In the short term, Carmen plans to save money to buy an additional vehicle which can be used to bring in money if one of the others is under repair. She is an individual borrower with Kiva partner, Microfinanzas PRISMA, and this is her second loan. She plans to continue making improvements to her business. The 3000 soles which she is seeking will allow her to buy some spare engine parts so that there will be no future problems with the vehicles.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy spare parts for her vehicles

loans.name: Maria De Los Remedios

texts.es:
La señora María De Los Remedios es una señora de edad adulta  y para conseguir empleo esta difícil sobre todo por la edad. Al ver ella que no encontraba trabajo decidió  invertir en un negocio el cual opto por  ropa usada ya que en esta frontera es muy solicitada por la gente, desde hace 9 años se dedica a este oficio en  el cual ya mucha gente la conoce. 
Ahora ella quiere comprar más mercancía y variedad en tallas de ropa, por que sus clientes la conocen por vender buena calidad y sobre todo por el precio. Así con estos ingresos ayudaría en mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Sra. María De Los Remedios is an older woman who has difficulty finding employment because of her age. Since she was not able to secure work, María decided to start a business selling used clothing since there is existing demand for this type of merchandise. She has been in business for 9 years and is well-known among her customers.

She now wants to buy more merchandise and clothing in various sizes. Her customers know that she sell high quality products, but they buy them mainly for the price. Her income will help her improve her quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise for her business

loans.name: Serapio Jose

texts.es:
"Don Serapio Jose P. T., tiene 38 años de edad y vive en la ciudad de El Alto en la casa de sus padres, es soltero y no tiene hijos, don Serapio  se dedica a atender su internet el mismo que se encuentra ubicado en la avenida Buenos Aires. Su segunda actividad está relacionada con lo que está estudiando que es adender su veterinaria, el mismo que lo administra con ayuda de su cuñado que tambien tiene su veterinaria y que se encuentra ubicado en la avenida Buenos Aires.

El crédito solicitado por don Serapio está destinado a la compra de comida balanceada para cachorros, el mismo que por su calidad y precio cuestan caros."
texts.en:
Serapio Jose P. T. is 38-years old and lives in El Alto city with his parents. He is single and doesn’t have any children. Serapio runs an internet café located on Buenos Aires Avenue. He is also studying to be a veterinarian and works at his brother-in-law’s veterinary practice, located on Buenos Aires Avenue. The loan he is requesting will be used to buy nutrient-balanced puppy food, which is of high quality and expensive.

Translated from Spanish by Vivian Lu, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Investment in nutrient-balanced feed.

loans.name: Ntinda F Nanyazi Harriet Group

texts.en: N. Harriet is twenty-nine years old married with two children. She is operating a retail shop business since the year 2006. She is using the loan to purchase items such as paraffin, 100 kilogram bag of sugar, bags of salt, wheat flour, maize flour, and so forth. She is so grateful in advance for the loan opportunity because she thought it was not all that easy, she will improve as she increase on the stock for big profit return. Her dream is to prosper and be well.

loans.use: To purchase items such as paraffin, 100 kilogram bag of sugar, bags of salt, wheat flour, maize flour, and so forth.

loans.name: Liduena

texts.en:
63-year-old Liduena works with her husband on their farm. They have three children and the eldest is 33 years old.

At her age, Liduena is still strong enough to tend their farm. She hopes to succeed in life and give her family a better living.

Liduena applied for a loan of Php 10,000 from CEVI and will use this loan to finance her farm. She is hopeful that her dreams will come true.

loans.use: To use for farm financing

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mercy resides in the village of Culalabat, Cauayan City with her family. She is married to Jeffrey D., who works as a carpenter in their village, and the couple is blessed with three children: Jerica, two years old, and Cherry Mae, and Jeffrey Jr., both school-aged.

Mercy is engaged in a food retailing business. She has been selling rice cakes for almost a month now in their village. Every afternoon she sells her products. Her daily net income is Php 100, and she wants to access a loan amounting to Php 6,000 from Kiva lenders. She plans to use it to purchase rice cake ingredients and kitchen utensils for her business. According to her, it will be a great help in meeting their daily needs.

loans.use: to buy more ingredients and utensils for her food production business

loans.name: Sunday

texts.en:
Sunday C. brews and sells beer locally. She is requesting a loan to purchase more materials to use. Sunday is 30 years old and widowed. She has 6 children, all of whom go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a house.

About BRAC:

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and the empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services, all of which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: purchasing more materials with which to brew beer

loans.name: Kwesi

texts.en:
Kwesi A. sells bicycle parts at Abura near Cape Coast. Kwesi has received a junior high education. He is married and has one child. His wife is a trader.

Kwesi has been selling bicycle parts for the past five years. He is responsible for the payment of school fees and utility bills. His loan will be used to buy more bicycle parts for sale and he hopes to use the new profits from his business to complete his building.

loans.use: To buy more bicycle parts to sell

loans.name: Chita

texts.en:
Chita B. is from the village of Centro 2. She is 49 years old. Chita is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Chita owns & operates a general store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Chita has been engaged in her business for over 15 years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Chita joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Chita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Chita is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand product offering. This will be the third loan taken out by Chita from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand product offering

loans.name: Alice Syonguma

texts.en:
Alice is married to Henry and they have three children: Rose, Isaac and Elizabeth, who are 20, 12 and 9 years old, respectively.

Alice was introduced to KADET through existing clients and this will be her first loan. She has no credit history from other Micro-Finance Institutions. She has been in the cereals and green-grocery business for six years now, and she intends to use the loan to purchase cereals like rice, beans and pigeon peas.

Alice operates within the estate where she resides and the tenants are her customers. With the extra profits she intends to expand her business further.

Alice's hopes are to run a wholesale cereals distribution company, as she believes she is focused and hardworking.

loans.use: to purchase cereals

loans.name: Nicel

texts.en: Nicel H. is a 33-year-old married woman who lives in Barangay Panaquiao, Isabela, Negros Occidental. She earns her living through her general store, RTW, and buying and selling rice. RTW, or "Ready To Wear", is the selling of used clothing which is a very popular business among Project Dungganon members. Nicel’s husband, Cyrus, 35 years old, works as a laborer in a sugarcane plantation. They have five children who are between 2 and 12 years old. All of her children are still attending school and also help in running the business and with household chores. Nicel joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2006 in the hope that she would be able to help her husband improve the quality of life of their family. With the help of her loans from NWTF-PD she has been able to increase their family income by running her businesses and now earns an average monthly income of Php 4,500. Nicel is a member of good standing. Her previous loan of Php 14,000 was used to fund her businesses, and it had a positive impact in both the businesses and the family’s living conditions. Now she is borrowing her 6th loan of Php 14,000, which she intends to use as additional capital for her businesses. Nicel is working hard to achieve her dreams and aspirations for her family, which is to provide them with a brighter future and a more comfortable life. About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress out of earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: To use as additional working capital for her RTW and rice businesses

loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
Norma J., age 45, is making sure that her family has enough provision for their daily needs. She is married to Rogelio J., a driver, and they are blessed with two children. She makes sure that she helps her husband earn so that their family can have a better life. She has been running her buy and sell business for quite some time.

Norma has been a regular member of Center for Community Transformation* (CCT) for more than a year. She regularly attends their weekly fellowship meetings and pays her weekly dues consistently. Because of her good repayment performance with her previous loans, she was able to borrow quite a few times from CCT’s cooperative.  She is consistent in paying her dues because she used the money she borrowed to expand and improve her buy and sell business.     

Now with your help, she would like to apply for a PHP 8,000 loan. This amount will be used as a source of added capital for her expanding business. She will use this loan to buy more products for her inventory. She dreams that her business will continue to grow so that she can have a good and comfortable life with her family.


* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To buy more products for her inventory.

loans.name: Jean Bosco

texts.en:
Jean Bosco was born in 1978. He is married and does not have his own children but he does take care of four dependents who are relatives aged between 3 and 12. He lives in the Gasabo district of Kigali, the capital of Rwanda.

Jean Bosco is a man of great ability in the business of sewing clothes; his business is well known and organized, which is an advantage for him. He employs one person in his business as a helper so that his business runs smoothly. This is his third year of successful operation in this business. The hours of his business are from seven in the morning to six in the evening every day except Saturday.

Jean Bosco is now requesting a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company in order to purchase a new sewing machine and some clothing items. With the new machine and clothing items, he will be able to serve more customers on time and he also hopes that his profits will be increased.

Jean Bosco expects to earn more profits which in turn will be used for reinvestment in his business and for building a secure future for himself.

loans.use: To buy a new sewing machine and some clothing items

loans.name: Francklin Felix

texts.es:
Franklin Félix P., es  un joven  de 35 años quien  Labora como Higienista en el Mercado Oriental de Managua, el tiene tres hijos a su cargo,  y estos  se encuentra en edad escolar, es casado, ha trabajado tres crédito con CEPRODEL durante tres  años, en este periodo de tiempo ha invertido los tres créditos en la mejoramiento de la vivienda en la que habita, gracias a los financiamiento otorgados por CEPRODEL.  
El crédito solicitado es para invertir en la compra de materiales de construcción como: arena, cemento y piso  de su casa de habitación.
 Todo esto con el objetivo de Brindarles mayor seguridad y  una mejor condición de vida a sus hijos.
Franklin dijo que los préstamos otorgados han sido para el mejoramiento de su vivienda.
texts.en:
Franklin Félix P. is a young man of 35 years old age. He works as a hygienist in the Oriental market in Managua. Franklin has 3 children in his care, all school-aged. He was worked with 3 loans from CEPRODEL during 3 years, and has invested all 3 in home improvements, thanks to this finance granted by CEPRODEL. The loan he is seeking is to invest in the purchase of contruction materials such as sand, cement and flooring for his house. Improving his house is to give his family better security and give his children a better standard of living. Franklin said that the granted loans have all been for home improvements.

Translated from Spanish by Jane McCrory, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase construction materials

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase merchandise for her store

loans.name: Chuon

texts.en: Mr. Chuon C. is a villager in Kamnab village in Kandal province and he was born in 1977. He is a construction worker and his wife, Mrs. Sothea Nhel, is a farmer who owns 2 hectares of land to cultivate rice on to support her family. Now they are facing an obstacle because their house is too old to live in, but they do not have money to repair it. Thus, in order to improve  family living conditions, Mr. Chuon C. decided to apply for a loan to construct a new house instead of the old one. He is the father of three children, two of whom are enrolled in local public school, while the other is only five years old. His wife is also in the photo.

loans.use: To construct a house

loans.name: Charlita

texts.en: Charlita J. is from the village of Talisay, Gingoog City. She is 40 years old, is married, and has two school-aged children. Charlita owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling both food and daily-use products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month. In 2008, Charlita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Charlita is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding her business. This loan will be her 4th from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family’s income. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy tools for farming

loans.name: Arturo

texts.en: Arturo H. is from Barangay Tucal, Solano, Nueva Vizcaya. He is 48 years old, is married, and has three school-aged children. Arturo owns and operates a business planting and harvesting rice for sale. He has been engaged in his business for over twenty years and earns approximately 45,000 PHP per harvest. In 2010, Arturo joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and his ability to engage in business activities. He is requesting a loan of 20,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizer such as manure. This loan will be his first from ASKI. Arturo plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay his children’s tuition fees. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has twenty-one branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer such as manure

loans.name: Dramane

texts.fr:
Monsieur Dramane Dembélé est un homme marié de 34 ans et père de 4 enfants. Il vit avec sa femme et ses enfants dans le  quartier Faraba de Bougouni.(troisième région administrative du Mali)
N’ayant pas fréquenté l’école, dès à son jeune âge il mena des activités génératrices de revenus.
Pendant 10 ans il faisait les travaux journaliers auprès des commerçants notamment le transport de leurs marchandises avec un pousse pousse au marché et dans les différents quartiers de Bougouni,  sans succès.
C’est ainsi qu’il décida d’apprendre la vente d’articles divers dans une  boutique auprès de son oncle.
Avec plus de 7 années d’expérience, il maîtrise cette activité. Présentement sa boutique marche bien et  reçoit beaucoup de clients.
 Pour le renforcement de son commerce, Monsieur Dramane Dembélé décida de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso. Le prêt précédent obtenu avec Soro Yiriwaso a été correctement remboursé.
Il compte utiliser ce nouveau prêt pour acheter une grande quantité d’articles divers pour sa boutique.
Il s’approvisionne à Bamako (capitale de la république du Mali).
Avec ce prêt, Monsieur Dramane Dembélé compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 60 000FCFA.
 Il envisage toujours d’agrandir sa boutique avec ses bénéfices.
texts.en:
Mr. Dramane Dembélé is 34 years old, married and the father of four children. He lives with his wife and children in the Faraba borough of Bougouni (third administrative region of Mali). Not having attended school, he embarked on revenue-generating activities from an early age. For ten years he performed daily tasks for merchants, notably using a “pousse-pousse” to transport their merchandise to market and to different areas of Bougouni, without encountering success. Thereafter, he decided to learn to sell various articles in his uncle’s shop. After more than seven years’ experience, he now masters this activity. His shop is working well and he attracts many customers. To strengthen his commerce, Mr. Dramane Dembélé decided to collaborate with Soro Yiriwaso. The preceding loan granted by the MFI was repaid in full. He intends to use this new loan to buy a large quantity of various articles for his shop. He gets his supplies from Bamako (capital of the Republic of Mali). With this loan, Mr. Dramane Dembélé is hoping to reach monthly earnings of 60,000 FCFA. He envisions using his earnings to extend his shop.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy various articles for shop

loans.name: Flora

texts.en:
Flora D. is from the village of Bagong Silang, Iligan City. She is 38 years old, married and has 2 school-aged children. Flora owns and operates a business raising livestock, primarily pigs, for sale. Flora has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month from it.

In 2009, Flora joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Flora has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI, which was used to to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in the future. Flora is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will again be used to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in the future. This will be the 2nd loan taken out by Flora from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in the future

location.town: Bagong Silang, Iligan City, Lanao del Norte

loans.name: Juana Piedad

texts.es:
Juana Piedad G. C. tiene 52 años. Vive en unión libre en el cantón de Ventanas, en la provincia de Los Ríos. Tiene 4 hijos, de 24 a 30 años.

Juana es una socia de la ventanilla rural Recinto San Ramón, que esta ubicada en Nuevo San Ramón, a 12 Km. de Ventanas. Son 20 socios en total, que están trabajando en la agricultura de corto ciclo (cosecha en 6 meses). Esto es el primer crédito que ellos sacan con la Cooperativa.

Juana trabaja en la agricultura, cultivando maíz y arroz de verano. Hace sus ventas en los comerciales Laura, López y Cinero de Ventanas cada 6 meses. 

Solicita el préstamo para seguir aumentando el negocio: comprar semillas y abonos. Piensa que este crédito le ayudara a superarse trabajando.
Su sueño es comprar un carro para su hijo y después para ella. Enfrenta problemas de salud en la familia.

Le gusta divertirse mucho: escuchar música, bailar y jugar y cantar con sus nietos. Se dedica a su finca toda la semana y a su familia el fin de semana.
texts.en:
Juana Piedad G. C. is 52 years old. She is in a common-law marriage and lives in the district of Ventanas in the province of Los Ríos. She has 4 children ranging in age from 24 to 30. Juana is a member of the Recinto San Ramón rural loan group, which is located in Nuevo San Ramón, about 12 km from Ventanas. In all, there are 20 members of the group who make a living cultivating short-cycle crops (harvesting in 6 months). This is the first loan that Juana has taken out with Cooperativa San José. Juana also makes a living farming: she grows corn and dry-season rice. She sells her produce at the Laura, López, and Cinero stores in Ventanas every 6 months. Juana will use the loan she is requesting to grow her business by purchasing seeds and fertilizer. She thinks that this loan will help her improve her work. Juana’s dream is to purchase a car for her son, and later one for herself. The main problem she faces is poor health in the family. Juana enjoys many things: listening to music, dancing, and playing and singing with her grandchildren. She attends to her farm all week and then spends time with her family on the weekend.

Translated from Spanish by Christopher Knutson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Growing her business by purchasing seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.en:
Mercedes D. C. main source of income comes from raising pigs for breeding. She is 46 years old, widowed and has four school-age children. They are from the village of Brgy. Paniki, Bagabag, Nueva Vizcaya. Mercedes has been in her business for over 15 years and earns approximately 8,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month.

In 2006, Mercedes joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Mercedes has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from ASKI which was used to purchase breeding livestock. She is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP which will be used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. This will be her tenth loan from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue to improve and expand her business. 

About ASKI:
ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the central and northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase livestock feed and other supplies

loans.name: Eoung

texts.en: Eoung P., 52, is a widow who lives with three children in Takeo province. She buys and sells silk cloth and typically makes US$ 5 each day. She is also supported by one of her children who works in a garment factory. Eoung P. is asking for a loan of US$ 500 to purchase more silk cloth to sell.

loans.use: To purchase more silk cloth to sell.

loans.name: Rosela

texts.en:
Rosela B. is from the village of Sepac Sapang Dalaga, Misamis Occidental. She is 43 years old, married and has 3 school-aged children. Rosela owns & operates a retail store where she sells fruit like bananas in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Rosela joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the first loan taken out by Rosela from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to supplement her family's income. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fishermen and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Eugenia

texts.en:
Eugenia A. is from the village of Barangay 4, Talakag, Bukidnon. She is 51 years old. Eugenia is widowed and has one adult child. To make a living, Eugenia owns & operates a mini-restaurant. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from serving a variety of different meals to customers in the local community. Eugenia is just starting this business.

In 2009, Eugenia joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Eugenia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to invest in expanding the business. Eugenia is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase food & drinks for the restaurant. This will be the 3rd loan taken out by Eugenia from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase food & drinks for the restaurant

loans.name: Natalya

texts.en: Natalya is single. She runs a small business where she sells farm supplies such as seed, fertilizer, and flowers. The store she rents is in a very good location, and it attracts many clients. Natalya has been working for five years and has gained many repeat clients. She enjoys her business and would like to develop it further. Natalya is requesting a loan of 6,500 Grivnas to increase her inventory.

loans.use: To increase her inventory

loans.name: Zullen Geronima

texts.es: Zullen Geronima tiene 32 años es casada y tiene 2 hijos menor de edad. Ella se dedica a la venta de ropa, comida y pulpería. La cual es administrada personalmente por ella, además de esto su mama realiza las compras en el mercado. Sus ventas son siempre de contado, igualmente tiene que comprar al contado. Ella empezó con este negocio desde hace 2 años y medio, este dio inicio cuando su esposo estaba desempleado, pues junto con su esposo fue que decidieron continuar con el mismo. El crédito solicitado por la señora será invertido en la compra de inventario para la pulpería, ropa y parte de comida. Su sueño siempre ha sido llegar a tener una su negocio más amplio.
texts.en: Zullen Geronima is 32 years old, married and has two young children. She makes a living selling clothing, food and other grocery items. She runs her business herself, and her mother purchases the supplies at the local market. Her transactions are always in cash, and she also makes her purchases in cash. She started this business two and half years ago when her husband was unemployed and they decided to carry on as before. She plans to use the loan she is requesting to invest in the purchase of groceries, clothing and some food to add to her inventory. Her dream has always been to have a bigger business.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Diego Vinicio

texts.es:
Diego Vinicio C. C. tiene 27 años. Es soltero vive con la mama, vive  en el cantón de Guaranda en la Provincia de Bolívar.  No Tiene  hijos.

DIEGO  pertenece a la Ventanilla Casaiche Chilipamba ubicada a media hora de Guaranda perteneciente, es un grupo que se dedica a la agricultura y a la ganadería como vacas lecheras y chanchos, esta ventanilla tiene 20 miembros.

DIEGO se dedica a la agricultura de maíz, trigo fréjol y papa y a la ganadería cría vacas lecheras, las comprar las realiza en Guaranda y vende en el mercado mayorista de la  misma ciudad.

Solicita el crédito para la compra de insumos para la siembra maíz, trigo fréjol y papa y animales para engordar y después vender. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades de la familia. Su sueño es ponerse comprar casa, carro y terrenos para tener sus animales.

Le gustaría caminar por el campo
texts.en:
Diego Vinicio C. C. is 27 years old. He is a single man. He lives with his mother, in the Guaranda canton, in the Bolivar province. He does not have any children.

DIEGO belongs to the the Casaiche Chilipamba community bank. It is located half an hour from Guaranda. The members of the group work in agriculture and farming, with dairy cows and pigs. The group has 20 members.

DIEGO farms corn, wheat, beans, potatoes and he takes care of dairy cows. He buys them in Guaranda and sells them in the wholesale market in the same city.

He is requesting a loan to buy supplies for harvesting corn, wheat, beans, potatoes and for fattening and then selling dairy cows. The loan’s support would allow him to help his family economically with their household expenses. His dream is to buy a house, a car and land for his animals.

He would like to walk through the countryside.

loans.use: to buy supplies for harvesting corn, wheat, beans and potatoes and for fattening and selling dairy cows

loans.name: Edith

texts.es: Edith, de 28 años, es una mujer alegre y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Rubén de 29 años y su querida hija Daysi de 7 años, quienes son el motivo de todos sus esfuerzos. Desde muy pequeña Edith aprendió ha trabajar en la chacra, ahí ayudaba a sus padres en las labores agrarias, es así que aprendió todo sobre esta labor. Con el tiempo ha logrado tener sus propias tierras, donde siembra y  cuida con mucha dedicación, ya que depende de ello para obtener una buena producción.  Los frutos que siembra son: cacao, café y hojas de coca, que una vez cosechados son llevados a la ciudad de San Francisco para comercializarlos. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cosechar, de esa manera ve todo el esfuerzo puesto en su trabajo, siendo la recompensa la cantidad de frutos que recolecta. Han transcurrido 8 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es cuidar sus cultivos de la plaga de insectos que pueden afectar su productividad. Su mayor deseo es comprar nuevas tierras para poder sembrar en más extensiones de tierra. Este es el quinto crédito con MFP, sabe que tiene que pagar sus cuotas puntualmente y esta dispuesta a hacerlo. En su banco comunal es una socia muy alegre y siempre está poniendo la cuota de humor en el grupo. Con los tres mil nuevos soles solicitados, comprará abono para fertilizar sus tierras, puesto que espera cosechar buenos frutos.
texts.en:
Edith, 28, is a very happy and hard working woman.  She lives in her own house with her husband Ruben, 29, and with her beloved daughter Daysi, who is seven.  They are the motivation behind all of her efforts.  When she was very small, she learned how to work on a farm, and would help her parents with agricultural work.  This is how she learned everything about this kind of work.

With time, she has come to have her own land that she cultivates and cares for with much dedication, since she depends on it for good yields.  She cultivates cacao, coffe and coca leaves that when harvested, are brought to San Francisco city to sell.

What she loves most about her work is the harvest, when she sees all of the effort that was put in her work rewarded in the amount of products that she collects.  Eight years have passed with her doing this work.  What she considers most difficult is protecting her crops from insects that can affect productivity.  Her biggest wish is to buy new stretches of land to cultivate.

This is her fifth loan with MFP.  She knows that she needs to make her payments on time and is willing to do so.  In her communal bank, she is a cheerful member and is always making the group laugh.  With the requested 3,000 soles, she will purchase manure to fertilize her land, in the hopes of reaping good fruit.

loans.use: For the purchase of sacks of fertilizer.

loans.name: Bukiro Women's Group

texts.en:
A. Annet is the leader of Bukiro Women’s group in Ntungamo. She is 32 years old and married with three children, aged 12 to 7 years.  Annet has a retail shop in Kakigani that sells sugar, flour, books, pens, as well as owns a hotel in the same area for 6 years. From her businesses, she is able to make 100,000 UGX in weekly profits. 

She needs a loan to be able to buy more stock to expand the shop. Annet says that to start her shop, she got capital from the sale of bananas and  says that her shop is easy to manage. Her dream is to buy her own plot of land and build her own house.

loans.use: To stock retail shop

loans.name: Virgen Del Carmen Group

texts.es:
Las mujeres del presente comité son de la compañía Aguaity, barrio Virgen del Carmen.

La Presidenta del comité es la Sra. Patricia M. ella se dedica a la venta de Frutas y verduras, ella es una mujer muy sacrificada tiene 6 hijos 3 de los cuales viven con ella y estudian los demás ya son casados, una de ellas está viviendo en la argentina y le envía mensualmente un poco de dinero.

La Sra. Patricia es muy sacrificada sale tres veces a la semana a las tres de la mañana para trabajar en el mercada de San Lorenzo, ella está en el mercado hasta vender todos sus productos.

Doña Patricia está muy agradecida con la Fundación Paraguaya y a la vez con Kiva por el apoyo tan importante que les brinda a las señoras del comité.
Ella solicita el préstamo para la compra de frutas y verduras.
texts.en:
The women of this communal bank are from the Aguaity residential development in the Virgen del Carmen neighborhood.

Patricia M. is the president of the group.  She sells fruits and vegetables.  She is a very self-sacrificing woman, and she has six children.  Three of them live with her, and they go to school.  The other children are married.  One of them is living in Argentina and sends her a little money each month.

Patricia is very selfless; three times a week she leaves at three in the morning to work in the San Lorenzo market.  She stays in the market until she sells all of her products.

Patricia is very grateful to the Fundación Paraguaya and Kiva for the very important support they offer the women in the communal bank.  She is requesting the loan to buy fruits and vegetables.

loans.use: To buy fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase construction materials to tile  the room which is still earth, to obtain better hygiene

loans.name: Abdumavlon

texts.en: Abdumavlon is married with two children. He owns a minivan and offers transportation services in the city. He understands his role as the head and provider for his family, and is ready to work 24/7 to provide for the needs of his loved ones. He has been faithfully working in this business for eight years. Abdumavlon has found his niche in this business. Today, it’s a lot harder to start your own business as a public van driver. Currently, Abdumavlon’s net profit is about $500 a month. An economical diesel engine in his vehicle helps him reduce his operating costs and adds to his bottom line. Loans that Abdumavlon has received from IMON International have helped to promote stability and growth in his business. Abdumavlon is asking for a loan of 7,000 Somoni to purchase necessary car parts to fix his minivan. He understands the effort and commitment it takes to be a private entrepreneur and is willing to work hard in his business to be able to support his family, which is the first priority in his life. More about Tajikistan and IMON International Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes being a key post along the Silk Road, and for the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. IMON's History Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low-income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing spare parts for maintenance of his minivan

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to expand call center

loans.name: Mwanarusi

texts.en:
Mwanarusi is a married woman with five children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees.

She has operated a fish selling business for the past three months, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby.  Mwanarusi faces a major challenge of seasonality and high cost of transportation in her business. She hopes to be self reliant in the future.

With the Kshs 30,000 she wants to purchase cooking oil, frying pan and sacks of fish for sale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase cooking oil, frying pan and sacks of fish for sale.

loans.name: Kimsan

texts.en:
Mrs. Kimsan S., 55, is a widow. She has no children and lives with her elderly mother, a nephew and a niece on an island in the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh. 

Kimsan is a weaver. She also buys finished fabric (silk and cotton) from fellow villagers for resale to a middleman in Phnom Penh. She is asking for her first loan of $1,000 to expand her business by purchasing additional silk and cotton products for resale.

loans.use: to purchase silk and cotton products for resale

loans.name: Ana Beatriz

texts.es:
La señora Ana, es socia del banco comunal Las Luchadoras, del Distrito Campo Verde, Departamento de Ucayali, tiene 59 años de edad, tiene 7 hijos pero solo uno está a su cargo.
Tiene una pequeña bodega instalada en su casa, la misma que viene implementando cada vez que saca un préstamo,  lleva recién 2 años trabajando con Manuela Ramos.
Con su nuevo prestamos de S/. 1,000.00 nuevos soles comprará; ½ caja de leche, 1 saco de sal, ½ saco de azúcar, ½ saco de arroz, 2 paquetes de papel higiénico, 1 bolsa de legía, ½ caja de jabón en barra, 3 jabas de gaseosa, 1 paquete de agua.
Es poco lo que puede comprar con el préstamo que saca pero, pero es la capacidad de pago que tiene por el momento, mas adelante subirá su crédito para ampliar su negocio.
Esta tranquila porque con lo que trabaja le alcanza para pagar los estudios de su hijo.
texts.en:
Ana is a member of the 'Las Luchadoras' community bank which is located in Campo Verde district, in Ucayali department.  She is 59 years old and has 7 children, only one of whom is still in her care.

Ana has a small grocery store in her home.  She stocks her store every time she takes out a loan.  She has been working with Manuela Ramos for 2 years.

Ana will use her new loan for 1,000 Peruvian soles to buy half a crate of milk, 1 sack of salt, half a sack of sugar, half a sack of rice, 2 packs of toilet paper, 1 bag of bleach, half a box of bars of soap, three 3 crates of soda and 1 packet of water.

Ana cannot buy much with the loan that she is taking but it is in accordance with the payment capacity that she has right now.  Later she will raise her loan amount in order to expand her business.  She is happy because the money she makes through her work is enough to pay for her son's education.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, soap, toilet paper and bleach

loans.name: Sol Naciente Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal “Sol Naciente” tiene 2 ciclos D. funcionamiento (cada ciclo son 4 meses) entonces tiene un año juntos como grupo,  el banco comunal está conformado por personas amigables y carismáticas. Las reuniones del banco comunal son cada treinta días en la oficina central D. la Asociación Arariwa D. la ciudad del Cusco. La mayoría D. los socios viven en los diferentes distritos D. la ciudad del Cusco.  Cusco es una D. las ciudades más visitadas D. nuestro país. El Cusco cuenta con una infinidad D. atractivos turísticos cercanos que han encantado al mundo entero. Uno D. los principales es Machupicchu, una D. las maravillas del mundo, una ciudad D. piedra muy famosa por sus construcciones y el reflejo D. la civilización inca. Es además uno D. los destinos turísticos más visitados en el mundo por la belleza D. sus paisajes como: terrazas agrícolas, cascadas, riachuelos, escaleras D. piedra e impresionantes lugares históricos. 

Los socios son personas que se sientes muy orgullosos D. vivir en la ciudad del Cusco y aprovechan las oportunidades para salir adelante y con su esfuerzo diario entregar un mejor futuro a sus hijos.  Las actividades económicas D. algunos D. los socios a las que se dedican son por ejemplo; venta D. ropa, comestibles, artesanía,  libros, accesorios para celulares y otros se dedican a brindar servicios.  
 
La socia Lidia nació en la ciudad del Quillabamba provincia D. la Convección  del departamento del Cusco y tiene 49 años D. edad. Actualmente, Lidia vive junto con sus dos hijos en la ciudad  del Cusco. Su actividad económica principal D. Lidia es ofrecer sus servicios profesional D. contabilidad, ella tiene un estudio contable que está básicamente implementado, ella abrió el  estudio contable en el año 1996 y desD. entonces tiene que implementarlo con muebles como escritorios, sillas,  computadoras personales y otras cosas más. En esta oportunidad Lidia requiere el préstamo e igual que sus compañeras del banco comunal para incrementar capital del negocio pero ella desea aumentar su dinero para comprar una laptop. El sueño D. Lidia es tener otro estudio contable y sacar profesionales a sus hijos.  

(Los socios que faltan en la foto no están porque pidieron permiso para no estar presente en la reunión).
texts.en:
The "Sol Naciente” ["Rising Sun"] communal bank has been operating for 2 loan cycles (each cycle is 4 months), and thus the members have 1 year together as a group. The communal bank is maD. up of friendly and charismatic people. Its meetings take place every thirty days in the central office of the Arariwa Association, in the city of Cusco. Most of the members live in the various districts of the city of Cusco.  Cusco is one of the most-visited cities of our country. It has countless tourist attractions nearby which have delighted visitors from everywhere in the world. One of the most important is Machu Picchu, one of the wonders of the world, a city of stone that is very famous for its constructions and its reflection of Inca civilization. It is also one of the most visited tourist destinations in the world thanks to the beauty of its landscapes, including agricultural terraces, waterfalls, rivers, stone staircases and impressive historic sites. 

The members are people who feel very proud of living in the city of Cusco, and they are taking advantage of opportunities to get ahead and proviD. a better future for their children through their daily efforts. The economic activities pursued by some of the members incluD., for example, selling clothing, food, handicrafts, books, or cell phone accessories, while others work providing services. 

Lidia is a member who was born in the city of Quillabamba, in Convección province of the department of Cusco. She is 49 years old. Currently, Lidia lives together with her two children in the city of Cusco. Lidia's main economic activity is offering professional accounting services. She has an accounting firm which is equipped with the basics. She opened this office in 1996, and since then she has improved it with furnishings such as desks, chairs, personal computers and other things. At this time, Lidia needs a loan, like her fellow members of the communal bank, to increase her business capital. She would like to increase her capital so she can buy a laptop. Lidia's dream is to have another accounting office and help her children become professionals.   

(Note: The members who are missing in the photo are not present because they asked to be excused from this meeting.)

loans.use: to buy a laptop for her business

loans.name: Mano Group

texts.en:
In the photo are members of the “Mano” group. They are small-scale businesspeople based in Makeni, a city in northern Sierra Leone. They have come to SMT/Kiva lenders to request a loan of SLL 1,400,000 for each, in order to improve their businesses. The leader of this group is Dura S.. 

Dura is 59 years old.   He was born in Makeni city, where he is currently residing with his wife and 3 children. His wife is a businesswoman and 2 of his children are attending primary school.  One is in secondary school.  Dura has been selling fowl for many years now.  He will use his share of this loan to buy dozens of fowl to resell.

loans.use: to buy dozens of fowl

loans.name: Hanna

texts.en:
Hanna is a 42-year-old woman who lives in the West Point area. She and her partner are living together. They have 5 children between the ages of 5 and 12; all of them attend school. Hanna runs a mini-used clothing and shoe store in her area. Sales are not always good because the inventory in her shop is low. Hanna is requesting a loan to purchase more clothes and shoes for her business.

Hanna's dream is to build a house for her children and send them to quality schools.

loans.use: to purchase more clothes and shoes for her business

loans.name: Jose Luis

texts.es:
Jose Luis nació en la ciudad de Abancay del departamento de Apurímac, tiene 28 años y vive en la ciudad del Cusco junto con sus padres. Jose Luis es técnico dental y desde varios años tiene su propio laboratorio dental. El es una persona responsable que actualmente estudia la carrera profesional de odontología en la Universidad Privada de Alas Peruanas y está cursando el tercer año de estudio. Jose Luis tiene crédito con  la Asociación Arariwa, está muy contenta de saber que tiene un apoyo financiero ya que siempre ha demostrado ser responsable en sus pagos, además le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal “Templo del Inca” porque todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias, agradece a aquellas personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita y le será muy útil en el progreso de su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, será para implementar el laboratorio y comprara materiales como masillas, amalgamas y también para pagar sus matriculas dela universidad.  

Jose Luis es persona emprendedora y trabajadora que saca adelante su profesión y su sueño es abrir una clínica odontológica.
texts.en:
Jose Luis was born in Abancay in the department of Apurímac. He is 28 years old and lives in Cusco with his parents. He is a dental technician and has had his own laboratory for several years. He is a responsible person and is currently studying to become an odontologist at the Universidad Privada de Alas Peruanas. He’s in his third year.

Jose Luis has a loan with Kiva partner Asociación Arariwa. He is very happy to know that he has this financial support and has always been very responsible with paying back the loan. He is also pleased to be part of the ‘Templo del Inca’ Community Bank because the members are responsible people and very committed.

Jose Luis wishes to thank all those who contribute to his loan which will be very useful in helping him with the business. With the money he plans to buy items for the laboratory such as filler and amalgam, as well as pay his university fees. He is a hardworking, enterprising person who wants to get ahead in his career. His dream is to open an odontology clinic.

loans.use: to buy items for his laboratory such as filler and amalgam, as well as pay his university fees

loans.name: Jackeline

texts.es: Jackeline, de 27 años, es una mujer muy amable y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Víctor de 30 años y sus 2 queridos hijos Hugo de 6 y Virginia de 3 años, a quienes desea brindar una mejor calidad de vida. El negocio al que Jackeline se dedica es la venta de cerveza, gaseosas y hielo, su puesto esta ubicado en su propia casa y todos los fines de semana lleva muchas cajas de cerveza y gaseosas para renovar las que han sido consumidas durante la semana. Ella es una vendedora muy alegre y carismática, por eso sus clientes la prefieren antes que a la competencia. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es conversar con sus clientes, ya que así hace más amenas sus largas jornadas de trabajo, lleva 6 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es trasladar las pesadas cajas de cerveza. Para el futuro, espera poder poner una tienda, donde pueda brindar una mejor atención a sus clientes. Este sería su sexto crédito con MFP, sabe que tiene que pagar sus cuotas puntualmente y esta dispuesta a hacerlo, en su banco comunal es una socia muy alegre y colaboradora. Con los dos mil nuevos soles solicitados, comprará más cajas de cerveza, ya que por estas fechas se incrementa su demanda.
texts.en:
Jackeline, 27 years old, is a very friendly and hardworking woman. She lives in her own house together with her husband Victor, 32, and their two cherished children, Hugo, 6, and Virginia, 3, who she wants to give a better quality of life. 

Jackeline's business is selling beer, sodas and ice from her home. Every weekend she carries a lot of cases of beer and sodas to replace what's been consumed during the week. She is a very happy and charismatic saleswoman, which is why her clients prefer her over the competition. What she likes most about her work is talking with her customers, since it makes her long work shifts seem lighter. She's been doing this for 6 years and thinks the hardest part is transporting the heavy boxes of beer. In the future, she hopes to put in a store where she can give better service to her clients. 

This will be her 6th loan with MFP and she knows that she has to make payments punctually and is ready to do so. She is a happy and cooperative member of her village bank. With the 2,000 nuevos soles requested she will buy more cases of beer, since demand has been increasing lately.

loans.use: to buy more cases of beer.

loans.name: Sukunthea

texts.en:
Sukunthea, 46 years old, has been selling pottery with her husband since 2000. They have four children, 17, 13, 11, and 9 years old. Three are studying and one is helping them to sell pottery. 

The income of this family is $20 per day. Every month, she has to spend $150 on food, $10 on electricity and $15 on school fees. 

She would like to request a loan of $1,000 to buy a motorbike with a trailer attached to transport the pottery to sell in the provinces nearby. She will try hard with her business to get a good income that can send all of her children to study in the university when they finish high school.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike with a trailer attached to transport her pottery products.

loans.name: Novelita

texts.en: Novelita, a 43-year-old married woman with one child, has been growing rice for six years and earns about 8000 PHP per month.  Novelita plans to use her loan to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs, and in the future hopes to be a successful businesswoman.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs.

loans.name: El Progreso Group

texts.es:
El comité denominado El Progreso se encuentra en la ciudad de San Lorenzo, está conformado por 21 miembros, todas ellas vecinas y amigas de la ciudad.
El grupo de mujeres se define como mujeres jefas de familia que trabajan para el sustento diario de sus hogares. Manifiestan que todas trabajan de forma conjunta y solidaria, donde se ayudan recíprocamente dentro de un ambiente de respeto y cooperación.
La Sra. Maria se dedica a la venta de comida desde hace varios años ya. Ella todos los días se levanta a tempranas horas para elaborar los alimentos que pondrá a la venta y regresa ya entrada la noche. Por medio de este trabajo ella ha podido sacar a su familia adelante y darles así una vida digna y decorosa.
Ella solicita el credito para la compra de los insumos para la elaboración de los alimentos que vende, como ser, carnes, especias, huevos, y demás.
texts.en:
The “El Progreso” (The Progress) Communal Bank is in the city of San Lorenzo.  It is comprised of 21 members; all of them are neighbors and friends from the city.

This group of women is defined as being women who are heads of the family.  They work for the daily support of their households.  They say that they all work together in a supportive way.  They help each other within an atmosphere of respect and cooperation.

Maria has been selling food for several years now.  She gets up in the early hours every day to make the food that she will sell, and she returns at night.  Through this work she has been able to get her family ahead.  She has also been able to give them a decent and respectable life.

She is requesting the loan to buy supplies to make the food she sells.  She will buy things like meat, spices, eggs, and other ingredients.

loans.use: to buy meat, spices, eggs, and other ingredients to make food.

loans.name: Canisia

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al Banco Comunal “TAYTACHA SEÑOR DE CCOYLLORITY DE YUNGAQUI”; El banco pertenece al distrito de Yungaqui, Provincia de Anta, departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Canisia; la socia tiene 48 años; la socia es conviviente y tiene 3 hijos, de 12, 9, 7 años de edad;  La socia se dedica a la compra y venta de animales menores, la socia cría cuyes, chanchos, ovejas, gallinas, la socia vende en la tablada los días de feria que son los sábados y domingos, la socia desea comprar 2 vacas terneras para aumentar sus ganados, la socia los cría engorda produce leche las vacas ella tiene la posibilidad de vender leche fresca y producir quesos y luego vender las vacas maduras o vender como carne, la socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de 2 vacas tiernas.

La socia se muestra muy satisfecha y agradecida por el apoyo que se le brindara mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus deudas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the Community Bank  “TAYTACHA SEÑOR DE CCOYLLORITY DE YUNGAQUI”.  The bank is in Yungaqui district, in the province of Anta, and department of Cusco.

The member is Señora Canisia, and she is 48 years old.  The member lives with her partner and has 3 children, aged 12, 9, and 7 years old.  The member works buying and selling small animals; the member raises guinea pigs, pigs, sheep, and chickens.  The member sells in La Tablada, where market days are Saturdays and Sundays.

The member wants to buy two calves to increase her herds.  The member will raise them and fatten them to produce milk.  She has the possibility to sell fresh milk and make cheese, and then later sell the mature cows or sell them as meat.  The member is applying for the loan to invest in the purchase of two young cows.

The member is very satisfied and grateful for the support that is provided through this medium and agrees to comply with her repayments within the prescribed period.

loans.use: to invest in the purchase of two young cows.

loans.name: Miriam Gladis

texts.en:
Miriam Gladis is 47 years old and married with two children. Her son is 20 years old and her daughter is 10 years old. She has a small cafe in the university located in the city of Calca. She sells breakfast, lunch, and dinner five days a week at her cafe. In addition, she has a business selling corn and some clothing from her house on Saturdays and Sundays. 

Miriam is asking for a 1,000 dollar loan mainly to buy more corn to sell on the weekends. She also plans to use a small portion of the money to buy ingredients for her cafe such as potatoes, chicken, and beef. She is a very hard-working woman and is committed to making all of the necessary loan payments on time.

loans.use: to buy more corn to sell.

loans.name: Rogelio

texts.en:
Rogelio is 56 years old, a diligent father of seven children. He is a farmer working in the Philippines. 

To make living, Rogelio is engaged in a farming and hog raising business. He has run his hog raising business for almost 10 years. His wife is housekeeper and partner in managing their businesses.

Rogelio’s goal is to gain higher income from the business to further support his family's necessities. He wants to borrow a loan to buy feed for the maintenance of his hogs. He believes that through the loan he can maintain his hog raising business and attain his goal.

loans.use: to buy feed for the maintenance of his hogs.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is a 27-year-old married woman with a 3-year-old child. She lives in the town of Sto. Niño, South Cotabato with her family. Rose's husband works as a farmer.

Rose has been in the business of raising hogs for 4 years. She earns about 10,000 PHP per month from her business. Rose plans to use her loan to purchase piglets, feeds, rice seeds and fertilizers. Rose works hard to support her family.

In the future, Rose hopes to have a successful business.

loans.use: to purchase piglets, feeds, rice seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Dorita

texts.en:
Dorita works hard to support her family. Dorita is married and has a scrapping business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for five years now and also earns an additional income from her general store business.

Dorita requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more scrap to resell.

In the future, Dorita would like to build and expand her business to support the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more scrap to resell.

loans.name: Narcisa

texts.en:
Narcisa is 48 years old and lives in Villaflor, Oroquieta City. She is married with two children. 

To earn a living, Leonila has a business selling items such as sugar, milk, vegetable oil, canned goods, cigarettes, etc. She earns about 1,500 Philippines pesos (PHP) each month doing this type of work. Leonila has requested a loan of 3,000 PHP to purchase more stock for her grocery store.

Leonila has been a member of PMPC for three years. In the future, Leonila would like to save more coming from the business. Leonila is a good mother and loving wife. She is hardworking and proud to be a member of PMPC because they can help in terms of financial problems anytime.

loans.use: to purchase more stock for her grocery store.

loans.name: Flordeliza

texts.en:
Flordeliza is 26 and single. She lives in a village with her beloved parents. She engages herself in selling different kind of soft drinks in their village to help her parents in gaining income. She has operated this business for almost four years and usually earns a profits of PHP 6,000 a month, which she uses for their food, clothing and allowances of her younger sister.

She aims to improve her business to increase her income, but due to financial difficulty, she is asking for additional capital of PHP 14,000 to buy additional stocks of soft drinks like Gatorade, C2, Coke, Pop Cola, Sprite, Pepsi and Mountain Dew. 

She believes that this loan will help her to improve the business and hopes that she can make her business a viable source of income through patience and hard work.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of soft drinks to sell.

loans.name: Aisha

texts.en:
Aisha is a married woman. She has three children with two currently enrolled in school. Aisha operates a poultry business and sells her goods at the market. She's worked in this business for six months and her primary customers are wholesalers in town. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Aisha's other source of income includes her husband's earnings. She describes her greatest business challenge to be the dropping prices for chickens. Her largest monthly expense is food for her family.

Aisha will use the loan of 20,000 Kenyan shillings to purchase more chickens. Aisha aspires to expand into her own wholesale business in the future.

loans.use: To purchase more chickens.

loans.name: Fermin

texts.es:
El Sr. Fermin es de la ciudad de Santaní, tiene 55 años de edad, está casado con la Sra. Graciela de 38 años de edad. Tiene 2 hijos, todos en edad escolar.
Tiene un Automóvil en el cual trabaja como taxi de pasajeros, tiene 2 puestos de trabajo, mercado municipal y terminal de ómnibus. Tiene una clientela bien formada, lo cual le genera buen ingreso. Nos comenta que tiene buenas referencias comerciales y personales, el es un señor muy trabajador, excelente cliente con la fundación.
El desea seguir ampliándose, y por eso solicita el crédito para la construcción de un salón donde podrá poner sus automóviles. Agradece a la fundación por la oportunidad que esta le da.
texts.en:
Fermín, 55, lives in the city of Santaní with his wife, Graciela, 38.  He has two school age children.

He has a car that works as a passenger taxi.  He has two pick-up points: the municipal market and the bus terminal.  He has a well-formed clientele which generates good income.  He comments that he has good personal and commercial references.   He is a very hardworking man and an excellent client of the Fundación.

He wants to continue to grow so is asking for the loan to build a garage where he can keep his automobiles.  He thanks the Fundación for the opportunity it gives him.

loans.use: to buy building materials and supplies.

loans.name: Monique

texts.en: Monique, who is 24 years old and engaged to be married, sells used clothes in a store she has been running for five years.  She would like a loan to buy more clothes to sell. The profits will be reinvested into her business which she would love to see grow in the future.

loans.use: to buy more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Alma Leticia

texts.es:
Un buen cambio importante será este préstamo para su negocio y su vida. La señora Alma desea tener más mercancía para vender ya que tiene un buen lugar donde exponer su mercancía, pero le esta haciendo falta mas variedad de productos como es ropa de invierno y accesorios para dama. 
 Doña Alma vive con su hija quien le ayuda con el negocio se pueden poner en diferentes partes de la ciudad, ya que es divorciada y tiene bajo su responsabilidad a su hija quien estudia la preparatoria y en días de vacaciones es cuando le ayuda en el negocio. 
Con esta inversión el negocio de la  señora Alma tendrá mayor ganancia.
texts.en:
This loan will bring about a good change that is important for Sra. Alma’s business and her life. She wants to have more merchandise to sell since she already has a good place where she can display her goods. However, she lacks a greater variety of products, such as winter clothing and women’s accessories.

Doña Alma lives with her daughter who helps with the business. They are able to conduct business in different parts of the city. Alma is divorced and has responsibility for her daughter, who studies at a preparatory school. She helps with the business on her vacation days.

With this business investment, Sra. Alma will have more income.
