loans.use: to buy winter clothing and women’s personal accessories.

loans.name: Nambami A Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Nambami A Group in Western Kenya! Geofrey is the facilitator of the group. This group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program. 

Geofrey takes care of six children at home. He joined One Acre Fund in order to grow enough to feed his family and access fertilizer and hybrid seeds. In the recent 2011 season, he had a very good maize yield harvesting 12 1/2 bags on one acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, he was only able to harvest six bags of maize on one acre of land. 

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Geofrey and his group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance. 

With income from his maize sales, Geofrey will invest in livestock rearing and business to raise his living standard. In 2012, the members of Nambami A group will each plant between ½ and 1 acre of maize.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Marcela Alexandra

texts.es:
Marcela de 44 años, empezó con esta actividad cuando su esposo la abandono y tuvo que sacar adelante a su familia, con la ayuda de Dios ha podido sobresalir y hasta ahora le ha ido muy bien.

Ella trabaja solo y viaja a Perú a ver su mercadería.

Está separada y tiene 3 hijos, 2 son mayores de edad y la ultima hija tiene 10 años que estudia en escuela fiscal.

Su meta a alcanzar es poder agrandar su negocio y poder mejorar su vivienda.
texts.en: Marcela, 44, started this activity when her husband abandoned her and she had to support her family.  With God’s help she’s managed to get ahead and to date has done very well.  She works alone and travels to Perú to get her merchandise.  She’s separated and has three children; two are adults and her youngest daughter is 10 years old and attends public school.  Her goal is to be able to increase her business and to do some home improvements.

loans.use: to buy blouses and pants.

loans.name: Noralba

texts.es: La señora Noralba a sus 34 años de edad se dedica a prestar servicios de asesorias contables desde hace varios años cuando decidió iniciar su propio negocio en el cual pudiera aplicar sus conocimientos adquiridos en al universidad donde estudio contaduría. Con el ánimo de mejorar la calidad y agilidad en el servicio que presta, la señora Noralba necesita de la compra de un software contable que le ayude a realizar mejorar su labor y le permita mejorar sus ingresos y así apoyar a sus padres y cumplir su sueño de tener su propia oficina de asesorias contables.
texts.en: Noralba is 34 years old and has provided accounting consulting services for several years. She decided to start her own business in which she could use the knowledge she learned at university, where she studied accounting. With an eye toward improving the quality and quickness of the services she provides, Noralba needs to buy an accounting software program that will help her to improve her work and allow her to improve her income. In this way she can help her parents and achieve her dream of having her own accounting consulting office.

loans.use: to buy an accounting software program

loans.name: Way Forward Group

texts.en:
Aminata is the leader of this group of entrepreneurs. Aminata was born in Kambia town, about  forty-eight years ago. She is married to a salaried worker and the couple have three children who are attending secondary schools. Aminata sells used clothes and has been doing this business for over twenty years now. 

With the help of this loan, Aminata and her group members will be able to expand their businesses, make more sales and consequently improve their living conditions. Aminata will use her share of the loan (2,000,000 SLL) to buy used clothes in large quantity to add to her current stock.


(Also included on the left of the photo is loan officer Kadiatu Bah, handing over the loan amount to the borrowers.)

loans.use: to buy used clothes in large quantity to add to her current stock.

loans.name: José

texts.es:
José de 66 años de edad ofrece servicios electrónicos en  vehículos  de mantenimiento y reparación. Él desarrolló su  experiencia de trabajo como auxiliar de mecánica y electromecánica, durante 6 años, porque  fue empleado de  una empresa, de donde nació su propio negocio,  quedó cesante y decidió dedicarse manera independiente a ello. Su negocio funciona en un espacio subarrendado  de un parqueadero en un punto de gran concurrencia vehicular; él se ha hecho muy conocido por los propietarios de vehículos que guardan sus vehículos mientras trabajan o hacen diligencias en el centro de la ciudad, la zona mas concurrida comicialmente de Barranquilla.
Con sus ingresos genera bienestar a sus hijos y apoya a su familia también y esto para él es muy importante. En la actualidad está aplicando a su primer credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el comprará repuestos y algunas herramientas como tester, y extensiones eléctricas, muy necesarias para su buen desempeño, con lo que ofrecerá un mejor servicio a sus clientes. El maneja una rentabilidad sobre sus ventas no menor del 42% y con sus créditos planea aumentarla, comprando de contado y buscando el incremento de su clientela a quien atiende con muchos deseos de ofrecerle la solución que ellos requieren.
texts.en:
José, who is 66 years old, offers electronic services for vehicle maintenance and repairs.  He developed his job experience as a mechanic and elecromechanic's assistant.  He was employed by a company for 6 years, from which his own company was born.  He lost his job and decided to do the job independently.  His business functions in a sublet space in a parking lot where there is great vehicular traffic.  He has become very well known by the car owners that keep their cars in the area while they work or that run errands in the center of the city, Barranquilla's most crowded commercial zone.  

With his income, he provides wellbeing for his children, and he supports his family as well.  For him, this is very important.  He is currently applying for his first Kiva loan, the first loan that Fundación Mario Santo Domingo is making.  With the loan, he will buy spare parts and some tools that are very necessary for his good performance such as a [battery] tester and extension cords.  He will offer better service to his customers with these items.  He earns a profit above his costs that is no less that 42%.  He plans to increase his profits with the loan by paying cash and looking to increase the number of customers that he serves with high desires of offering them the solution that they need.

loans.use: to buy spare parts and some tools like a [battery] tester and extension cords.

loans.name: Sonya

texts.en: Sonya sends her greetings to Kiva and will be happy if she manages her third Kiva deal. Sonya lives in Ijevan city of Tavush region with her daughter and grandchildren. Sonya has vocational education and specialty of nurse but she never worked of her profession. Being in the trading business already 20 years she earns on her family living and also covers the needs of her grandchildren. At the city’s wholesale market renting a stall she sells woman clothes of great variety and of different style. Sonya this time again needs Kiva support for her business and she asks a loan of 500.000 Armenian drams to renew her stall’s clothes assortment with new winter season women clothes.

loans.use: to renew her stall’s clothes assortment with new winter season women clothes

loans.name: Sylvie

texts.en:
Around 37 years old, Madagme Sylvie G. is married and mother of two children. Her husband is a tailor. This dynamic woman always has ambition to participate and take responsibilities for housekeeping, and has done this since an early age. With limited financial means at her disposal, she started a side business of selling loincloth. Today with almost 10 years in the field, she has mastered the contours of the business. She desires to improve this business, and open a shop. But her limited financial means do not permit her to undertake this project, while at the same time the demands of her clients have grown. The level of her schooling is enables her to manager her activities well. Today Madame Sylvie G. requests a loan of $950 to improve her business. This loan will permit her to rent a shop and provide a more consistent service, also to purchase and resell loincloth of quality.

Translated from French by Farron Blanc, a Kiva Volunteer

Agée de 37 ans environ, Madame G. Sylvie est mariée et mère de deux (02) enfants. Son mari est un tailleur. Cette femme dynamique a toujours eu pour ambition de participer activement aux charges de son ménage et elle commencé très tôt à se battre pour cela. Avec les maigres moyens qu’elle avait à sa disposition, elle commença un petit commerce de vente de pagne. Aujourd’hui, forte d’une expérience de près de 10 ans dans le domaine, elle maîtrise bien les contours de son activité. Elle désire améliorer cette activité par l’ouverture d’une boutique. Mais ses moyens financiers très limités ne lui permettent pas d’entreprendre ce projet alors même que la clientèle est devenue importante. Son niveau d’étude secondaire lui permet de bien gérer ses activités. Aujourd’hui Madame G. Sylvie sollicite un financement de $950 pour renforcer son activité. Ce crédit lui permettra de louer une boutique et de disposer d’un fons de commerce plus consistant pour l’achat et la revente des pagnes de qualité.

loans.use: rent a shop and purchase and resell loincloth

loans.name: Kamran

texts.en:
Kamran is a member of the Hunter Society. He has a hunting dog. This clever dog helps him to hunt.
In the beginning of his business he did not have a dog and it was a big problem for him.
One day he decided to borrow $400 and bought the hunting dog.
Now he needs a loan of $1000 to buy a fowling-piece, which is a light shotgun for shooting birds and small animals.Kamran has been in this business for 4 years. He has a license for hunting.
Kamran is 57, an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan Fizuli region, settled in Fizuli region, Mahmudlu village He is married and has 2 children.

loans.use: To buy a fowling-piece

loans.name: Francisco

texts.en:
Francisco is married and has three young children, ages 5, 7 and 10. Forty years ago, Francisco's father founded a business selling fruits and vegetables which as a boy Francisco lent a hand in running so that his brothers and sisters could continue their studies. Later, when his father fell ill, Francisco headed up the business and saw it grow. He has recently acquired a van and now delivers his produce to outer neighborhoods where there is good demand. At this time, Francisco is asking for a loan of $375 to grow his business. He will use it to buy the produce his customers demand. He promises to repay the loan in 6-12 months. Francisco could use your help and appreciates your support and confidence.

Translated by a Kiva Volunteer.

Francisco es casado y tiene tres pequeños hijos, de 5, 7 y 10 años de edad, su padre inició el negocio de venta de fruta y verdura desde hace 40 años, y desde muy pequeño le ayuda en el negocio para poder que sus hermanos continuaran estudiando, después su padre enfermó y no pudo continuar trabajando, es así como Francisco quedó el frente del negocio y afortunadamente lo ha hecho crecer, recientemente ha adquirido una camioneta para llevar sus productos hasta las colonias más retiradas y ha tenido gran demanda de estos clientes.

Para continuar creciendo, Francisco solicita un préstamo de $ 375 dólares que empleara en la compra de mercancía para poder cubrir la demanda de sus clientes y ofrecer un buen servicio él se compromete a regresar esta cantidad en un lapso de 6 a 12 meses. Tu ayuda será de gran utilidad para Francisco, él te agradece sinceramente tu confianza y ayuda.

loans.use: To buy fruits and vegetables for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase merchandise at discount prices

loans.name: Soa

texts.en: Mrs. Soa C., 50, is married, has six children, and lives with her husband in Prey veng province, Cambodia. She sells vegetables at an open-air market where she can typically earn about US$12.5/day in revenue. Her husband is currently employed at a local community, where he earns around US$2 a day, while one of their children works for Care (a local organization), earning US$100 a month. Another three of the couple's chilcren are students. Mrs. Soa C. has applied for a loan of US$1,000 to repair the leaks in their house, which is important because of the coming rainy season. She and her family are very grateful for all the lenders' trust and support.

loans.use: Repair of a house

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
GLORIA, age 49, supports a house of 7 with her bar and liquor store, “T. Square Take Away Drinks.” Although she has no children of her own, she and her husband take care of 5 relatives’ children, three of which have been orphaned. Gloria’s husband, who used to work for the local phone company, is now without a job because of a stroke that affected his memory.

Gloria’s bar and shop opened around 2½ years ago and now employs 5 workers. This business brings Gloria an average profit of around $20 a day, from its 10-20 customers on the weekdays and 50 on the weekends.

Gloria has taken out two previous loans from Tujijenge Tanzania to buy a deep freezer and initial stock for her liquor store. Having paid these back successfully, she now hopes for a third loan to increase her inventory and buy chairs for her bar.

Gloria belongs to the group Makete (named after their district in Dar es Salaam), which consists of 15 other members who keep each other accountable and insure one another in paying back their loans.

loans.use: To increase inventory and buy chairs

loans.name: Rosemary

texts.en: Rosemary O. is a 27-year-old married mother of 2 children. She has spent two years learning the art of dressmaking/embroidery and has offered her tailoring services within her community in Kisumu, Kenya since 2002.  She specializes in making women’s dresses, men’s shirts and also embroidery.  Despite the stiff competition in her area, Rosemary has always been able to attract old and new customers.  She constantly updates her materials to keep up with the current fashions, offers a wide selection of patterns and maintains a good stock to meet her customers’ demands.  Her hard work, years of experience and well-established client base ensure that her business will continue to succeed.  She plans to use three quarters of her next loan of US $ 800 to buy new patterns and materials, and save the remaining amount into her  account to use in case of unforeseen circumstances.

loans.use: Buy stock of tailoring materials

loans.name: Epifania's Group

texts.en:
Aurea, Epifanis, and Delfina have been part of the community bank “Virgen Maria” for two years or less. In the bank they have learned how to invest money, to demand respect from people, how to care for their children, and how to save.

Aurea is 27 and has three children. She has had a grocery store in the town of Quicapata for 18 months. At first she sold things door to door but now she has been able to put a roof on her house and sell her products from there. She also used to sell cattle with her husband, but gave up that business to spend more time with her children.

Epifania is 41 and has six children. She sells meat in the city of San Francisco, which is located in the nearby jungle region. She travels to different markets to buy animals and later butchers them. She sells her meat at markets and different restaurants. She also buys "toccra", a product made from banana leaves and chewed like tobacco, which she sells in Lima.

Delfina is 55 and has 2 children. She sells clothing imported from the cities of Lima and Tacna. She sells her products at different markets around Ayacucho.

Aurea, Epifania, and Delfina need loans of 1000, 1200, and 1000 soles respectively (3 soles = $1), which they will invest in buying rice, squash, carrots, onion, sheep, pork, roosters, and a showcase to display products for sale.

They plan to use their savings to: buy more cattle; build a house; educate their children; and to continue developing their businesses. Aurea, Epifania, and Delfina dream of opening a grocery store in the jungle; that their children will be professionals; and that they will someday be able to travel to the town where they were born.

loans.use: invest in and expand their various businesses

loans.name: María Antonia

texts.en:
María Antonia is a forty-six-year-old, experienced businesswoman and mother of three children. María is a well-known seamstress in El Cacique community of Yamasá, seeing that she has been working there for more than twenty years. Five years ago, María Antonia decided to take advantage of her reputation and opened her own shop in a locale she had bought beforehand. The entrepreneur says that she has a well-established clientele, the majority of whom are parents of school-going children. María also explains that she has a monthly income of about US$ 250.

When she is overburdened and has many orders, she hires other experienced women temporarily to help her. María plans on using her loan to buy special cloth to start producing bedspreads, pillows, and cushions because these products are in high demand in her community.

María’s business supports her children’s university studies.

loans.use: To invest in the purchase of cloth in order to produce bedspreads, pillows, and cushions.

loans.name: Elvira

texts.es:
Elvira, 45, is a single mother. She lives in a humble house in Managua's Laureles Sur neighborhood. For 10 years, she has operated a small store in which she sells various products. She's built the business with loans and she now has a store stocked with all kinds of products such as dairy foods, canned goods and everyday things like beans and rice that every household needs. She's asking for a loan to stock summer products because in the beach season there will be a big demand for sardines, canned tuna, etc. By working hard and using credit wisely, she hopes her small store will ultimately become a large general store and that when she is older, her children will take it over as a family business so that they can lead dignified lives.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

Doña Elvira R., es madre solera de 45 años, habita en una humilde vivienda del Barrio Laureles Sur y desde hace 10 años de forma improvisada montó una pequeña venta de productos varios, con créditos ha venido creciendo y hoy en día tiene una pulpería abastecida con toda clase de productos de alimentos lácteos, enlatados, alimentos crudos como frijoles y arroz entre otras cosas de importancia en el hogar como papel higiénico, pasta de dientes, etc. Solicita un Préstamo para abastecer de productos de verano para esta época de playa en que se demanda mucho las sardinas, atún enlatados, con su esfuerzo y el buen uso de sus créditos su sueño es que su pulpería sea una Miscelánea grande y que cuando ella este mayor sus hijos la administren y mejoren el negocio familiar con el cual su madre pudo darles una vida digna.

loans.use: Buy product for resale.

loans.name: Fatima Rosario

texts.es:
Fátima C. is married and has an 8-year old daughter who is an elementary school student. Her husband works as a temporary laborer for PEMEX, a Mexican oil company. She started her business because she’s always liked sales and it would allow her to help her husband with the household expenses. She would like to create wealth for their daughter and for their next child, as she is pregnant. Three years ago she selling shoes by catalog, which has given her a good income.

She currently needs a loan of $250, to be repaid over three months, in order to fill her pending orders. With your contribution, Fátima will be able to make progress.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Westin, Kiva volunteer.

Fátima C. es casada y tiene una hija de 8 años que es estudiante de primaria, su esposo labora como empleado eventual de PEMEX. Inicio el negocio porque siempre le han gustado las ventas y de esa manera apoya a su esposo con los gastos del hogar, ya que desea forjar un patrimonio para su hija y para el próximo que viene ya que esta embarazada. Desde hace 3 años empezó con la venta de calzado por catalogo actividad que le ha generado buenos ingresos.

Actualmente requiere un crédito por US $250 que pagara en 3 meses para surtir pedidos pendientes. Con tu contribución Fátima lograra progresar.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Krishna Kumari

texts.en:
Mrs. Krishna kumari M. lives with her husband and three children in Thecho Village. Thecho is one of the developing villages in the Lalitpur district. Most of the people in this region are engaged in seasonal farming. Mrs. M.’s husband's name is Mr. Ratna Kazi Maharjan and he is engaged in handicraft work. Her daughter is studying in grade 9 and her sons are studying in grades 6 and 1 respectively.
Mrs. M. opened her poultry firm three years ago to upgrade her family's standard of living. She sells her chicken in the local market.
Now Mrs. M. is requesting for a $150 loan to buy more small chickens to sell.

loans.use: To buy small chickens.

loans.name: Hai

texts.en:
Mrs. Hai H., 46, and her husband, Mr. Savun Vor, 43, who live on an Island of Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh, were married when she was twenty years old and have six children, three sons and three daughters. Two of their children were married and live outside the family home. Other four children, two of whom weave silk at home, other one have full time employment, and the last one is in school.

Mrs. Hai has been a silk weaver since she was fifteen years old, a skill she learned from her mother. She sells her finished products to the middle man in the village, who then takes it to sell in Phnom Penh, while Mr. Savun has been a farmer for sixteen years and also assisting his wife in weaving business.

Now Hai is requesting a loan of US$600 to purchase silk material for her weaving business.

loans.use: To purchase silk material for weaving.

loans.name: Fatou Gassama

texts.fr:
Fatou Gassama S. is a widow and has 8 children to support. She's been a member of the Kadior village bank for 7 years. She would like to buy "monkey's bread" (baobab fruit), milk, sugar, palm oil and lemons. She intends to make and sell fruit juice and ice cream, and to retail the palm oil and the lemons. The profits of her business will enable her to provide for day-to-day expenses, and to improve the living conditions and the health status of her family. She's applying for a loan that will be repaid after six months, in one single installment.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer.

Fatou Gassama S., veuve avec 08 enfants en charge est membre du banc villageois de Kadior depuis 7 ans. Elle veut acheter du pain de singe, du lait, du sucre, de l'huile de palme et du citron. Elle va préparer et vendre du jus et des crèmes glaces et revendre l'huile de palme et le citron. Les revenus tirés de son commerce lui permettent de participer à la dépense quotidienne et d’améliorer les conditions de vie et de santé de sa famille. Elle sollicite un prêt qui sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance.

loans.use: To make and sell fruit juice and ice cream, and to retail palm oil and lemons

loans.name: Michael

texts.en: Michael Kechegwa is a married Tanzanian man with two children. His residence is in Buguruni in Dar-es-Salaam. He runs a cosmetics shop at Gongo la Mboto  He sells a variety of cosmetics-shop items to customers. He purchases his inventory from the wholesellers in the Kariakoo shopping center. His family's daily demands depend on his business. His business plan is to run a wholesale shop. He is requesting a loan to expand his business.

loans.use: Expand business

loans.name: Du Anka

texts.en: Du Anka is a 49-year-old woman from Doboj. She is a widow and she receives her husband's pension in the amount of 300 KM.  She has one daughter who goes to secondary school. This is her first loan and it amounts 1,200 KM.  She will use it to buy food for her livestock: pigs, cows, and sheep. Her wish is to fatten the pigs and to sell them for a good price.

loans.use: To buy food for stock.

loans.name: Maria Luisa

texts.es:
Maria F. tiene taller de costuras, junto a dos operarios (sus hermanos de 18 y 21 años de edad) confecciona chamarras para varones. Su marido trabaja en la ciudad de Cochabamba, la pareja tiene una hija de 5 años de edad pero Maria espera sus segundo hijo (lleva 4 meses de embarazo). 

Maria vive en la casa de sus padres ubicada en la Zona Brasil de Rio Seco, ciudad de El Alto.

Piensa usar el monto crediticio para comprar materia prima (tela) y confeccionar mayor número de  chamarras que se puedan llevar a la frontera con Perú (Desaguadero). 
 
Es su cuarto crédito con Impro, su buen comportamiento de pago es una buena garantía
texts.en:
Maria F. owns a sewing workshop. With two partners (her brothers, ages 18 and 21), she makes men's jackets. Maria's husband works in the city of Cochabamba. The couple have a 5-year-old daughter and Maria is expecting her second child (she is 4 months pregnant). Maria lives in her parents' house located in the Zona Brasil de Rio Seco district of the city of El Alto. She plans to use the loan to purchase materials (fabric) and make a greater number of jackets, which can be brought to the Peruvian border (Desaguadero) for sale. This is Maria's fourth loan with Impro. Her good payment history is an indicator of her ability to repay the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Todd M. Anderson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of materials

loans.name: Agung Ayu Putu Wirati

texts.id: Situasi ekonomi yang tidak menentu seperti sekarang ini sangat dirasakan oleh Agung Ayu Putu Wirati bersama suaminya, apalagi suaminya hanya bekerja sebagai seorang petani yang mana penghasilannya tidak menentu sehingga terkadang tidak bisa  mencukupi kebutuhan keluarganya. Karena desakan kebutuhan hidup yang semakin besar maka Agung Ayu Putu Wirati bersama suaminya berusaha untuk mengembangkan usaha ternak babi yang selama ini sudah mereka jalani sekitar 5 tahun yang lalu. Dalam satu periode pemeliharaan selama 5 bulan, Agung Ayu Putu Wirati bersama suaminya biasanya memelihara 3 sampai 5 ekor tergantung modal yang mereka miliki dengan keuntungan yang mereka dapat antara  Rp. 250.000,- sampai Rp. 300.000,- dan dari hasil tersebut ibu Agung Ayu Putu Wirati menggunakan untuk memenuhi kebutuhan keluarganya. Ibu Agung Ayu Putu Wirati juga mengakui karena keterbatasan modal usaha sehingga terkadang mereka kesulitan dalam membeli pakan apalagi untuk mengembangkan usahanya. Dengan kemudahan yang didapat dari DINARI melalui pembinaan dan pinjaman Modal Usaha sebesar Rp. 5.000.000,- dengan jangka waktu pinjaman selama 6 bulan dan pembayarannya dilakukan setelah akhir periode pemeliharaan, maka Agung Ayu Putu Wirati yakin bahwa usahanya kedepan bisa dikembangkan dengan baik sehingga ekonomi keluarganya juga bisa meningkat.
texts.en:
Agung Ayu Putu Wirati and her husband is feeling the effect of the current volatile economic situation. Her husband works as a farmer with uncertain income. To gain additional income stream, Agung Putu Wirati and her husband tried to grow their pig farm that they started 5 years ago. In a 5 month cycle, Agung Ayu Putu Wirati usually farms 3 to 5 pigs, and earns about $25-30 profit. She uses the earnings to pay for daily living expenses. Mrs Agung Ayu Putu Wirati feels that limited funding availability is restraining them from purchasing additional feed to grow her business. With DINARI's funding and training assistance, she is applying for $475 6-month loan. Agung Ayu Putu Wirati is certain that she can grow her business and increase her earnings.

Translated from Indonesian by Kresna Hartandi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase Feeds

loans.name: Angie Rose

texts.en:
Angie Rose is a 20 year old woman aspiring to help her family by starting up a buy and sell business. While living with her parents, she wants to help her brothers and sisters finish their educations. Her husband is working as a driver in the nearby province. They have a two-month-old son named Earl Lawrence.

Angie had joined ASHI to support her husband as well as her family. Her loan will be used to purchase curtains, pillow cases, and beauty products so that she can have an income that sustains her daily needs.

Through her membership in ASHI, she dreams of having a stable business that will help her and her husband acquire their own house, help her family, and give a bright future to Earl Lawrence.

loans.use: Buy products for resell

loans.name: Martha

texts.es:
La Señora de nombre Martha García tiene la edad de 59 años, su estado civil es casada, Doña Martha tiene 4 hijos de los cuales su hijo mayor de 45 años de edad trabaja por cuenta propia, otro de sus hijos que tiene la edad de 38 años que trabaja por cuenta propia, sus otra hija de 33 años de edad que cursa recientemente el 5 año de secundaria y su otro hijo de 28 años que cursa el técnico superior, su esposo no labora debido a la edad avanzada que el posee, los propósitos para con su negocio es ampliarlo y transformarlo en un comedor donde pueda brindarle a los clientes almuerzo familiar y comida a la carta y en sus deseos esta tener una pulpería para tener una variedad de ingresos para enfrentar la difícil situación económica.

La actividad económica a la que se dedica es la venta de comida en la que vende: desayunos, almuerzos y refrescos, el tiempo que tiene de poseer este negocio es de 10 años esta actividad la realiza a diario, ella inicia este negocio con una pequeña mesita donde vendía frutas y verduras mas tarde decide improvisar con una pulpería por lo que empezó con pocas cosas pero debido a problemas personales decide realizar un viaje fuera del país por lo que no tuvo otra opción de encargarle el negocio a su hija por lo que cuando ella decide volver al país pero su negocio había decaído completamente y trata de comenzar de nuevo con otro negocio que seria la venta de comida que hasta los momentos es la que ha mantenido con firmeza para que no suceda lo que paso con su otro negocio ya que sus clientes son una variedad de personas tanto médicos, enfermeras y empleados de diferentes lugares, el financiamiento es para capital de trabajo que será destinado para la compra de verduras frescas y frutas para la realización de sus refrescos naturales y carne fresca para la elaboración de sus diferentes comidas.
texts.en:
Martha García is 59 years old and is married. Martha has 4 children. Her oldest son is 45 and self-employed, her second son is 38 and self-employed, her 33 year-old daughter is studying the 5th year of secondary school, and her other son is 28 and studying for an Advanced Technical Degree. Her husband does not work due to his advanced age. Her proposal is to expand her business and turn it into a cafeteria where she can offer customers home-style cooking and a la carte meals. She also hopes to have a store so that she can have various incomes to meet the difficult economic situation. In her business she sells meals: breakfast, lunch, and refreshments. She has had this business for 10 years and works at it daily. She started this business with a small table where she sold fruits and vegetables. Then later she decided to put together a store, which she started with only a few items. However because of personal problems she decided to make a trip out of the country, and she had no choice but to leave her daughter in charge of the business. When she decided to return to the country her business had completely declined, and she tried to start over again with another by selling food. This is what she has been committed to until now, so that what happened to her other business does not happen again. She has a variety of customers like doctors, nurses, and employees from different places. The loan is for capital to buy fresh fruits and vegetables to make natural refreshments and fresh meat for making her different meals.

Translated from Spanish by Kelly Wester, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Business capital

loans.name: Munavvarkhon

texts.ru:
Алимова Мунаввархон
Войдя в Центральный рынок города спросите любого кто Мунаввархон. Все ее знают. Уже десять лет занимается продажей зелени : начиная  от укропа, петрушки, чеснока, редиски, щавеля …Кроме того у нее в ассортименте имеется консервированные овощи  фрукты.
 Раньше жила и работала в Канибадаме. После смерти мужа переехала жить в Исфару .Дочерей выдала замуж. Сейчас  живет со своим внуком. Ему 18 лет.
 Покупает свои зелени  в Ходженде (в свои 53 лет она ездить за товаром сама) два раза в неделю. А также друзья поставлять с Коканда (Узбекистан) по более выгодным ценам.
Весною выращивает в своем саду укропы , петрушки , салатные листа.
Признается что конкуренция очень тяжелая  и цены стали повышаться. Она делает все что сделать свой бизнес еще лучше.И  она предлагает скидку на большие заказы  чтоб удержать клиентов .
Уже два года она кредитует свой бизнес и признается что только благодаря Микроинвест она смогла расширить ассортимент товаров. Взяв последней свой займ она купила большую партию банок и овощей чтоб сделать запас на зиму  так как  цены на них  летом ниже.
Она собираеться открыт еще одну торговую точку на следущий свой займ.
texts.en:
Upon arrival in the city's central market, ask anyone about Munavvarhon A.. Everyone knows her. She has sold leafy green vegetables for the past ten years, starting out with dill, parsley, garlic, radishes and sorrel. Her inventory additionally includes canned fruit and vegetables. Munavvarhon previously lived and worked in Kanibadam, but after the death of her husband she moved to Isfara. Her daughters married and she now lives with her 18-year-old grandson. Although she is 53 years old, Munavvarhon herself travels to Khojand twice a week to buy greens. Her friends also supply her with vegetables from Kokand, Uzbekistan at a good price. In the spring Munavvarhon grows dill, parsley and salad greens in her own garden. She recognizes that competition is fierce and prices have begun to rise. She does all she can to improve her business, and offers discounts on bulk orders in order to keep customers. For the past two years Munavvarhon has taken out business loans and she acknowledges that it is thanks to MicroInvest that she was able to expand her range of products. Taking advantage of the low summertime prices, with the last loan she purchased a large quantity of canned goods and vegetables in order to stock up for the winter. She is planning to open an additional retail outlet with her next loan.

Translated from Russian by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Opening of a new retail outlet

loans.name: Gulzar Allah Wasaya Group

texts.en:
Gulzar Baji is a 37-year-old married lady and has resided in a city named Multan, Pakistan for the past 24 years. Her husband's name is A. W. and he has had a dairy business for the past 10 years. He sells milk in the milk shops and in the community as well. Gulzar Baji helps him by milking the buffalo. Presently he has one buffalo at home. Gulzar Baji has three kids: one son and two daughters. All of her kids are getting an education from a school which located near their house. She successfully repaid her first loan from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan). Now she is applying for a loan to buy another buffalo to expand her milk selling business.

She is a group leader of some more women of her locality. Zainab Mai and Manzooran Baji each want a loan to buy buffaloes for their milk selling businesses.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy another buffalo for milk selling business

loans.name: Aquiles Lanao Flores Group

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Aquiles Lanao Flores, inicia su noveno ciclo con 18 socias. 

Las socias realizan diferentes negocios como L. venta helados, CD, DVD, condimentos, ropa, abarrotes en general, tubérculos, libros, medicina natural, cosméticos, brindar servicio D. cosmetología y tejidos D. chompas.

Las socias necesitan diferentes montos D. prestamos como 300 soles, 450 soles, 600soles, 900 soles, haciendo un total D. 11,250 soles D. prestamos en el Banco Comunal. 

Sus prestamos serán invertidos en L. compra helados, lanas D. diferentes colores, DVD, cremas, perfumes, tintes, chompas, pantalones, arroz, azúcar, aceite, papa.

Los sueños D. las socias son tener capital propio, mejorar su negocio, tener casa propia y local estable.
texts.en:
The Community Bank “Aquiles Lanao Flores” begins its 9th loan cycle with 18 members. The members all have different jobs like selling ice cream, selling CDs and DVDs, clothes, groceries, root vegetables, books, natural medicines, cosmetics, sweaters, and offering cosmetology services. Each member is asking for a different loan amount, such as 300 soles, 450 soles, 600 soles or 900 soles. The total loan amount for the group is 11,250 soles. The loan money will be used to buy ice cream, different colored wool, DVDs, lotions, perfumes, makeup, sweaters, pants, rice, sugar, cooking oil and potatoes. The group’s dreams incluD. having their own capital, improving their businesses, owning their own homes and being in a peaceful place.

Translated from Spanish by Rachel Crouch, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy ice cream, wool, DVDs, cosmetics, clothing, food items

loans.name: Tagi

texts.en:
Tagi S., 49, is married with 6 children. She has 2 years of experience in the pop corn/ice cake business. She sells to the villagers 4 days a week. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 400 Tala (~166 USD).

Tagi S. has already received 1 loan from SPBD. SPBD loans are Tagi’s only access to capital because she has never been able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks. Her loan will be used to buy ingredients that are needed to run her business. Some part of her loan will be used to pay for her childrens' school fees.

loans.use: Purchase ingredients and supplies

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.en:
L. Nguyen is a 43 year-old female living in the town of Nghi Lộc.  She is married and has 3 school-aged children.  To earn a living, L. works in a family member's business venture operating a manufacturing business.  While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from manufacturing & selling wood products to local businesses and community members.  L. has been engaged in this business for over 5 years and earns approximately 3000000 VND a month from these activities.


In 2004, L. joined TYM Fund to gain access to financial services to help improve  her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  L. has successfully repaid a previous loan from TYM Fund.  This previous loan was used to invest in renovating the business.  L. is now requesting a new loan of 10000000 VND which will also be used to invest in renovating the business.  The loan will be the 5th loan taken out by the borrower from TYM Fund.  L. plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve/expand the borrower's business.

loans.use: Bussiness

loans.name: María Magdalena

texts.es:
En el Mercado Mayoreo de la ciudad de Managua, la señora María M. se dedica con mucho entusiasmo a su actividad de venta de verduras y frutas y en especial, venta de tamarindo los cuales son ofertados en su establecimiento donde a diario le visitan sus clientes.

Hoy en día ella ha acudido a Ceprodel con el propósito de ser beneficiada con un crédito que le permita la compra de las frutas para continuar con su negocio en el mercado y así abastecer a su familia que tanto requiere de su apoyo.
texts.en:
In Managua's wholesale market, María M. works with considerable enthusiasm selling vegetables and fruits and especially tamarind, which she offers from stall where customers visit daily. Today, she has approached Ceprodel with the aim of being the recipient of a loan which would permit her to purchase fruits in order to continue with her business in the market and in this way supply her family with everything they need her support for.

Translated from Spanish by Katy Long, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fruit and vegetables

loans.name: Aun

texts.en:
Aun H., 29, lives in Banteay Meanchey Province where she has had a medium-sized plot of farmland since she was single. She grows rice and has two crops per year, in both the dry and rainy seasons. She is married and has two children. Both of them are students and still live in the family home. Her husband, Keo Phalla, 32, works as a domestic construction worker around his community.

Because the rainy season is coming, Aun H. needs a loan of US$ 300 to buy seeds and fertilizers to grow crops and to pay to have her farmland plowed. The loan will help to increase the farm's income and sustain her family's needs.

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizers to grow crops

loans.name: Adela

texts.es: Adela tiene 56 años, es madre soltera, vive con su hija y su nieta en su casa propia. Desde hae 6 años vende ropa de segundo uso y abarrotes, esta mercadería la lleva a un puerto fluvial cercano a su casa, donde sus principales consumidores son los agricultores. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es que se siente una mujer útil y se relaciona con muchas personas, además le es muy rentable, ya que sus productos y sus prendas de vestir se venden muy rápido cada día. Posteriormente, Adela quiere mandar a construir un local para establecerse en tienda de ropa y dejar el comercio ambulante. Este es su 3er préstamo con MFP, y le gusta trabajar con su banco comunal porque todos sus compañeros son muy responsables y amables. Con el dinero que solicita comprará más ropa y productos comestibles para incrementar sus ventas.
texts.en:
Adela is 56 years old. She is a single mother and lives with her daughter and granddaughter in a house she owns. She's sold secondhand clothing and groceries for the past six years. She takes this merchandise to a port on the river near her house, where most of her customers are farmworkers. What she likes best about her work is feeling like a useful woman and interacting with a lot of people. It's also quite profitable, and her food products and articles of clothing sell very quickly every day. In the future, Adela would like to build a shop location instead of selling on the street. This is her third loan with MFP, and she likes working with her communal bank because all of her partners are very responsible and friendly. She will use the requested loan to buy more clothing and groceries to increase her sales.

Translated from Spanish by Andrea Rosenberg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase her stock

loans.name: Saydeh

texts.en: Saideh is a 33-year-old single woman living with her parents and her brothers. She is cooperating with her brothers to provide the household expenses. She has owned an accessories shop since 2006. Today, Saideh is requesting to borrow $1,000 to buy merchandise, hoping that her business will develop during the summer.

loans.use: To buy merchandise for her business

loans.name: Đinh Thị

texts.en:
T. Đinh Thị (535030964) is a 33-year-old woman living in the town of Ý Yên.  She is married and has two school-aged children.  To make a living, T. owns & operates a business raising livestock.  While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising cattle for sale.  T. has been engaged in this business for over six years and earns approximately 4100000 VND a month from these activities.


In 2003, T. joined TYM Fund to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  T. has successfully repaid a previous loan of 20000000 VND from TYM Fund.  This previous loan was used to purchase baby livestock to raise & sell in the future.  T. is now requesting a new loan of 20000000 VND, which will be used to invest in expanding the business.  The loan will be the sixth loan taken out by T. from TYM Fund.  T. plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Abdukayum

texts.ru: Кадыров Абдукаюм  является нашим активным клиентом более 3 лет. Он торгует тканью  на рынке. Его сын привозит товар с Урумчи и Каросу.   Также в торговле помогает его жена. Она советует им покупать модные современные материалы. Она знает, какой цвет и какая ткань модна в этом или другом году. Кредит получил на покупки материалов из Каросу. Сейчас сезон свадеб и все покупают и шьют дорогой материал.  Также покупают на приданное дочерей и будущих невест.

loans.use: покупка тканей

loans.name: Inuisa

texts.en: Inuisa is 23 years old, single and dependent. For the past two years he has worked as a taxi driver. He picks up passengers from the local lorry station and takes them to the nearby towns at a transport fare of between ¢45p and ¢50p per head. However, his business is in crisis of late because his car has broken down and he needs money for repairs. Inuisa is therefore requesting a loan to buy a new engine for his taxi so that he can resume his business and make some income. He would be grateful for your assistance.

loans.use: To buy an engine for his taxi

loans.name: Olivia Del Carmen

texts.es: Doña Olivia del Carmen tiene 43 años de edad, reside en el barrio Memorial Sandino en la capital de Managua, tiene dos hijos de 13 y 15 años de edad, estudiantes, su negocio es una abarrotaría que desde nueve años logro poner en el mercado inicio con golosinas, frutas verduras. Sus planes es poder dejar en buenas condiciones a sus hijos. Con este préstamo comprara granos básicos, productos lácteos, frutas, verduras y poder vender más a si como captar clientes nuevos. Da las gracias a la institución por la oportunidad de prosperar en su inventario como en el volumen de ventas lo cual traerá mejores ventas como ganancias.
texts.en:
Olivia del Carmen is 43 years old and she lives in the Memorial Sandino district of the capital city Managua. She has two children, aged 13 and 15, and they are both attending school. She runs a convenience store that she established nine years ago, starting out selling sweets, fruits and vegetables. Her hope is to provide for her children. With this loan she will purchase basic grains, milk products, fruits, vegetables, as well as introduce new products to attract new clients. She is very grateful to the organization for giving her the opportunity to replenish her inventory. More inventory translates into more sales and better earnings.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase basic grains, milk products, fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Maria Maricela

texts.es:
la sra. MARIA MARICELA S. se dedica a la venta de ropa y calzado nuevo, su negocio opera bajo el nombre de Vta. De Ropa y calzado "ESTER".
Doña Maria es madre soltera, tiene 2 hijss, les brinda todos los gastos que ellos necesitan,
actualmente ambas estan estudiando una de ellas se esta graduando de secundaria este año.
su esposo se divorcio de ella, quedandose ella a cargo del hogar, a pesar del problema que tuvo no se acobardo y decidio poner su propio negocio. ella cubre a un 100% los gastos del hogar y brinda la educación a sus hijas.
La Sra. S., es una mujer que lucha por salir adelante, pero en la actualidad no cuenta con 
el capital de trabajo suficiente paras surtir mas su negocio, razón por la cual esta solicitando el credito.

loans.use: compra de jeans, camisas, camisetas, zapatos, botas, tennis, blusas, sillas plasticas

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To increase her stock of produce for resale

loans.name: Everlyn  Jepkemoi

texts.en:
Everlyn is 48 years old and married to Samson, who is a farmer. They have eight children. Her rental housing business is located in Eldoret. The majority of her clients are teachers and businessmen who are not residents of Eldoret, so they rely on Everlyn's rental houses.

She was introduced to KADET by a friend.

With the loan she is taking from KADET she intends to buy more construction materials and also to repair her houses. Her future dreams are to buy land within Eldoret and build residential houses.

About KADET: 
The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is dedicated to economically empower its clients by providing financial services to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Kenya. KADET is the micro-finance subsidiary of World Vision Kenya. Obtain more information on KADET from the website: www.kadet.co.ke

loans.use: To purchase materials for construction of rental houses and to repair existing rental homes.

loans.name: Hadjah Nakakande 's Group

texts.en:
Hadjah is 42 years-old and married with seven children aged between 12 and 22 years. All her children go to school. She resides and owns a four room house where she stays with six people. The family has access to electricity and piped water. Hadjah takes care of additional family members. The family gets three meals a day.

Hadjah has a stall in Kawempe and works seven days a week. She incurs transport costs to and from shopping in Kalerwe market, one of the busiest markets in Uganda. She sells to all categories of people and on average she receives 30 customers a day. Hadjah has been in this business for over four years, with Kiva partner MCDT for eight years and this will be her fourteenth loan. Her monthly expenses include rent for her business premises, school fees for her children and food for the family. Hadjah wants to use this loan to buy more bunches of bananas. She aspires to see her business grow and to begin selling only wholesale.

loans.use: To buy bunches of bananas.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase clothes in bulk

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To additional stock in bulk for her grocery.

loans.name: Félicienne

texts.fr: S. Félicienne est née le 07 Mars 1975 à Ouidah, ville historique du Bénin. Félicienne est mariée à KIKI Gérard, un peintre auto. Le couple a trois enfants qui sont tous scolarisés. La famille vit à Sègbèya, un quartier de Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Le couple supporte ensemble les charges de la famille. Pour faire face à ses besoins et assurer les besoins de ses enfants, Félicienne vend divers produits (pâtes alimentaires, conserves, lait, mayonnaise, riz) et aussi des tissus à son domicile. C'est à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin que Félicienne s'approvisionne. Félicienne a huit ans d'expérience dans ce métier, et est à son troisième crédit à ALIDé. Félicienne a bien remboursé les deux crédits qu'elle avait obtenu de ALIDé. Félicienne rencontre actuellement quelques difficultés financières. Félicienne voudrait augmenter son fonds de roulement et accroître son activité, afin de mieux satisfaire ses clients. C'est la raison pour laquelle Félicienne sollicite un troisième crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
S. Félicienne was born on March 7, 1975 in Ouidah, a historic village in Benin.  She is married to KIKI Gérard, an automobile painter.  The couple has three children who are all in school.  The family lives in Sègbèya, a district in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin.  The couple provides for the family jointly.  To address her needs and to ensure that her children's needs are met, she sells a variety of goods (pasta, canned foods, milk, mayonnaise, rice) and also cloth, out of her home.  Dantokpa, the international market of Benin, is where she stocks up.  Félicienne has eight years of experience in this trade and is now on her third ALIDé loan.  She repaid the two loans she had obtained from ALIDé.  Right now, she is meeting with a few financial difficulties.  She would like to increase her working capital and to grow her business, so as to satisfy her customers better.  For these reasons, she's requesting a third loan from ALIDé.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying canned foods, mayonnaise, and sacks of rice

loans.name: Va

texts.en: Va N. is 33 years-old and resides with her husband and four of her children in Siem Reap province. She is a rice farmer and also sells cake at the local market for a profit of US$2 per day.  Her husband, pictured here, makes rice wine and raises pigs. He typically makes about US$5 profit per day. Va N. is asking for a loan of US $1000 to make two investments. She will purchase rice and remove the husks in order to resell it and make a profit and also purchase more pigs to raise.

loans.use: To purchase rice and pigs.

loans.name: Fortunata

texts.en:
Fortunata Y. is a married woman who supports her family by operating a food-vending business, selling frozen foods and running a general store. She lives in Bollos St., Brgy Boyco, Bayawan City, Negros Oriental, with her husband and their school-aged child.
Fortunata has been a member of Kiva partner, NWTF-Project Dungganon, since 1996. She has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her various businesses, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of 3,800 PHP.
Fortunata Y. is now borrowing 12,000 PHP to expand into other areas of food vending, including selling barbecue (also known as inalsal). This will be her sixteenth loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of 10,000 PHP was paid off well within its term, and was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Fortunata Y. aspires to improve her family’s living conditions and ensure its future wellbeing.

About NWTF
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means 'honorable'). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon – a title of esteem that is bestowed on a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: To expand into other areas of food vending

loans.name: Chrissa Faith

texts.en:
Chrissa Faith M. is from the village of Guba Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 36 years old. Chrissa Faith is married and has four small children. To make a living, Chrissa Faith owns and operates a motor transport service. Chrissa Faith has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 10,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) a month.

In 2008, Chrissa Faith joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Chrissa Faith has successfully repaid a previous loan of 20,000 PHP from GDMPC. Chrissa Faith is requesting a new loan of 5,653 PHP, which will be used to repair the engines of vehicles she owns. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Chrissa Faith from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:
GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk, and small entrepreneurs.

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To repair engines for vehicles used in her motor transport business.

loans.name: Nidia Sabina

texts.es: Nidia Sabina es una mujer muy trabajadora, pues todos los días labora en su vivienda. Porque es aquí donde está ubicado su establecimiento que es una pulpería. Ella inicio este negocio porque anteriormente su Papa se dedica a atender la pulpería con el paso del tiempo el fallece y le hereda la pulpería, pues él no quería que todo el esfuerzo que había realizado se derrumbara fue así que Nidia empezó a hacerse cargo de este medio de vida. Ella tiene 1 hijo de 18 años que está a su cargo pues ella se preocupa en proporcionarle lo necesario. El financiamiento que solicita es para la compra de golosinas, refrescos naturales, jugos, pan, galletas, detergentes entre otras cosas. Ella sueña con establecer una tienda de mercadería en general.
texts.en:
Nidia Sabina is a very assiduous woman who works from home, where her general store is located. She got into this business because her father used to own it and after he passed away, she inherited the store because he did not want all his efforts to go to waste. This was how Nidia took charge of the business. She has an 18-year-old son who is under her care, so she is concerned with giving him the necessities. The loan that she is requesting will be used to purchase candy, juice, other beverages, bread, cookies, and detergent, among other goods. She dreams of launching her own store.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Yan

texts.en:
Mrs. Yan C., shown in the photo, is a widow with six children: two sons and four daughters. One of her children is married and lives in a separate home, one is a fisherman, and another one attends school. The other three have full time employment in Phnom Penh. The family lives on an island on the Mekong River about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Yan has been a silk weaver since 1983. She sells her finished products to a middleman who takes them to sell in the Phnom Penh market. She is requesting a loan of $500 to purchase silk materials to continue her weaving business.

loans.use: To purchase silk materials to continue her weaving business

loans.name: Lillian

texts.en:
Lillian is the single mother of two children aged 14 and 16 years. She is 35 years old and lives in a family home with her children. She is the head of her family with the responsibility of looking after her children.

Lillian operates a secondhand clothing business in Hoima, Uganda, and has been in the business for six years now. She first worked in a hotel (restaurant) as a waitress, after which she started selling clothing with the little capital she had. She dreams of educating her children and constructing her own residential home so as to shift from the family house.

Lillian’s clothing business was recently burned in a fire outbreak, that being the major hardship she has faced so far in her business. The loan funds are for purchasing clothes to sell at her stall in the market.

loans.use: To purchase more used clothes to sell

loans.name: Saroun

texts.en:
Mr. Saroun L., 38, lives in Lvea Sar Kraom village in Kandal Province where he is a teacher in the local school. His wife, Mrs. Sokhoeurn Chou, is a vegetable and fruit seller in the local market who earns some money to help support her family. Since his wife’s business is doing well, Saroun is requesting a loan to buy more mangoes for re-selling and a trailer to transport them to market.

Saroun is the father of four children, one an NGO employee, another a farmer, and the others students in local public school. His wife is on the right in the photo.

loans.use: To buy more mangoes and a trailer

loans.name: Necifora

texts.en: Necifora R. is from the village of Pandan, Gingoog City. She is 49 years old, is married, and has three school-aged children. Necifora owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling both food and daily-use products in the local community. She has been engaged in her sari-sari store business for over a year and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month. In 2009, Necifora joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to invest in expanding her business. Necifora is requesting a new loan of 11,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her 4th from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support her children’s education. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Mujeres Luchadoras Group

texts.es:
El presente comité se encuentra, en su Sexto ciclo y todas las integrantes se encuentran satisfechas con el trabajo que cada una realiza.
Una de las integrantes es la  Sra. Ramona M. tiene 50 años con  2 hijas  señorita, una de ellas también participa del comité.
La Sra.  Ramona se dedica a dos actividades una de ellas es la venta de ropas de segunda mano y la otra es la  confección y venta de lencería.
La ropas las ofrece en su salón de ventas y  las  confecciona de lencería   vende los  fines de semana visitando locales comerciales con su hija.
 Es una señora muy guapa y le gusta lo que hace y agradece por el apoyo que le brinda la Fundación por el crédito que se le otorga.
Solicita el préstamo para la compra de fardos de ropas de segunda mano.
En el futuro desea ampliar su salón  para su taller de costura, por ende ella pone mucho empeño en su trabajo y dice que si uno procura por sus metas se puede lograr el objetivo .
texts.en:
The “Mujeres Luchadoras” (“Fighting Women”) group is in its sixth loan cycle and all of its members are satisfied with each other's work. One of the group's members is Ramona M.. Ramona is 50 years old and has two daughters, one of whom is also in the group. Ramona has two businesses. She sells used clothing from her shop, and she makes lingerie which she and her daughter sell on the weekends by visiting local businesses. Ramona is a very beautiful woman and she likes what she does. She is grateful for the support of the loans she has received from Fundación Paraguaya. She will use this loan to purchase bundles of used clothing. In the future, she would like to expand her shop and sewing studio, and so she puts a lot of effort into her work. She says that if you work hard you can achieve your goals.

Translated from Spanish by Kris Vickery, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of bundles of used clothing

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
Marilou C. is from the village of San Isidro, Baggao, Cagayan. She is 47 years old. Marilou is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Marilou owns and operates a business providing transportation services. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from operating jeepney transport services. Marilou has been engaged in her business for over 15 years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2005, Marilou joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Marilou has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from ASKI. Marilou is requesting a new loan of 12,000 PHP, which will be used to repair the engine of her jeepney. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Marilou from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of her children.

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk, and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva.

loans.use: To repair the engine of her jeepney.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: For plowing the field, hoeing and the purchase of fertilizer

loans.name: Enerika

texts.en: Enerika S. is currently in the business of selling local Sudanese food in her restaurant and is requesting a loan to stock ful beans (fava beans), a local Sudanese type of bean, to cook and sell. Enerika is 50 years old and is married to a retired soldier. She has seven children and four of her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to extend the floor of her restaurant. About BRAC BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To stock ful beans, a local Sudanese type of bean, to cook and sell

loans.name: Heydi Del Socorro

texts.es: Heydi Del Socorro tiene 31 años, su actividad es brindar el servicio en un cyber. Hace más de 15 años que tiene este negocio, por lo que siempre está pensando en mejorar para el bienestar de su familia, ella siempre ha sido una madre muy responsable y disfruta de su negocio, por lo que tiene 1 hijo menor de edad que tiene que hacerse cargo. Para en el futuro ella desea incrementar su negocio, estableciendo nuevas computadoras para sus clientes. El financiamiento que solicita es para la compra de computadoras, teclados y accesorios para computadora.
texts.en:
Heydi Del Socorro is 31 years old and offers Internet services at her cybercafé. She has been in business for more than 15 years and is always thinking about making improvements for the welfare of her family. Heydi has always been a very responsible mother who enjoys running her business. She has a young child who is under her care.

In the future, she wants to expand her business by setting up new computers for her customers. The loan she is requesting will be used to buy computers, keyboards, and computer accessories.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase computers, keyboards, and accessories

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Puchase a stereo

loans.name: Vorn

texts.en: Mrs. Vorn S., 53, is married to Ou Chorn, 52, and the couple earn a living by cultivating crops. They currently have six children, two of whom are married and live separately, while the other four are single. In addition to their farming work, Vorn S. produces cakes to sell to her nearby villagers, who eat them as a snack food. The coming rainy season is good for growing. However, Vorn S. doesn’t have any farming supplies to use on her field. Thus, she has asked for a loan to use towards buying fertilizer, insecticide and crop seed for planting.

loans.use: To use towards buying fertilizer, insecticide and crop seed for planting

loans.name: Umedjon

texts.en:
F. Umedjon is 33 years old, married, and has three children. All of his life he has devoted to agricultural work, and on market days he brings his products to the market. For Umedjon the harvest is what he enjoys the most and he devotes a lot of time to sorting wheat, onions, watermelon and rice. 

Agriculture is full of satisfaction for him and his family, even more when they sell for a good price at the market. That is the motivation to continue planting. At the same time Umedjon raises cattle. 

This is the 9th loan that Umedjon has with IMON International, making his payments on time. He is very grateful to those who support him, because they allow him to provide well-being to his family. With the money requested, Umedjon will buy seeds, fertilizer, fuels and lubricants, and also cattle.       

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need.

To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing seed, fertilizer, fuels and lubricants, cattle

loans.name: Sok

texts.en: Sok M., 46, is a professional silk weaver, making US$ 2 each day in Takeo province. She is married and has four children living at home to support. Her husband makes approximately US$ 5 every day, selling furniture. Sok M. would like a loan of US$ 1000 to purchase more furniture for resale.

loans.use: purchase furniture to resell

loans.name: Sèbessé Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Sèbessé est composé de quatre célibataires sans enfant vivant toutes dans des grandes familles traditionnelles. Elles ont en moyenne 20 ans. Elles habitent le quartier Médine Ségou (4ème Région administrative du Mali) et se sont connues à travers leurs activités génératrices de revenus dans le marché Médine de Ségou. 
Les membres du groupe font l’achat et la vente du savon, riz, fruits, tubercules et légumes (concombre, patate, igname, banane et pomme de terre). 
Dans le but de diversifier les marchandises à vendre, les membres du groupe ont décidé d’adhérer au programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 5ème prêt solidaire.
 Mademoiselle Djènèbou  S. compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter, 20 cartons de savon au grand marché de Ségou en gros. Elle revend au comptant et à crédit à domicile, en ambulant dans les quartiers et au marché de Médine Ségou en détail à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Mademoiselle Djènèbou  S. espère réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 25 000FCFA qui sera utilisé pour épargner, s’entretenir et constituer petit à petit son trousseau de mariage. Tout comme les autres membres du groupe, elle a pour objectif d’augmenter le volume de son petit commerce dans cette relation avec Soro Yiriwaso.
texts.en:
The Sèbessé group is made up of four single and childless women, who all live in large traditional families. They average 20 years of age. They live in the Médine district of Ségou (Mali's fourth administrative region) and met each other through their income generating activities at the Médine market in Ségou.

The members of this group buy and sell soap, rice, fruit, tubers and vegetables (cucumber, yams, bananas and potatoes). In order to diversify the goods that they sell they decided to join Soro Yiriwaso's loan program and are on their fifth group loan.

Miss Djènèbou S. is planning on using her loan to buy 20 cartons of soap wholesale at the market in Ségou. She resells on a retail basis for cash and on credit, walking through the various districts and at the Médine Ségou market, to a customer base made up of men and women. 

With this loan, Miss S. is hoping to make an average monthly profit of 25,000FCFA, which will be used to save, to look after herself and to build up her marriage trousseau. In common with the other members of the group, her goal is to increase her business volume through her relationship with Soro Yiriwaso.

loans.use: To buy soap

loans.name: Jose De Jesus

texts.es: El señor Jose de Jesus M. D., es un adulto mayor, de 61 años que habita acompañado por su pareja de vida, tienen 2 hijos mayores de edad, que sobreviven independientemente, ellos son agricultores desde hace 21 años, los cuales se han enfrentado a plagas y sequia que desfavorecen las cosechas y afectan a su economía, a futuro espera contar con el capital necesario para diversificar sus cultivos, por ahora solicita un préstamo para la compra de insumos vegetativos, fertilizantes y fungicidas, que permitan una mantenimiento fitosanitario en apoyo a sus terrenos, y de esta forma a corto plazo recuperar lo invertido, y la mejora continua de sus niveles de vida y la de su pequeña familia. Ellos son una humilde pareja que no cuenta con el apoyo de sus hijos, por la limitación de trabajo que no les permite apoyar a sus padres. esta no es la primera vez que se apoya a esta familia, ellos son muy responsables y se sus condiciones economicas han mejorado para bien estos ultimos años
texts.en: Mr. Jose de Jesus M. D., is an adult of 61 years old who lives with his life partner. They have 2 grown children who live on their own. They have worked in agriculture for 21 years, and have faced plagues and drought that work against the harvest and affect them financially. In the future he hopes to have the capital necessary to diversify his crops. For now his is requesting a loan to buy fertilizers, fungicides and agricultural supplies that will allow him to maintain the health of his plants and help his lands. In this way he hopes to recover the investment in a short time and continue improving their living standards and that of his small family. They are a humble pair that don't have the help of their children due to work constraints that don't allow them to help their parents. This is not the first time that we have helped this family. They are very responsible and already their economic conditions have improved these last couple years.

loans.use: To maintain plant health.

loans.name: Alfonso

texts.es:
Alfonso Y. T. tiene 36 años. Es casado vive con la esposa y los hijos, vive  en el cantón de Guaranda en la Provincia de Bolívar. Tiene 5 hijos.

Alfonso pertenece a la Ventanilla Casaiche Chilipamba ubicada a media hora de Guaranda perteneciente, es un grupo que se dedica a la agricultura y a la ganadería como vacas lecheras y chanchos, esta ventanilla tiene 20 miembros.

Alfonso se dedica a la agricultura de maíz, trigo fréjol y papa y a la ganadería cría vacas lecheras, las comprar las realiza en Guaranda y vende en el mercado mayorista de la  misma ciudad.

Solicita el crédito para la compra de insumos para la siembra maíz, trigo fréjol y papa y animales para engordar y después vender. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades de la familia. Su sueño es ponerse comprar casa y comprar terrenos.
Le gustaría que el crédito sea el monto más alto.
texts.en:
Alfonso Y. T. is 36 years old. He is married an lives with his wife and children. He lives in the Guaranda canton in the province of Bolívar. He has 5 children. 

Alfonso belongs to the Casaiche Chilipamba bank, located a half an hour from Guaranda. It is a group that is dedicated to agriculture and dairy cattle and pigs. This bank has 20 members. 

Alfonso grow corn, wheat, potatoes and raises dairy cows. He makes his purchases in Guaranda and sells in the wholesale market of the same city.  

He is asking for the loan to buy materials to plant corn, wheat, beans and potatoes as well as animals to fatten up and later sell. The support of this loan will help him financially to meet his family's needs.  His dream is to be able to buy a house and land. He would like the loan to be the highest amount.

loans.use: Materials to plant corn, wheat, beans and potatoes, as well as animals.

loans.name: Francisco Filadelfo

texts.es: Francisco Filadelfo tiene 23 años, su actividad es la venta de mercadería en general. Hace más de 12 años que se dedica a este medio de vida, el es un hombre muy trabajador, tiene 1 hijo menor de edad a su cargo que vive con esposa pues el sale a vender todos los días desde las 5 de la mañana hasta las 10 de la noche, pues tiene ciertos clientes que visitar ya que siempre le están solicitando diferentes productos y el busca la manera de cómo complacerlos. Este financiamiento es para la compra de materia prima como ropa, cosmeticos y calzado necesaria ya que se acerca una buena temporada.
texts.en:
Francisco Filadelfo, 23, sells general merchandise.  He’s had this means of support for 12 years.  He is a very hard working man and has a minor son in his care that lives with his wife because he goes out to sell every day from 5am until 10pm; he has customers to see who are always asking for different products and he seeks ways to satisfy them.

This loan will be used to buy needed merchandise like clothes, cosmetics and footwear because a good season is approaching.

loans.use: To buy clothing, cosmetics and footwear.

loans.name: Kitinda Traders Group

texts.en: Kandi N. is a member of the Kitinda Traders group. He is 40 years old, married, and has 14 children.  Kandi has a retail shop business where he sells posho, sugar, soap, and more for a profit. He has been in the business for 20 years and he acquired his start-up capital from agriculture after advice from a friend.
